loans.name: Albertina Januario

texts.pt:
Albertina Januário Fernando P. nasceu na cidade de Chokwe Província de Gaza, tem 29 anos de idade, frequenta 10 classe. Neste momento casada e com 2 filhos de 4 e 2 anos de idade, vive ainda com uma sobrinha de 9 anos que vai a escola enquanto outros frequentam escolinha. Para alem destes não sustenta mais ninguém, os seus parentes geram o seu próprio rendimento.

 Deslocou se para Boane no ano de 2001 saindo de Chokwe, e em 2005 devido a transferência do marido juntos se deslocam ate Ponta Douro, onde em 2008 casa se oficialmente. Reside actualmente em Boane embora o marido continuando na Ponta Douro trabalhando como técnico agrónomo da Quinta Ouro.
 
Desenvolve o seu negócio permanentemente na Ponta Douro, onde aprendeu esta actividade desde o ano de 2005 e tem 2 empregados. Quando aplica 10.000.00 mt na aquisição, consegue 15.000.00 na venda, o que lhe faz render cerca de 10.000.00 por mes e consegue poupar algum para no final de mes. O marido tem também ajuda nas despesas, de momento vive em casa própria.
 
Nunca teve outros empréstimos em outras instituições e este é o seu quinto empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00mt para compra de material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia e outros). Os outros empréstimos foram para a mesma actividade nos valores de 5.000,00mt;17.000,00mt duas vezes de 6.000,00mt.
Para o futuro pretende abrir um armazém de venda de ração, assim após a conclusão deste pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para fortificar o negócio.
texts.en:
Albertina Januário Fernando P. was born in the city of Chokwe, Gaza province, in Mozambique. She is 29 years old and is enrolled in 10th grade. She is married and lives with her two children aged 4 and 2, and a 9 year old niece, who also attends school. Besides the kids, she doesn't support anyone else. Her husband lives in a different city because of his work as an agronomist for the company Quinta Ouro. Albertina has a business and she makes around 10.000,00MT (U$375) per month. Her husband also helps with the household expenses, so they are able to save some money every month. This is going to be her 5th loan in the amount of U$375 to buy construction supplies (rocks, cement, sand, and others). The other loans were made for the same purpose. She dreams of opening her own animal feed mixer store, and improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (sand, rock, cement, others)

loans.name: Tètevi Senawobgé

texts.fr: Cet homme vend uniquement des pneus d’automobile dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; il a débuté cette activité depuis 1994 et a donc une vie professionnelle assez remplie en expériences. Il commande ses pneus du Nigéria à bon prix ; il exerce également le métier de vulcanisation de pneus dans son atelier de mécanique générale, et a même recruté des mécaniciens de voiture pour l’aider dans sa tâches Il a un besoin urgent en ce moment de lancer une nouvelle commande ; c’est pour cela qu’il compte sur un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pneus Opel et Bus. Il est marié et a à sa charge 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A.’s business is selling auto tires in the Adakpamé neighborhood of Lomé. He begin his trade in 1994, so he has considerable professional experience. He purchases tires at a low price in Nigeria. He also repairs tires in his mechanic shop; he even employs auto mechanics to help him in his business. Currently he has an urgent need to place an order for Opel and Bus tires. This is why he has requested a loan from WAGES. Mr. A. is married with two children.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work supplies and equipment

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a 36 year old father to one school going boy. He operates his stationery business as well as building contracts in Nairobi. He is requesting for a first loan of Kes. 50,000 to purchase a computer and add stock of stationery. He hopes to grow his business into a big company that will create employment. He describes himself as creative and innovative.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock & buy a computer

loans.name: Jude

texts.en:
Jude is a 35 year old father to two who operates his boda boda (motor bike taxi) business in Nairobi. He has run this business for one year on a hired motorbike after employment as a rider. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 74,000 to purchase his own motorbike. He hopes that he will buy a plot and build a home for his family one day. He also plans to enlarge his business and own three motor bikes and a vehicle for taxi. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James U. is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years old. He lives in Rubavu district, West Province, Rwanda. He employs one person in his business and operates every day from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m..

James has been in the business of selling goats for three years. Before that he was doing agriculture activities and could not afford enough food for his children.

With this new loan, James will purchase more goats and, with the profits he hopes to earn, James will be able to continue paying school fees for his children and expand his business by purchasing more goats. He also hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is from the village of Bunawan. She is 46 years old. Nenita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Nenita is just starting this business 8 yrs. ago.

In 2000, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 20th loan taken out by Nenita from PMPC. Nenita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family

loans.use: Additional grocery items

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 46 year old black smith who lives and operates his business in Machakos, Kenya. He previously sold shoes  before beginning this business thirty years ago. He is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to enable him add stock of raw materials. He hopes to diversify into farming through irrigation in order to uplift his living standards. He hopes to dig a borehole for irrigation soon. He describes himself as hardworking.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of raw materials

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Sepac. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three adult-aged children.

Erlinda owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2004, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie L. is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and is married with two school aged-children.

Elvie owns and operates a sari-sari store business (general store) selling a variety of products to her neighbors and passers-by. She has been engaged in this business for almost three years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month.

In April 2007, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC with a good record of repayment.

Elvie is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

Cynthia owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Our Father 2 Group

texts.en:
Kular G. is 46 years old and married with three children between the ages of five and eleven. They attend school in 1st through 8th grades. Kular is illiterate due to poverty. 

She buys rice wholesale and takes it to rural areas to sell it at a retail price. Kular has been running this business for fifteen years, and it is the income from this business that makes it possible for her to take care of her family. She has good relationships with her customers, and that's why her business is successful.

This loan is needed to buy more rice wholesale in order to make more profits that can expand her business. Kular dreams of having a rice store of her own that she can manage well in order to build a house, educate her children, and give them good medical care.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Mrs. Julia S. is 51 years old and married to Romeo S., Sr. They live in Barangay III, Tangub City. She is blessed with eleven children but only four of them live with her because the rest have their own families. For their income, her husband drives their own bicycle with a sidecar, locally known as “trisikad”, with an average income of not less than $3 a day.

On a little parcel of land at Hoyohoy, Tangub City, they cultivated and planted abaca and vegetables from which they earned an average net income of not less than $110 a month. As a fourth-cycle loaner in our coop under the PDP-LP Program, Julia is applying for a loan of Php 3,000 to finance her mini-abaca plantation in the highlands of Tangub City. She is hoping that someday her agri-business will prosper so that she can purchase additional parcel of lands for their abaca culture and production.

loans.use: Cultivation of mini abaca plantation

loans.name: Arsinia

texts.en:
Arsinia C. is from the village of Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Arsinia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Arsinia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Arsinia has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 1,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arsinia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsinia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Arsinia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Arsinia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne U. was born in 1979, married with two children first child is 3 years old the last child is  2 years old..
She has an experience of five years in shoping where she sells differents kind of products such as :rice ,cooking oil, sugar,beens,soaps  etc
She opens her small shop everyday from 6h00 AM to 8h00 PM. 

Evelyne is requesting this new loan from vision  finance company in order to earn more profit than before ,through purchasing more products  for sales

loans.use: purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Believe In Allah Group

texts.en:
Believe in Allah is a group of 5 borrowers led by Dabah D.. Dabah is married with 6 children aged one to 20 years old, whose educational levels are from first grade to first year in college. Dabah is illiterate due to the fact that during the early 1960s, Muslims parents didn't usually send their girl children to school.

Dabah's business is in buying charcoal wholesale and selling in retail to the residents of River View community, Northern Monrovia, Liberia. This community is isolated and poor. She has been running this business for 25 years and is grateful to the business for being there for her and her family.
The rainy season is the only obstacle to Dabah's business, because when it is wet, it can be very hard to produce charcoal. With her good relations with customers, her business has been doing well.

She is hoping to expand her business in order to build a house for her and her family. Dabah needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand business.

loans.use: Dabah needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

texts.en:
Marie Louise R. B. is 29, single, and she takes care of two children aged between 7 and 13. She lives in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has operated her business since 2000. She opens her store every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Before starting this clothes business, she was a full-time housewife and could not provide all the needs of her family.

With this new loan requested from Vision Finance Company, she hopes to earn more profit which will help her to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marie Aimee

texts.en:
Marie Aimee U. N. operates a retail business selling new clothes.  She started this business in 2004. Aimee employs one person. The business hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m daily. Before starting her clothing business she was a full-time housewife.

Marie Aimee is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 12.She lives in Kimironko, an area of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

With the loan requested by Aimee, she plans to expand her business through purchasing more variety of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: clothing inventory

loans.name: Faidha

texts.en: Faidha K. is a married woman in Tanzania who started a business as an entrepreneur. She raises poultry at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. She keeps both broilers and layers in her poultry cages. For the layers, it takes almost five months to get the first lay out, but broilers can be sold after only three months. Income derived from selling broilers is used to buy layers, feed, and to pay medical expenses. Faidha collects six trays of eggs daily from her poultry cages and sells to both retail and wholesale customers. She plans to expand her business by constructing more poultry cages and increasing the number of layers. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To construct poultry cages and buy more layers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice U. is 28 years old ,single and she takes care of one person
She lives in Nyarugenge district,Kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
She has an experience of two years in business of clothes  and employs one person in her business;starting everyday from 6h00 AM to 5h00 PM.

Before this business she was not able to get all needs in her life.
With this  loan requested in Vision Finance Company she plans to expand her business and save the money  in order to change her life forever.

loans.use: Clothes sales

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl is the leader of this group. Her divorce has made her a stronger woman and a better mother. She is doing her best to provide for her only son, a school student. As a divorced woman she receives child compensation in amount of four and half dollars a month from the government. So Janyl cannot depend on or ask help from anybody. Now she has to rely on herself.

Even though she is forty-three years old, her age has not prevented her from making a major change in her life. About two months ago a friend of hers went to trade in another market and left her stall to Janyl. Janyl, who had never done trading before, gave up her former occupation and decided to take a risk. She invested all her money, $700, in women’s clothing and started selling. Very soon the sales started to go well, and she has been able to increase her turnover up to $535. Now she is making $200 a month.

Her son also helps her run the stall after school. Janyl is teaching him some basic lessons of survival, giving him a chance to earn his own pocket money. Janyl has applied for this loan to purchase more goods, mainly women's seasonal clothes. She is eager to work hard and increase the turnover. She wants to buy a more profitable spot for the stall. These are Janyl’s partners: Aftandil, Jumabubu and Jyrgalbubu. Aftandil, 31, has two daughters. Aftandil’s relative has suggested that she set up in business. This relative trades in bedclothes. So Aftandil has decided to obtain this loan and purchase bedclothes for resale. Jumabubu, 48, is divorced and has one son. Her husband is temporarily unemployed, so Jumabubu supports her family by selling foodstuffs. She needs a loan to purchase goods, mainly foodstuffs. Jyrgalbubu, 45, is a widow and has one thirteen-year-old daughter. Jyrgalbubu is engaged in sewing. She makes traditional articles and takes them in to some shops. She needs a loan to purchase fabric at “Madina” market, since fabric is cheaper there. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy clothing for the fall trade

loans.name: Cartas

texts.en:
Cartas M. was born in 1969,married with two children aged between 6 and 8.
She lives in Nyarugenge district, Kigali province capital of Rwanda .
Cartas owns a small shop of loin clothes since 2003 and employs one person in her business.

Before doing this business she was fultime house wife and she could not get all needs for her family.
With this new loan requested in vision finance company ,she plans to purchase more loinclothes in order to earn more profit so that she will be able to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: Clothes sale

loans.name: La Simpatia 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Teresa B. (far right in photo) is an entrepreneur who lives in Bayaguana, Dominican Republic. Bayaguana is a large town about 40 miles northeast of Santo Domingo. Despite its size, Bayaguana is a prisoner to its location in the interior of the country. It lacks reliable electricity and has no potable water and is somewhat difficult to reach even by truck.

Teresa is the coordinator for the solidarity group called La Simpatia (Charm), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. She is 60 years old and has three grown children. Teresa has a small general store from which she sells food to her neighbors. She focuses on the staples of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, oil, and flour. With this loan, Teresa hopes to expand her business to include some basic interior decorations to sell, such as curtains and shades. This will make her business more attractive than thO. just offering food.

Teresa hopes that with her profits she can make repairs to her home so that life is a little more comfortable. This is Teresa’s sixth loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record over the three years of thO. loans. Thank you for lending to Teresa and La Simpatia group!

loans.use: To buy curtains and shades to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a young man who is married with two children, aged 2 and 4 years old. He needs the loan to pay his wife’s university tuition in addition to purchasing some necessary items for his house.

Anwar is an employee with the Palestinian National Authority, his wife plans to get her degree from the university in order to be more educated and help her husband.

loans.use: To pay his wife's university tuition

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, the leader of this group, used to work as a schoolteacher. Her teacher’s salary was far less than sufficient, even for basic survival. She believed that there had to be another way of life, a more deserving one. Gulnara made a choice toward improving her life even though she knew that it would require some sacrifice.

Seven years ago she convinced her husband to sell their car. She invested the proceeds, about $1050, into setting up a business. She started trading in foodstuffs (candies, biscuits, canned food and cereals) in her own stall at a city market. Her family's quality of life has indeed improved. She is making $350 a month, which is one-third of the car’s selling price. Besides being able to pay for their children’s education, they have been able to buy a car, to open another shop near their house, and to put a refrigerator, a freezer and a rack in the shop .

Gulnara has three children. Her husband still works at the school. Her son, 19, works as an electrician. Another son goes to a law school. Their daughter, 14, goes to school, and after school she substitutes for her mother.

Gulnara wants to obtain a loan to purchase cereals, candies and vegetable oil, and to buy some winter clothes for winter trade. She is making plans about expanding her shop and making changes to attract more customers. Gulnara’s partners are: Gulnura, Shaiymkul, Anarkan and Gulnara. Gulnura, 36, has two children. Her husband is a welder and Gulnura helps him support the family by selling milk. Gulnura needs a loan to purchase two sheep and a calf and to put up new gates. Shaiymkul, 58, is a farmer’s wife. They have three children. Shaiymkul keeps some cattle and sells milk. Shaiymkul hopes to obtain a loan and buy a calf and with the rest of the loan harvest the clover. Anarkan, 46, has four children. She is a housewife and sells milk. Anarkan needs a loan to buy a calf. Gulnara, 46, has two children. Currently she is busy harvesting crops: clover, corn, pumpkin and sugar beets. She needs a loan to buy a calf. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, candies and vegetable oil and buy some winter clothes for winter trade

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
Casimira es artesana confecciona mantas de vicuña y alpaca mismo que son comercializados en distintas feria populares de la Ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su gastos personales, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la Zona San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (lana), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por casimira.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo de ocupación pequeño agricultor y productor lechero mismo que lo comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa es su principal apoyo en el trabajo que desempeña en el campo y también comercializa papa y chuño lo vende en distintos mercados de El Alto tiene 3 hijos 2 en colegio y 1 en la Universidad, viven en casa propia ubicado en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Guillermo.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE INVERSION

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
Rosa, a fifty–year old divorced mother of four children, is the leader. Her eldest son, 31, lives in another town and her daughter, 29, is married and lives separately as well. Another son, 26, is married and lives with his family. Only her youngest son, 20, is still single and lives with her. To earn her daily bread, Rosa occupies herself with cattle breeding. She manages to make some extra money from selling milk and also works part time as a guard. From time to time she produces cottage cheese and sour cream and also sells it to local villagers. Rosa brought up her children doing this same job, and continues to work hard even though her children are now able to support themselves. Rosa’s total earnings amount to 70 US dollars. It is the way of life she has gotten used to, including receiving enjoyment from breeding cattle. Now, Rosa needs a loan to buy a calf for breeding. She is already awaiting grandchildren and making arrangements to marry her youngest son.

Rosa’s partners are: Erkinbek, Elmira and Venera. Erkinbek, 55, is a father of five children. All his children are grown-up and earn their living themselves. He works as a security guard at a car station and raises livestock. Erkinbek wants to increase the total population of his cattle and hopes that by obtaining a loan he will be able to buy several sheep.

Elmira, 54, has mothered four children. She is a widow. To make a living she is engaged in poultry farming. Her son, 29, works as a car maintainer and another son does odd jobs at a brick producing factory. Her daughter has recently gotten married. Her youngest son is a senior at high school. Elmira needs a loan to prepare her daughter’s dowry.

Venera, 34, is married. She has two children. Her husband works as a shepherd. Venera is a housewife. She manages to earn a little money selling milk. Their total monthly income is around $105. Venera wants to obtain a loan to buy another cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for breeding and then to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia U. is 28 years old, single, and she takes care of three persons aged between 24 and 17. She lives in Kigali, capital of Rwanda, where she owns a small shop of products.

Leatitia has experience of two years in this business. She opens her shop everyday from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Before running this business Leatitia could not provide all the needs of her family but now, through the loan requested from Vision Finance Company, she believes she will earn more profit. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a young man who is married with four children. He is responsible for his wife and children in addition to his parents and his business is the only source of income for the whole family.

In addition to filming weddings and parties and his photo shop, he sells cellphones and accessories, video games, video tapes, picture frames, batteries, etc.

Murad appears in the picture at his business. He needs this loan to buy new equipment for his business such as cameras, mixers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase new cameras and mobile phones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es comerciante por mayor de vasos de cristal donde vende en los locales de eventos sociales, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su Madre en casa alquilada ubicada en El Alto zona Villa Bolívar ‘D’, su Madre trabaja en 
el Magisterio,  

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Mercadería,  aumentando su stock en cristalería  para la venta en diferentes locales de eventos sociales y así poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el primer crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Lourdes.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Kerezbu's Group

texts.en:
Kerezbu, a fifty–seven year old widow, is the leader of this group. Several years ago, Kerezbu left for Russia as a migrant worker. Hard work and determination helped her save her earnings and upon returning home, she started her own business. She is a mother to and has raised four children. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her elder son is still working in Russia. Her middle son does odd jobs at the local market and her little daughter, 26, helps her in the business. Some people believe that the active part of your life ends once your children become grown–ups, and you can quietly meet an old age and have rest. That’s not the case with Kerezbu. Moreover, having received Kerezbu’s upbringing, her children know that there is no free cheese in this world. Kerezbu has preferred to be active and not depend on them. Instead, she is a great example of a strong independent woman. Kerezbu’s business is trade in women’s underwear, night gowns, pajamas and T–shirts. From her earnings, she invested around $715 to purchase goods. Now her current monthly income is $120. Her Russian experience is helping her to survive and be competitive. Kerezbu needs a loan to purchase goods for fall and winter seasons and increase her range of goods. Her immediate plans are to save money to buy a car for her middle son and marry her little daughter.

Kerezbu’s partners: Aida, Asel and Uulkan. Aida, 36, has three children. She plans to start her own business of running a shop. She hopes to obtain a loan as she wants to purchase foodstuffs, drinks, cereals and sugar.

Asel, 26, has one child. Together with her husband, she sells socks at a local market. They need a loan to buy a milk cow for breeding and for milk.

Uulkan, 22, is married. She sells various kinds of jackets. Her husband and his brother help her transport the goods. Uulkan has applied for this loan because she needs to purchase new goods and increase the assortment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for fall and winter seasons and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Reina Blanca

texts.es:
Reyna de ocupación productora de Pan de Laja, este producto lo comercializa en El Alto y en distintas ferias populares en las comunidades vecinas, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus Padres ubicado en la comunidad Laja Prov. Los Andes.

El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital de inversión, compra de Harina al por mayor así poder incrementar su producción de Pan.
 
Es el tercer crédito, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Reyna.

loans.use: COMERCIO

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es: María Celina D. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una sala D. bellaza la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. María Celina posee varios años D. trabajar en la cosmetología y es una señora con muy buenas referencia por su excelente trabajo. Gracias a esto ella logra obtener muy buenas ganancias las cuales le permiten ayudarle a su esposo a mejorara la estabilidad económica D. su hogar. María solícita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda comprar más productos D. primera calidad para su negocio y D. esta manera mejorar sus márgenes D. ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar productos de bellesa.

loans.name: Amparo Libertad

texts.es:
Amparo de ocupación vivandera cuenta con una pensión en el domicilio de sus suegros ubicado en la zona Yunguyo de El Alto, donde vende pollos a la brosther y silpanchos, el esposo trabaja como costurero en un taller particular tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de víveres por cantidad, para incrementar sus ingresos familiares y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Amparo.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Focus Group

texts.en:
Focus is a group of five borrowers led by Joseph F., 35 years old. He is an 11th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support.
He is a single father with three children aged 3-9 years old. They attend Kindergarten and first grade. Joseph and his children live in Vai town north of Monrovia, Liberia.

Buying used clothing wholesale, selling at retail is the business Joseph and his children depend on to pay for their daily expenses.
By introducing new goods to the market, Joseph attracts customers. Joseph has been running this business for four years and hopes to become an importer of used clothing to Liberia. Joseph needs this loan to increase his capital in order to accomplish his goal. He dreams of educating his children and preparing them for the future to come.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to expand business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha M. G. de 61 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo en casa propia. Martha, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, shampoo y otros productos más, tiene 15 años de realizar la misma actividad y es a través de esta como ella ha logrado seguir adelante durante tantos años. Es por esto que ella desea que su negocio mejore, y esta es la razón por la cual ha solicitado un préstamo, ya que a través de este  podrá invertir en su negocio y mejorar su condición económica, ya que espera comprar más productos de mejor calidad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de cosmétivos

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie M. was born in 1950 and is married with five children aged between 37 and 17. She lives in Gasabo district in the Kigali province of Rwanda.

Marie owns a small shop selling different kinds of products. She has an experience of seven years in this business, conducting her activities every day from 11:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Before starting this business she was a farmer and she was able to provide all the needs of her family.

With this loan requested from Vision Finance Company she plans to purchase more merchandise which will help her to earn more profit. With this increased profit she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Karla Evangelina

texts.es: Karla Evangelina P. de 31 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, junto a su esposo y su hijo de nueve años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en su casa en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, los cuales logra venderlos muy bien, ya que posee una buena clientela. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio y comprar más productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda en el lugar. Su deseo es mejorar sus ventas para poder contribuir junto a su esposo y tener una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Karla Evangelina P. is 31. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her husband and nine year old son. She has a store in her house where she sells basic needs products. She is doing very well selling them. She has a good client base. She is asking for a loan to be able to invest more in her business and buy more products. There is much demand in her place. Her wish is to improve her sales to be able to contribute with her husband and to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es empleado costurero de una Empresa Textil, su esposa trabaja como costurera en su domicilio propio ubicado en la zona Ballivián de El Alto, para una mejor confección de chamarras le hace falta una maquina recta, tienen dos hijos menores de seis y tres años de edad.  

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Maquina Recta, de esa forma podrá incrementar su producción de chamarras para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Francisco.
texts.en:
Francisco is a sewer employed in a textile enterprise. His wife works as a seamstress in her home, located in the Ballivian de El Alto zone. She lacks the right sewing machine to make better leather jackets. They have two young children, 6 and 3 years of age.

The loan will be used to buy a proper sewing machine. This will increase her production of jackets to meet the demand that exists in the market.

This is their first loan and the evaluation carried out qualifies them for approval.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A PROPER SEWING MACHINE

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor Marina C. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Apopa, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. DesD. hace un año, Flor puso su propia tienda en su casa, en ella comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual ella pueda invertir más en su negocio, ya que debido a su poco tiempo, le faltan más productos y es este uno D. los mayores deseos D. Flor, poder surtir su negocio para percibir mejores ganancias y poder mejorar la economía D. su familia.

loans.use: Compra de más productos

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: The Five Trusted Brothers Group

texts.en: Anthony N., a 30-year-old high school graduate who is preparing for college, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The Five Trusted Brothers. He is married with two children. His children are three and six years old and attend Kindergarten and first grade. Anthony and his family live around the Sea Port of Monrovia, Liberia. Buying used clothing wholesale, selling at retail is the business Anthony and his family depends on to take care of their daily expenses. By introducing new goods to the market, Anthony attracts customers. Anthony has been running this business for eight years and hopes to become an importer of used clothing to Liberia. Anthony needs this loan to increase his capital in order to accomplish his goal. He dreams of educating his children and preparing them for the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl de ocupación taxista asalariado en la ciudad de El Alto la esposa trabaja como comerciante de abarrotes en distintas ferias de El Alto tienen 2 hijos de 15 años en colegio y de 21 en la Universidad viven en casa propia ubicado en la Zona Nuevos Horizontes de El Alto la cual se encuentra en refacción.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción para una mejor comodidad de la familia.

 Es el segundo crédito, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Raúl.
texts.en:
Raúl is a salaried taxi driver in the city of El Alto in Bolivia. His wife sells groceries in various markets around El Alto. They have 2 children -- a 15 year old who is in high school, and a 21 year old who is in university. They live in a house that they own, which is located in the Nuevos Horizontes zone of El Alto. Their house is currently under renovation. The loan is for the purchase of construction materials to improve their family's comfort. This is their second loan. A credit evaluation was conducted in order to approve Raúl's loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home renovation

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es: María Alicia P. M. de 45 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque junto a su hija, sus nietos y su yerno. Ella desde hace 14 años que posee un negocio en el cual vende medicina natural y cosméticos. Es así como María ha logrado superarse y obtener todo lo necesario durante todo este tiempo. María solicita un préstamo ya que desea ver prosperado su negocio y así lograr más ventas, es así como por medio de dicho préstamo ella espera comprar más medicinas y cosméticos. María espera mejorar sus ventas, ya que es por medio de este negocio por el cual ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para vivir de una manera aceptable.
texts.en:
María Alicia P. M. is 45. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her daughter, grandchildren, and son-in-law. For 14 years she has had a business selling natural medicine and cosmetics. That is how María has been successful and gotten what she needed during all of this time. María is asking for a loan because she wants to see her business prosper and get more sales. Through this loan she hopes to buy more medicines and cosmetics. María hopes to improve her sales. It is through the business that she gets the necessary income to live in an acceptable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de ocupación comerciante de ropa por temporada vende en ferias populares del área rural del Altiplano Paceño, su esposo de ocupación comerciante de ropa vende en ferias populares de la Ciudad de Oruro, tiene 2 hijos y viven en casa propia de adobe ubicado en la zona de villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital de inversión, compra de mercadería.
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Isabel.

loans.use: COMERCIO

loans.name: David

texts.es: David F. P. de 45 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos junto a su esposa y dos hijos, desde hace 20 años vive en la casa de su suegro, y es ahí donde él posee su propio negocio, el cual consiste en venta y confección de ropa. David trabaja para maquilas, colegios y personas en general. David solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de prendas de vestir. El es muy respetado y es preferido por las personas, ya que goza de muy buenas referencias por ser una persona puntual y responsable, el cual aprovecha muy bien su trabajo.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des planches

loans.name: Desididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Desididas lo integran tres mujeres luchadoras e ingeniosas del barrio Camilo Ortega ellas son Yolanda S., Claudia G. y Elizabeth O.. La coordinadora de este grupo es constante, trabajadora y  sagaz, ella es Yolanda del Carmen S. de 60 años.

Esta señora tiene una diversidad en cuanto a su negocio ella vende cajeta, dulces tradicionales, pasteles, churros, comida, carne entre otros. Todo comenzó con la venta de carne y luego fue variando en cuanto a los productos que realiza y comercializa, actualmente desea invertir en la venta de sopa  y desea en un futuro no muy lejano tener una pulpería.

Las otras dos integrantes son Claudia Leticia G. de 32 años quien destaza cerdo y vende nacatamales, un plato típico nicaragüense y Elizabeth del Carmen O. de 41 vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Desididas Group is comprised of three clever women who are born fighters. Yolanda S., Claudia G., and Elizabeth O. are from the Camilo Ortega neighborhood. Yolanda del Carmen S., 60, is the coordinator of this group. She is loyal, hard-working, and astute. She sells diverse items like caramel, traditional sweets, cakes, churros, meals, and meat among other things. Everything started with the sale of meat. Then she started selling a variety of products. She currently wants to invest in selling soup. In the near future she wants to have a mini market. Claudia Leticia G., another member, is 32. She butchers pork and sells “nacatamales”, a typical Nicaraguan dish. Elizabeth del Carmen O., a member, is 41. She sells cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, meat, corn and vegetables to make soup and other things

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila G. D. C. D. 46 años, resiD. en Mejicanos junto a su esposo y su único hijo. Ella posee un comedor desD. hace un año en el cual prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Domitila solicita un préstamo por  medio del cual espera obtener el capital necesario para comprar mesas y sillas para sus clientes, así también desea comprar más productos para la elaboración D. comida. Domitila desea mejorar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que todo esto beneficiará a su familia y como toda buena madre desea lo mejor para su hijo.
texts.en:
Domitila G. D. C., 46, lives in Mejicanos with her husband and only son. For one year she has had a dining room where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Domitilia is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs for her customers. She also wants to buy more products for making meals. Domitila wants to improve her business and be able to get greater earnings. All of this will benefit her family. Like all good mothers, she wants the best for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola tiene una tienda de abarrotes y trabaja como ayudante de estilista, vive en la casa de sus Padres ubicado en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto,  su esposo trabaja como costurero, confecciona Chamarras y tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio.
 
El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital de inversión, compra de materia prima para el taller del esposo.
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Yola.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE INVERSION

loans.name: Isis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Isis esta integrado por Martha Elizabeth Rodriguez Solis, Jenny Gertrudis M. R., Brenda del Socorro A. B. y Karen Esperanza G.. La coordinadora del grupo es Martha Elizabeth  R. S. de 29 años ella vende ropa, hace repostería y queques y desea invertir en la compra nueva mercadería y zapatos. 

Las otras tres integrantes son Jenny Gertrudis M. R. quien vende de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos y perfumes, Brenda del Socorro A. también comercializa con estos productos y Karen Esperanza G. vende cristalería, zapatos y ropa.

loans.use: para abquirir nueva mercacia en ropa y productos para la reposteria como harina, leche, huevo...etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Constancia G. Belotto is 56 years old and has been living with Mr. Francisco Solano Sanchez for several years in a house that is located in the San Isidro district in the city of Encarnacion.

Mrs. Maria Constancia devoted several years to the selling of containers, such as cans, jars, glasses, and so on. She currently has a sales position in the downtown area. Also, she works in a restaurant and is a cook in the mornings. Through this work, she can meet the cost of the household expenses as well as any unexpected problems that might occur. Her husband, Mr. Francisco, is also dedicated to the sale of merchandise on the street and can contribute to the household income. 

Mrs. Maria Constancia is applying for credit to purchase more merchandise to fill her post and the post of her husband. The amount requested is Gs. 3,000,000.

loans.use: She will buy more products to sell

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena D. A. de 38 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa y su hija. Ella posee desde hace un año una venta de productos para la elaboración de pan, productos como harina, azúcar, levadura, entre otros productos más. Carmen solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio y surtirlo más, ya que espera mejorar sus ventas, debido a que su hijo mayor estudia en el extranjero, ella desea obtener más ganancias y poder ayudarle más a su hijo, así mismo poder contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen Elena D. A., 38, lives in Lourdes Colón in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and daughter. For a year she has been selling products like flour, sugar, leavening, and more for making bread. Carmen is asking for a loan to invest in her business and get more stock. She hopes to improve her sales. Her oldest son is studying abroad. She hopes to get more earnings to be able to help her son more and to be able to contribute, with her husband, to the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
Jessica Raquel R. L., María De La Concepción 	P. y María De Los Ángeles A. son las constituyen al grupo Rio Blanco. La coordinadora del Grupo es Jessica Raquel R. L., ella vende cosméticos de la marca Avon y productos de limpieza entre sus vecinos y conocido.

Mientras María De Los Ángeles A.  vende todo tipo de comidas derivadas del cerdo como nacatamales, frito, chicharrón, moronga y María De La Concepción P. vende ropa usada y nueva.

loans.use: comprar lapiz labial, rimel, delineador, cremas y base entre otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits de l’alimentation générale

loans.name: Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Buen pastor esta integrado por cuatro mujeres inteligentes, capaces y con deseo de auto superación. La coordinadora del grupo es Isabel V. de 46 años, ella vende comida en el mercado oriental y desea poder ampliar y mejorar su lugar de trabajo para que sus clientes cuenten con un local apropiado para comer.

Las otras integrantes son Rosa María O. E. de 45 años quien vende producto avon y fresco, Melida Rosa G.  de 41 años quien vende ropa y Ana María Bojarge R. de 43 años, ella vende comida en su casa.

loans.use: comprar productos para preparar deverso tipos de comida como carene, pollo, arroz, tomate...etc

loans.name: Paz Y Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Yrma is the coordinator of her Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Paz y Fe (peace and faith.) Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Eseperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whome recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in the east of the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unavailable. Here she makes her home with her husband and five children in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof which she owns but does not have title to.

Yrma originally came to Esperanza over six loan cycles ago for the purpose of improving her business and she has proved herself very successful as an associate of Esperanza, repaying on time every time. She will use this new loan to invest in more products such as plantains, name (a potato like root) and booklets to sell in her store. She plans to use the profits to purchase, clothes, school uniforms, notebooks and shoes for her children, a cow for her family and to continue to improve her home. Additionally, in the long term she would like to save money for a vehicle to move her products and to continue to increase her savings. She would like to thank you all for your support.

loans.use: Plantains, Name and booklets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits de l’alimentation générale

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria E. de 40 años reside en Ciudad Delgado, junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, faldas y blusas, las cuales las comercializa de manera ambulante. Macaria es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual sale a las calle desde muy temprano para tratar de vender lo más posible y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder obtener el capital necesario y de esta manera comprar más mercadería y así poder brindarles mayor variedad a sus clientas.

loans.use: Compra de ropa.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Darcy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Darcy esta conformado por tres mujeres audaces, diversas y motivadoras. Estas son Lucia del Carmen C. A. de 32 años quien vende cosméticos y productos lácteos como leche, queso, crema, leche agria y cuajada. El lema de C. es satisfacer a los clientes e invertir en la compra de productos de calidad y variedad.

Mientras Fátima G. A.  de 30 baños  y Elvira de los Angeles I. M. tienen cada una un salón de belleza e invertirán su crédito en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
El grupo Darcy comprises three audacious, diverse and motivated women. They are Lucia del Carmen C. A., 32 years, who sells cosmetics and dairy products like milk, cheese, cream, leche agria (similar to buttermilk) and curds. C.'s motto is to satisfy the clientes and invest in a variety of quality products. Meanwhile, Fátima G. A., 30 years, and Elvira de los Angeles I. M. each have a beauty salon and will use their loans to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and dairy products

loans.name: Florish Sister Group

texts.en:
Florish Sister is a group of five borrowers led by Sylvestine W., who is 31 years old and married.  She has two children ages 11 and 13 years old, and their educational levels are 4th and 5th grade. She also cares for a sibling. Because Sylvestine could only afford to attend school through the eighth grade, she needed to go into business so as to take care of her family’s needs.

Sylvestine buys food such as cereals, sugar, milk, etc. wholesale and then sells them at retail to the residents of Claratown, a crowded community north of Liberia’s capital, Monrovia.
She has been running this business for eight years and is grateful for her good relationships with her customers. 

Sylvestine is requesting this loan in order to increase the food she offers for sale. In this way she hopes to grow her business so she can change her family’s living conditions for the better.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale food to sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Comercializar vidrios, repuestos, vender comida, hacer tejidos y tostar habas son los negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo San Luís que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani. Es el caso de Martha Q. de 29 años, esposa y madre de una niña, muy temprano se levanta para hacer las laboras de su casa, para luego empezar a hacer su trabajo como es el tostar habas. Ella compra haba, los más grandes, luego los remoja con bicarbonato, para luego tostarlos y por último embolsarlo. Cuando ya tiene suficientes paquetes de haba, los fines de semana reparte a diferentes puestos y tiendas, este producto es muy consumido por los niños escolares. En esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar haba en mayores cantidades y seguir operando en su negocio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también necesitan del préstamo e invertir en sus negocios, comprando mercadería. Su presidenta Alicia C., indica que les gusta
texts.en:
Selling glass, replacements, food, weaving fabric and toasting beans are the businesses that the members of the San Luís group - part of Centro Focal Collpani- are dedicated to. Martha Q., who is 29 years old, a wife and mother of a girl, wakes up very early to do the chores in her home to later do her work toasting beans. She buys beans, the largest ones, covers them in baking soda, to later toast them and then finally bag them. When she has enough bean packages, on the weekends she delivers to several shops and stores; this is a product that is purchased by many school children. This time she needs the loan to purchase larger quantities of beans and to keep operating her business. The rest of the members of the group also need the loan to invest in their businesses, purchasing merchandise. Their president is Alicia C..

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Piedras Preciosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa esta integrado por tres señoras inteligentes, audaces y con visión. Ellas son de Villa Nueva un barrio del casco urbano de Managua.

María Auxiliadora G. es la coordinadora del grupo ella aprendió el oficio de la zapatería de su esposo con el cual trabaja lustrando zapatos, arreglandolos y vendiendo  materiales para su fabricación como cuero.

Mientras las otras dos integrantes Paula Lourdes  V. H. y Martha Cecilia 	A. venden ropa de  forma ambulante.

loans.use: Comprar pasta para lustrar, chinola, cepillos, cuero, suelas, hilo, pega, clavos...etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de congélateur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des outils de travail

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es: Mariana Azucena esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación  en su casa,    y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, vive en la zona # 6, trabaja en el instituto Rubèn Dario desde hace 20 años como docente de Español, ama su trabajo,   es una profesional muy responsable, honesta, ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  tiene dos hijas la mayor tiene 17 años estudia su quinto año de educaciòn secundaria y la menor de 13 años de edad estudia su sexto grado de educaciòn primaria, a pesar que no ha tenido la ayuda del papà de sus hijas  ella ha luchado para que a sus dos hijas no le falte nada,  ellos son una familia muy unida y todos comparten con los gastos familiares,  Mariana con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Mariana Azucena is requesting her 5th loan from AFODENIC to repair a room in her house, and this way improve the conditions in her home. She lives in zone #6, she has worked in the Ruben Dario institute for 20 years as a Spanish teacher. She loves her work; she is a very responsible and honest worker. She has shown good behavior and credit history. She has two daughters; the oldest is 17 years old and studies the 5th grade of high school and the youngest is 13 years old and is in the 6th grade. Even though she hasn't gotten any help from the father of the girls, she has fought so that her two daughters have everything they need. They are a very closely knit family and they all share their family expenses. With the previous loan, Mariana managed to succesfully build a room for greater comfort. She aspires to have a home with better conditions, work stability and health.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a room

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Suerte esta conformados por mujeres que trabajan por embellecer a sus clientes. Hoy en día la imagen de una persona es de mucha importancia y el cuidado de esta es prioridad tanto para hombres como para mujeres.

Esto lo tienen presente las integrantes de este grupo que trabajan en rubro de la belleza empezando por la coordinadora Sonia Claribel B. quien vende cosméticos por catalogo, seguida por Meyvi María R. S. vende productos Avon y Lissette del Socorro N. que hace manicure, pedicura,  tintes, alisados y peinados de todo tipo.

loans.use: comprar cosmeticos como lapiz labial, delineador, cremas etc

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bendición de Dios II esta conformado por Juana Emilia M. V., Daysi R. M. y Karla Vanessa M. M.. Ellas son mujeres muy ingeniosas, inteligentes y decidas a salir adelante.

La coordinadora del grupo es Juana Emilia M. Valera quien tiene un negocio familiar de venta de cosméticos, todos en la casa cooperan y distribuyen la mercadería entre sus conocidos. 

Las otras dos integrantes son Daysi R. M. quien vende nacatamales y ropa usada y Karla Vanessa M. M.  quien vende lámparas y ropa usada.

loans.use: compra de cosmetico como lapiz labial, delineador, sombras, bases, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits de l’alimentation générale

loans.name: Melva Rosa

texts.es: Melva Rosa O. O. tiene 53 años de edad. Su actividad económica es el destace de res. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado. El negocio consiste en el destace de ganado en su vivienda, por lo que Melva compra el ganado a ciertos productores que le ofrecen los productos favorable, posteriormente ella misma se encarga del destace, por lo que anteriormente se dedica al destace de cerdo, pero al no contar con el dinero suficiente, no continuo con este negocio por lo que en la familia se dedicaban a este tipo de negocio y fue así como mas tarde Melva decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. Y así solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertirlo en capital de trabajo para la compra  de más ganado y así abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Melva Rosa O. O. is 53 years old. Her business is beef butchering. She has been doing this work for more than 17 years and has always enjoyed it.

Melva works from her home, buying livestock from the producers who offer the best products, and personally taking charge of the butchering. Previously she also butchered pigs, but could not afford to continue this. Melva learned this trade from her family and later decided to start her own business at home.

She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase more livestock and thus satisfy the needs of her customers. Her desire is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Ana Patricia R. ha iniciado a poner mucho empeño en su trabajo para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda el cual ha estado en malas condiciones desde hace mucho tiempo y por esto requiere mejorarla.

Es por esta razón que ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y la pintura para iniciar a pintar las paredes y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de la vivienda y así brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo and department of Chinandega, Sra. Ana Patricia Rios is in the middle of reconstructing her house because it has been in poor condition and is in need of improvements.

For this reason, she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase construction materials and paint so that she can continue with these improvements. These changes will provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Gladys S. se esfuerza grandemente para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que es una pulpería cuya propietaria es ella misma por lo que está comprometida en el bienestar del negocio para lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes.

Por esta razón es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los productos para llenar sus estantes y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio. Confía en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así aumentará sus ingresos y continuará llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Mrs. Gladys S. works very hard to improve her business, which is a convenience store. Since she is the owner, she is very invested in the success of the business and satisfying every one of her customers. For this reason Gladys has come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to be used for the purchase of merchandise to fill her shelves and thus improve her business. Trust that her loaned funds will be delivered to her appropriately and that she will increase her sales, enabling her to continue to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El caballero Luis Alberto B. es padre con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar siendo ellos el motivo por el cual él se esfuerza grandemente para llevarles el sustento. Acaba de iniciar la reconstrucción de su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones y requiere brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir.

Por ello, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la obra de mejoramiento de su vivienda y así alcanzar que sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con su padre.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Douglas Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Douglas Ernesto Gutiérrez M., el tiene  45 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y calzado, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación. Douglas dio inicio a su negocio hace 10 años, cabe señalarse que antes de poner el negocio en su casa el viajaba al Río San Juan a distribuir sus productos de forma ambulante, además que allá tenia personas conocidas, a los cuales el les entregaba sus productos para luego regresar a los 15 días que ya habían vendido la mercancía. Pero esto le resultaba muy cansado y poco a poco fue estableciéndose hasta que logro poner el negocio en su casa, que es donde está actualmente establecido. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa variada y calzado las cuales piensa distribuir desde su casa de habitación, ya que posee una buena clientela establecida. Su sueño es llegar a establecer otra tienda en el mercado, en el cual sus ingresos puedan ser mayores que los que posee actualmente
texts.en:
Douglas Ernesto Gutiérrez M., 45, is married and has three minor children. He sells used clothing and shoes from his home. Douglas started the business ten years ago. Before he started the business in his house, he traveled to Río San Juan to distribute his products as a street vendor. Also, he had people there that he knew. He would leave the products with them and return in 15 days after they had sold the merchandise. But, this made him very tired. Little by little he was establishing himself, and he was able to set up the business in his house. That is where it currently is. The loan is to buy various clothing and footwear, which he plans to sell from his home. He has a well established client base. His dream is to establish another store in the market, which can lead to greater income than he currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
Venta de alimento para animales, repuestos de movilidad, pescado, comida y en su mayoría venta de ropa son los negocios de las  integrantes del grupo El Sol que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani. Se agruparon recientemente, por la necesidad de mejorar sus negocios. Así por ejemplo Paulina Quiñones de 28 años, soltera se animó a ingresar al grupo porque su amiga la ha invitado ya que ella tiene su pequeño negocio de elaboración de masitas y ahora desea comprarse un pequeño horno que le permita incrementar su nivel de producción.
 Las demás integrantes del grupo también necesitan del préstamo e invertir en sus negocios, comprando mercadería.
 Liderizadas por su mesa directiva elaboran su reglamento interno de su Asociación.
texts.en:
The members of grupo El Sol, which belongs to Centro Focal Collpani, have businesses that sell animal food, spare parts, fish, food, and mostly clothing. They started the group recently, because they needed to improve their businesses. For example Paulina Quiñones, who is 28 years old and single, was persuaded to join the group when a friend invited her because she has a small business that makes food, and she needs to buy a small oven that will allow her to increase her production level. The rest of the group's members also need the loan to invest in their businesses, purchasing merchandise. Lead by their board, they write the internal rules of their association.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Nelly Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Lainez es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual tiene en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitada por sus clientes a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer.

Con muchos deseos de desarrollar el negocio, la señora Nelly ha iniciado a trabajar más arduamente y tiene la necesidad de llenar sus estantes de productos y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos principalmente comestibles para ofrecerlos en la pulpería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Mighty God Group

texts.en:
Mighty God is a group of five borrowers led by Cecelia K., 35 years old. She is a high school graduate but couldn't afford to continue at the university due to lack of financial support. She is a single mother of four children aged 1-17 years old. They are in the third through ninth grade.

Cecelia's business is her little provisional shop where she sells bath soaps, detergent, washing soaps, candles, cheese, etc to the residents of Virginia, Northern Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for six years. The difficulty Cecelia faces is when customers buy her goods and don't pay on time for her to buy new goods.  However, because she talks to them in a good manner, they always want to patronize her business. She needs this loan in order to buy more goods like bathing soap, wheat, candles, etc.

Cecelia's goal is to grow from a shop to running a store. And she dreams of educating the children and building a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Ramona M. es una dama muy esforzada y muy trabajadora  que se ha propuesto brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y para ello ha decidido invertir en la remodelación de su vivienda en el municipio de Somotillo debido a que necesita mejorar las condiciones porque ha raíz de los fenómenos climáticos la vivienda se ha venido deteriorando.

Por este motivo es que ella ha acudido para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida brindándole a su familia un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Ramona M. is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She plans to give her children better living conditions. To do that, she has decided to invest in the remodeling of her home in the Somotillo municipality. She needs to improve its condition because the climate has caused its deterioration. That is why she has come to ask for a loan to buy construction materials. She will continue improving their living conditions by giving her family a decent roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa Chávez M. es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. La señora Maria tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan, los cuales distribuye luego a los negocios cercanos. Debido a la experiencia que tiene y a los años que ya lleva funcionando el negocio, la señora posee una amplia cobertura de clientes, que van desde clientes que le compran al por mayor y también al por menor. cuando la Maria inicio este negocio fue con capital propio y fue debido a la escasez de trabajo que asedia a nuestro país, además ella nunca se imagino que algún día llegaría a tener una panadería como la que posee en nuestros días. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra principalmente de harina, ya que mantiene almacenada para que cuando suban los precios no le afecten en la elaboración de sus manjares, además de esto ella desea también invertir en la compra de una batidora que le permita elaborar sus mercancías de una forma más rápida. Ella tiene el sueño de algún día exportar sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio es casado, trabaja como maestro de primaria en Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando el 3er crèdito, para comprar materiales de construcciòn y hacer una habitaciòn para asi mejorar las condiciones del nùcleo familiar,  su esposa se encarga  de los quehaceres del hogar, adicionalmente se dedica a la  siembra de cultivos agricolas en la finca de su mamà en los dias libre y los fines de semana y obtiene otros ingresos, es un docente que ama su trabajo y ha luchado para que a su familia no le falta nada, su sueño es seguir estudiando para asi desempeñar su trabajo con mucha eficiencia.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: El Provenir Group

texts.es:
El grupo el provenir esta integrado por  María Gabriela B. D., Sandi de los Santos N. y Martha Lorena R.. Ellas son provenientes del centro de Ticuantepe.
 
María Gabriela B. D. comenzó apoyando a su mamá con la atención de la pulpería, luego empezó a comercializar productos de la Avon desde entonces ha ido invirtiendo en diferentes productos como ropa, perfumes y la venta de fritanga. 

Esta joven de tan solo 21 años ha demostrado ser una gran comerciante y administradora, pero su mayor su ello es poder estudiar y aplicar su conocimientos al negocio.
