Las integrantes del grupo son Sandi de los Santos N. de 26 años vende ropa nueva y usada y Martha Lorena R. de 42 años que vende ropa.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos y chiverias

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, en el  municipio de Somotillo, la señora Yadira S. ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación por la razón de que necesita brindarle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo y así proporcionarles un techo digno donde vivir.  

Port tal razón, la señora Yadira acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar  el crédito oportuno para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de la vivienda ya que le es de importancia terminar con esta obra de construcción.
texts.en:
Yadira S., with much effort and dedication, has started rebuilding her house in the Somotillo municipality. The reason she is doing this is to give her children the conditions that are necessary for their development, and to give them a decent roof over their heads. For that reason, Yadira comes to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials. That way she will continue improving the condition of the house. It is important to her to finish this construction work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: La Casa Del Ahorro Group

texts.en:
L. Figueroa (second from right in photo) is an entrepreneur who lives in Guerra, Dominican Republic. Guerra is a small town in the interior of the DR, about 30 miles northeast of Santo Domingo. L. is a coordinator for her solidarity group called La Casa del Ahorro (The Savings House), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

L. is 27 years old and has five young children, ages 9, 7, 5, 3, and 2. She has a small business selling new clothing to her neighbors and friends. Fashion is very important to Dominicans, and L. has tried to capitalize on the latest trends. With this loan, she is going to buy the newest jeans and blouses which she will then sell to her customers. This is L.’s second loan with Esperanza, and she hopes to have more in the future.

Since Guerra is small and located in the interior of the country, it is difficult to access and lacks most utilities. Electricity is unreliable at best, there is no potable water, and sanitation is questionable. Despite these difficulties, L. hopes to raise healthy children with opportunities for a good education. She also hopes that with an expanding business, one day she will be able to have her own shop. Thank you for your loan to L. and to La Casa del Ahorro group!

loans.use: New pants and blouses

loans.name: Garcia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Garcia esta integrado por Martha Irene M. quien desde hace quince años vende frutas y verduras, Melena Cecilia C. G.  quien también vende verduras y Claudia del Rosario M. R. quien vende gaseosa y fresco.

Lo que ellas desean es poder su para esta crisis económica con trabajo, dedicación y esfuerzo pero para ello necesitan capital para invertir en productos para sus negocios como yuca, pipián, ayote, chayote, yerba buena, quequisque, naranja, pitaya, tamarindo, semilla de jícaro, cacao,  tomate entre otros.

loans.use: pata compraryuca, pipián, ayote, chayote, yerba buena, quequisque, naranja, pitaya, tamarindo, semilla de jícaro, cacao,  tomate entre otros

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise M. is 25 years old and is married with two children: the first is 3 years old and the second is two months of age. Louise lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Louise owns a metal workshop and employs six persons. She opens her business every day from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Before this business she was a full-time housewife and was not able to help her husband to provide all the needs of their family.

With this loan, Louise plans to produce more metal items so that she earns more profits, is able to save money for the future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her metal shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C. is from the village of Tolon. She is 35 years old. Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joy's husband works as a maintenance crew in one of the hotels in Dipolog City.  The family earns as little as 14,000 per month as their main source of living. Joy is also engage in Ready to Wear business which gave her a return of 500 Php per week. 

In 2006, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services at Paglaum Coop. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to finance her house repair activity. Little by little, she purchased some of the materials to start the house repair. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: God Is Wonderful Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five borrowers led by Jartu R., 48 years old. She is married with seven children aged 16-30 years old. Their educational levels are 10th grade through college student. Jartu is illiterate due to lack of financial support from her parents. She lives in Virginia, northern Monrovia, Liberia.

Jartu's business is buying fish wholesale and selling at retail in the Virginia market. She has been running this business for four years and is doing well.
The difficulty Jartu faces is when goods are bought, and then immediately the market price changes. It causes a loss in the business.
The good approach and affordable price she gives her customers makes her business go on fine. Jartu needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to expand her business. She dreams of improving her business so that she can educate her children the best way.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Danelia Argentina

texts.es: Danelia argentina Díaz V. tiene la edad de 43 años. Es una mujer muy responsable. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a trabajar a este negocio. Su esfuerzo u su anhelo por sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para obtener el pan de cada día. En la actualidad ha modificado su vivienda por lo que tiene exponer los productos que los distribuidores ofrecen ya que sus clientes siempre preguntan por nuevos productos. Es por eso que Danelia solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como golosinas, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, granos básicos y productos del hogar. El mayor sueño de Danelia es seguir con este pequeño negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Danelia Argentina Díaz V. is a responsible woman who is 43 years old. For more than 12 years she has run a small general store. She makes this effort because she desires to see her children get ahead, and because she needs to generate income to put bread on the table every day. She has recently modified her home in order to display products that the distributors offer, since her customers are always asking for new products. Daniela is requesting this financing to purchase more products such as candy, bread, juice, other natural drinks, basic grains, and home products. Daniela's main dream is to continue with this small business that is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bebelinda

texts.en: Bebelinda C. is from the village of Lumipac. She is 46 years old. Bebelinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bebelinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Bebelinda has been operating this business for a year now. In 2009, Bebelinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Bebelinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Bebelinda second loan from PMPC. Bebelinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: Additional stock for grocery store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen V. is from the village of Bunawan. He is 38 years old. Helen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence M. is 36 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 14. She lives in the Kicukiro district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda where she has owned a small clothes shop since 2008. She employs four persons in her business which she opens every day from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Before requesting this loan she was a full-time housewife and she was not able to provide all the needs of her family. With this new loan from Vision Finance Company, she plans to increase her business in order to earn more profit which will help her to save money and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina A. is from the village of Sepac. She is 58 years old. Celerina is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Celerina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Celerina's twelfth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Sepac. She is 20 years old. Merlyn is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating as a reloader. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from being a load retailer in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business as a load retailer. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine M. is 23 years old,married with one child of six month of age .
she has an experince of three years in sewing .she starts everyday her business from 6hoo AM to 7h00 PM .
Before doing this business of sewing clothes,she could not get all needs for her family.
Francine is requesting her loan from vision finance company witch will hel her to expand her business in order to get more profits.

loans.use: for expanding her workshop of sewing clothes

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona M. is 24 years old and is married with two children. The first is two years old and the second is eight months of age.  Fiona lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Fiona owns a small shop which has sold different kinds of products since 2008. She employs one person in her business which she operates every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Before starting this business she was a housewife and was not able to provide all her family’s needs.

With this loan, Fiona plans to expand her business which, through the increased profits, will help her to change the life of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría tiene 45 años. Es una mujer muy responsable ya que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y los mantiene ella ya que es madre soltera y sus hijos son lo más importante. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad en su vivienda, y poco a poco ha logrado incrementar en productos por lo que así fue incrementando clientes. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como es el poco apoyo 	que tenia por lo que no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en todos los productos, pero por medio de una amiga  que le hablo de Fundación León 2000 decide empezar a realizar financiamientos y seguir con el negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de café, jugos, huevos, arroz, aceite, gaseosas, pan y otras cosas. El sueño de Maritza es que sus hijos luchen para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría is 45 years old. She is a very responsible woman with three children under her care, who are the most important part of her life. She takes care of the children by herself, as she is a single mother. She has worked as the proprietor of a general store for 15 years, a business she started from her home. Little by little Maritza has managed to increase her sales as her number of customers has increased. Despite the difficulties she has faced, such as the lack of support since she has not had the sufficient amount of capital to invest in all the products, Maritza wishes to keep up with her business. After a friend told her about Fundación León 2000, she decided to start to apply for loans and keep her store running. Now Maritza is asking for this loan for working capital so that she can purchase coffee, juices, eggs, rice, oil, sodas, and bread, among other things. The dream of Maritza is that her children can continue to fight to come out on top.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, products to stock a general store

loans.name: Marcelo Ruben

texts.es: Marcelo Rubén E. Castellón tiene la edad de 28 años. Es un hombre responsable y con 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Marcelo inicio hace mas de 10 años, ya que su familia se dedicaba a este negocio, por lo que a él le gusto lamentablemente su familia no tenía suficiente recursos y lamentablemente no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, fue por esto que Marcelo lucho mas para que sus hijos no pasaran por lo mismo. Y así empezó este negocio que sería su medio de vida para sacar a su familia adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ciertos repuestos que son útiles para su medio de transporte. Para un futuro le gustaría que sus hijos aprendieran este negocio para mantenerlo en la familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal N. is 28 years old,single.she lives in Nyarugenge district,kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
she owns a small shop where she sells the spareparts since2008 and employs one person.
she opens his shop everyday from 6h00 AM to 5h00PM.

before doing this business he was not able to get all needs.
with this loan requested in vision finance company, he plans to expand his business in order to get more profits so that he will be able to change his life forever.

loans.use: purchasing more spare parts for sales

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel M. is 33 years old,married with four children aged between 9 and 2.
he lives in Nyarugenge district,kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
she owns a small shop of shoes since 2004 .she starts his business everyday 8h00 AM to 7h00 PM.
before doing this business he could not get all needs for his family.

with the loan requested in vision finance company,he plans to purchase more shoes so that he gets more profits witch will help him to change the life of his family such as to feed his children,to pay school fees of his children and also to save money for the future.

loans.use: Purchase more shoes for sales

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance N. is 32 years old,single and she takes care of 3 children aged between 8 and 2.
she lives in kicukiro district,kigali province capital of Rwanda.
she does the business of salon since 2003,and she employs six persons in her business,starting everyday from 6h00 AM to 9h00 PM.

before this business she could get all needs for her family becouse she was fultime house wife.

with this new loan requested in vision finance,she plans to expand her business through purchasing new equipment in order to get more profits .

loans.use: purchase more materiels

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz Maria García A. tiene 52 años. Es una mujer casada y junto a su esposo tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la una pulpería. Por lo que inicio hace más de 5 años ya que anteriormente vendía refrescos y sándwich, a pesar de no tener todos los recursos necesarios para iniciar este negocio Luz consiguió suficiente dinero de una manera humilde, a pasar el tiempo logro fue aumentando cada día más en productos, ya que siempre estaba pendiente de que a sus hijos no les faltara lo necesario. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, aceite, sopas, pan y jugos. Ella siempre ha soñado con tener su propia tienda de ropa y un restaurante que será destinado para que el día de mañana sus hijos tengan con que sobrevivir.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca Beatriz Bàez Morel lives in the Roque González Neighborhood in Immaculada Concepción. She is 22 years old and a university student. She lives with her mother and sister, and works with her mother selling door to door all types of merchandise. Blanca says that she always acompanies her mother and they know many districts in her area to sell to. She wants to start a small business with her mother, who will help facilitate the business. She has acquired many good clients, and she hopes with the profit that she can pay for her studies. Their products are made of good quality and are well-liked by the buyers. With the loan she plans to buy covers to sell door to door with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy covers

loans.name: Herika Liset

texts.es: Kerika Liset R. A. tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de sastrería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con la ayuda del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria por lo que anteriormente trabajaba en una zona franca, lo que le ha ayudo a obtener la respectiva velocidad en la elaboración de cada uno de los trajes que elaboraba, pero no recibía un salario justo y llegaba muy cansada a su casa para hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo, por lo que decide comenzar su propio negocio en su humilde vivienda y con el poco dinero que obtuvo empezó a realizar sus confecciones, actualmente Kerika tiene muchos clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. En un futuro le gustaría obtener su propio taller para emplear a personas que son como ellas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth Laínez M. tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es elaboración y venta de comida ya que ambas cosas la realiza ella misma. Ruth es cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre dice estar agradecida ya que es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido salir adelante. Actualmente tiene 1 hija de 6 años que está a su cargo y que cursa 4 grado de primaria. Ella realiza esta actividad hace 13 años, cuando empezó a vender por la razón de que ella se encontraba sin un trabajo estable y por medio de una tía logro establecer el negocio de venta de comida, el cual está ubicado en una estación de buses y hay muchos clientes. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de azúcar, granos básicos, frutas, verduras entre otros productos. Ruth desea que todos los esfuerzos ha realizado ayuden a su hija para que obtenga una educación digna.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Modesta Odili

texts.es: Modesta Odili M. P. tiene 35 años. Es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida en el mercado, por lo que es aquí donde obtiene a sus clientes, ya que en su mayoría todos los clientes salen a la hora del almuerzo, es en este momento en donde Modesta empieza a servir los paltos de comida para que sus clientes tengan le mejor servicio. A pesar de los problemas que enfrento como es ser madre soltera y tiene que trabajar todo el día, porque tiene 1 hija y tiene que ser madre y padre a la misma vez para que a su hija no le falten los estudios y con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante. La inversión del  financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de la comida. Modesta tiene el sueño de ser la dueña de un restaurante y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Modesta Odili M. P. is 35 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is engaged in the production and sale of food. She sells food in the market; it is there that she is able to find customers. The majority of her customers go out during the lunch hour; this is the time when Modesta begins to serve the meals for her customers in order that her customers have the best service. In spite of the problems that confront her as a single mother (having to work all day, having to be both mother and father at the same time for her daughter so that her daughter does not fall behind in her studies), with the help of God she has been able to continue to move ahead. This financing will be used to purchase raw materials for the production of food. Modesta has a dream of owning her own restaurant and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: With the credit he will buy a compressor

loans.name: 8 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo el provenir esta integrado por Suyen del Carmen A. A., Karen Marina R. L. y Ruth del Carmen A. P.. Ellas son provenientes del casco urbano de Ticuantepe.

Suyen del Carmen A. A. desde hace ocho años vende tortillas y cabaza de chancho. Todo empezó al ayudarle a su mamá con el negocioque en un principio solo era venta de tortilla y actualmente venden chancho en la casa y en la calle. Esta joven es la coordinadora del grupo

Las otras integrantes son Karen Marina R. L.  vende ropa y Ruth del Carmen A. P. vende piñas en el mercado Mayoreo

loans.use: para comprar maiz, leña y cerdo

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Señor José Ángel V. tiene  39 años, su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este trabajo, con mucho esmero le dedica el tiempo correspondiente a su negocio, junto con su compañera de vida tienen 3 hijos de los cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. El comenzó este negocio de manera ambulante, porque no tenía los suficientes recursos, establecerse en solo local, por lo que todos los días fueron de arduo trabajo para la lograr alquilar un local, el recorría muchos lugares con un saco de frijoles o azúcar sobre sus espaldas, afortunadamente logro obtener el capital necesario. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para la compra de suficientes productos y abastecer a sus clientes. El deseo de José es tener su propio local.
texts.en:
José Ángel V., 39, sells basic grains. He has been doing this work for over four years. With great care he devotes time to his business. He and his life companion have three children they are raising. He started this business as a street vendor because he did not have enough resources to establish himself in only one place. Every day he worked arduously to be able to rent a place. He traveled to many places with a sack of beans or sugar on his back. Fortunately, he was able to get the necessary capital. Now he is asking for a loan to buy enough products and supply his customers. His wish is to have his own place.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santo Tomas está integrado por Zela Ivone Z. P., Lucia del socorro Z., Ninfa Iveth S., María Carlota J. R. y Karlota Renata V. Gonzáles. Ellas son provenientes del Barrio Dolores Estrada del casco urbano de Managua.

 Zela Ivone Z. P. de 58 años empezó vendiendo fritanga los fines de semana y luego como el negocio fue creciendo y tomando forma puede vender todos los días. Su meta es lograr que su negocio se convierta en un restaurante de comida tradicional y popular.

Las otras integrantes son Lucia del Socorro Z. quien tiene una fritanga, vende fresco y gaseo y Ninfa Iveth S. quien vende tortilla y los fines de semana vende nacatamales y fritanga. Mientras que María Carlota J. R. vende productos de limpieza y Karlota Renata V. Gonzáles tiene una pequeña pulperia.
texts.en:
The Santo Tomas Group is comprised of Zela Ivone Z. P., Lucia del socorro Z., Ninfa Iveth S., María Carlota J. R., and Karlota Renata V. Gonzáles. They are from the Dolores Estrada neighborhood in the city center of Managua. Zela Ivone Z. Pinea, 58, started selling fried snacks on the week ends. Then, as the business was forming and taking shape, she could sell every day. Her goal for the business is to convert it to a traditional and popular food restaurant. Lucia del Socorro Z., another member, has a fried snack stand. She sells soft drinks. Ninfa Iveth S. sells tortillas. On the week ends she sells “nacatamales” (a type of tamale made of smashed corn and potatoes wrapped in a banana leaf along with some pork meat, little fresh tomato and some garlic & salt) and fried snacks. María Carlota J. R. sells cleaning products. Karlota Renata V. Gonzáles has a small mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "fritanga" (fried snacks) like meat, bananas, cabbage, and corn, etc.

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor del Campo está integrado por Humbelina del Socorro C. H., Lesbia María C. y Francisco de Jesús S. P.. Ellos son originarios de la comarca el portillo en Masaya. 

La coordinadora del Grupo es Humbelina del Socorro C. H.. Ella tiene una pequeña pulpería que comenzó con la venta de golosinas y ahora vende todo tipo de productos para el consumo del hogar.

Los otr0s integrantes son Lesbia María C.  quien vende verduras y Francisco de Jesús S. P. quien también vende frutas y verduras.  Ellos necesitan el crédito para poder comprar los productos  de acuerdo a su negocio como yuca, pipián, ayote, chayote, yerba buena, quequisque, naranja, pitaya, tamarindo,  tomate, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otros.
texts.en:
The Flor del Campo Group is comprised of Humbelina del Socorro C. H., Lesbia María C., and Francisco de Jesús S. P.. They are from the El Portillo region in Masay. Humbelina del Socorro C. H. is the coordinator of the group. She has a small mini market, which started by selling sweets. Now she sells all type of consumable products for the home. Lesbia María C., another member, sells vegetables. Francisco de Jesús S. P. also sells fruits and vegetables. They need the loan to be able to buy products for their businesses. They will buy things like yucca, squash, vegetable pears, spearmint, “quequisque” (a root vegetable), oranges, dragon fruit, tamarind, rice, sugar, and beans, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, fruit, and vegetables like tomatoes, oranges, squash, and vegetable pears, etc.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Diversos son las actividades económicas de las integrantes del grupo Progreso, que pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana y todas trabajan con la esperanza de dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Una de ellas es Susana M., casada y madre de 3 niños, ayuda en los ingresos de su familia tejiendo mantas, una habilidad que aprendió en el colegio, desea comprar lana de vicuña para luego tejer mantas de este material ya que es muy apreciado por sus clientas. Susana tiene su lugar de venta en la feria 16 de Julio y también ofrece sus productos en la Ceja Avenida Tihuanaku.
Al igual que Susana sus compañeras tienen sus negocios como la venta de zapatos, papa frita, alimentos secos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Many are the business activities that the members of the Progreso Group, a branch of the Panamericana headquarters, partake in. All of the members work with the hopes of giving their families a better quality of life. One of the members is Susana M., a married mother of three who helps to support the household by weaving blankets, a skill that she learned in school. She would like to purchase vicuna wool so that she can weave blankets out of this material because her customers prefer it. Susana has a stand at the 16 de Julio Market, but she also sells her products at Ceja Avenida Tihuanaku.

The rest of the group members sell footwear, fries, dried foods, vegetables, or other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
The committee of women Santa Rosa integrate working woman of the San Cayetano Neighborhood (3 kilometeres away from Carapeguá). A women of limited resources can enter the program and deciD. to meet and receive information about the program. 
The women are active, and the majority of them dedicate their time to diverse activities, and they are looking for an alternative way to help their husbands and family. They are  looking for ways to give them a better quality of life. 
They need the credit operation to invest in their respective work and achieve a growing and sustainable group. 
With their loans they will buy merchandise to dispense (rice, sugar, maté, milk, different kinds of breads, soda, etc.). They will buy the ingredients for a grocery store or newsstand. They will buy clothes, wood, fabric and decoration, and things from the hardware store (rings, purses, chains, buckles, etc.) to sell.

loans.use: They will buy clothes, wood, fabric and decoration, and things from the hardware store (rings, purses, chains, buckles, etc.)

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Luisa Emilia G. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos ofertados en su establecimiento.

Actualmente ella requiere invertir en la compra de los repuestos para ofertarlos y por esto es que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los repuestos para así continuar mejorando su negocio en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos para automóviles

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Mrs. Feliciana is married to Mr. Antonio C., and they live with their two young children in the neighborhood of Inmaculada Concepión, around the city of Roque Gonzalez.
She is the owner of a grocery store that sells alternative kinds of merchandise. She also has many clients. With her credit, she will buy sugar, rice, and mate (an herbal tea) to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and mate to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
En un establecimiento del mercado El bisne en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Eugenio O. se dedica a atender su negocio de joyería brindando el servicio de reparación de joyas y de venta de joyas. Él se ha destacado por ser un excelente joyero habiendo ganado en años anteriores el premio al primer lugar habiendo sido el mejor joyero de Chinandega.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para la compra de oro y plata para elaborar las joyas y así comercializarlas en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de oro y plata para la joyería

loans.name: Altiplano Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Villa tejada se reúne la asociación “Altiplano” un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que pro-mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una linda amistad entre ellas.
Actualmente son varias las actividades que realiza esta asociación, por ejemplo  Isabel hace seis años elabora masitas y las vende de forma ambulante, Justina vende variedad de frutas, Leonora vende papa y chuño,  Yolanda realiza tejido de mantas, Katy tiene un puesto de libros, Fabiola elabora pan y comida. Ellas afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de insumos y variedad de productos (harina, azucar, frutas y otros ).
texts.en:
The village bank, "Altiplano" meets at a regional office called Villa Tejada. They are a very nice group that in addition to working together in Pro-Mujer's system, they have formed lovely friendships within the group.

Currently there are a variety of activities in which this bank works. For example, Isabel has been making corn breads for the last six years and peddling them. Justina sells a variety of fruits and Leonora sells potatoes and chuño, or dehydrated potatoes. Yolanda makes fabric for blankets and Katty has a book stall. Fabiola bakes bread and makes food. They say they need more capital to buy supplies and a variety of products like flour, sugar, fruit and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Maritza Agustina

texts.es:
La dama Maritza N. desde hace siete años inició su pequeño negocio de salón de belleza donde no prestaba las condiciones necesarias hasta que poco a poco al pasar el tiempo fue mejorando su condición económica hasta desarrollarse más en el salón. 

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra directa de los materiales de trabajo como lo son tintes, pinturas, cremas, entre otros y de esta manera lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes que le visitan en el ramo de la belleza.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de trabajo

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Mr. Hugo lived in the neighborhood of Sta. Margarita around the city of Carapeguá. He is 31 years old and lives with Mrs. Victoria. They have two young children, one of school age and one two years old.
He works as a builder by trade and learned from his father, and he knows many people in the area that he can work for. 
He wants to buy a mixer with the loan to help his work. With the profit he wants to make a modest house where he can live with his family.

loans.use: He wants to buy a mixer

loans.name: Benita Lorena

texts.es:
En el mercado el Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Benita Lorena R. se ha destacado por ser comerciante de comida elaborada por ella misma y ofreciéndola a los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Por esta razón es que la señora Benita R. ha acudido a solicitar el crédito ya que está interesada en desarrollar su negocio y requiere para esto la compra de la materia prima para elaborar todos los tipos de alimentos y así venderlos a sus clientes que muy seguramente los compraran porque ella los elabora muy gustosos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos B. is married to Mrs. Cecilia Rolon and they live in Calixtro, a town in Carapeguà. Cecilia is a nurse, and they have three sons over 18. 
On the weekends Mr. B. sells typical things in his area, for the city of Guarambarè and also has a business where people can go to pay bills. 
With his loan he wants to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: he wants to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
Rosmary D. L. O., mujer D. 35 años cuenta que recientemente se animó a ingresar a este grupo Walisuma por invitación D. una vecina. ElL. ya trabajaba con Pro Mujer en otro grupo aproximadamente 7 años, tomo un descanso, pero ahora  ha regresado para sacar nuevamente un préstamo, porque le gusta L. forma D. trabajo, además valora mucho L. atención en salud, sobre todo las compañas D. fluorización para los niños.

Rosmery venD. comida especializándose en pollos a L. broaster, tiene su lugar D. venta en L. 16 D. Julio y le va bien, ahora quiere adquirir nuevos muebles para su tienda.
Sus compañeras D. grupo tienen diferentes actividades económicas como L. venta D. huevo, detergentes, ropa, frutas y alimentos y desean hacer crecer sus negocios teniendo un poco más D. capital con el cual operar.
texts.en:
Rosmary D. L. O. is 35 years old and recently joined Walisuma group with a neighbor’s invitation. She worked with Pro Mujer in another group for about 7 years. She took a break and is back for a loan because she likes her work, and pays more attention to health issues, especially the fluoridation campaigns for children. Rosmary sells food, specializing in broaster (baked) chicken. She has her store in 16 D. Julio (a street fair) and she does well, and now wants to get new furniture for her store. Her fellow group members have different economic activities like selling eggs, detergents, clothing, fruits and food. They wish their businesses to grow by having a bit more capital with which to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixed assets and merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Luis Alfonso D. se dedica a brindar el servicio de reparación de televisores y venta de repuestos de televisores. Es importante destacar que se ha destacado por ser muy conocedor del ramo de la electrónica y por ello ha tenido muchos clientes a los que les ha reparado los televisores. 

La razón por la que el señor Luis ha solicitado el crédito es porque lo va a invertir en la compra de los repuestos para los televisores y así utilizarlos en las reparaciones electrónicas que va realizando con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y brindarles un servicio de alta calidad.
texts.en:
In the El Bisne market in the district of Chinandega, Mr. Luis Alfonso D. works as a television repairman and seller of spare television parts. It is important to point out that he has distinguished himself by being an expert in electronics and because of this, has repaired television sets for many customers. The reason Mr. Luis has requested a loan is to buy spare television parts to be used in electronic repairs. In this way, he will satisfy the needs of his customers and offer them a high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare television parts

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel Martínez is 49 years old and has been married for 16 years. They have two children, one 21 years old and another 12 years. 
For 15 years he has been selling ítems in his area, specifically hammocks that his father takes to the area of Luque. 
His wife is a professional weaver and elaborates lovely covers that she sells in the area, and Mr. Miguel distributes the capital. They work very hard and want to buy a motorcycle to work more efficiently.
With the loan he wants to buy merchandies (hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets).

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Carlos Manuel C. se ha destacado desde hace varios años en el negocio de sastrería teniéndolo en su propio establecimiento donde brinda el servicio a sus clientes que le visitan. Es un buen sastre con amplio conocimiento en el ramo y esto lo hace ser muy reconocido en su localidad.

La necesidad que atraviesa es la de obtener el crédito a lo inmediato para la compra de tela, hilos, tizas y reparación de maquinas de coser para continuar en su negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de trabajo

loans.name: Nubes Blanca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nubes Blancas está conformado por Karla Vanessa P. G., Erick Iván S. R. y Nidia Lizath L. G.. Ellos son de la comarca San Francisco de Nindiri.

 La coordinadora del grupo es Karla Vanessa P. G., ella desde hace tres años empezó con la venta de ropa y actualmente compra por mayor. Los otros integrantes son Erick Iván S. R. y Nidia Lizath L. G. los cuales tambien vende ropa.

Ellos necesitan el crédito para poder adquirir nueva mercadería, ya que en el negocio de la ropa se tiene que estar con las últimas tendencias de moda en blusa, pantalones, chores, faldas especialmente en esta temporada donde las actividades son más productivas por las promociones, primera comuniones, entre otros.
texts.en:
The Group “Nubes Blancas” (White Clouds) consists of Karla Vanessa P. G., Erick Iván S. R., and Nidia Lizath L. G.. They are from the region of San Francisco de Nindiri.

Karla Vanessa P. G. is the group coordinator. She started selling clothes three years ago and she now sells them wholesale. The other members, Erick Iván S. R. and Nidia Lizath L. G., also sell clothing.

They need a loan to acquire new merchandise, since the clothing business requires that they keep up with the latest fashion trends. Among the items they plan to purchase are blouses, pants, jackets, and skirts that are in season and can be worn for promotions, first communions, and other events.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the latest styles of clothing

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es: Hilaria  A. es la presidenta de la asociación “illimani” del centro Focal Villa Adela, en la ciudad de El Alto, ella al igual que muchas de sus compañeras necesita elevar sus ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia, Hilaria tiene cinco hijos,  junto a su esposo hace cuatro años se dedican a la venta de repuestos para automóviles, tienen un puesto en el cruce taquiña (El Alto). Otras de las socias son artesanas, realizan tejidos de mantas, también venden artículos de plástico, ropa, muebles, manzanas y otros. La asociación Altiplano necesita incrementar su capital para poder variar e incrementar su mercadería, solo de esta manera podrán generar la clase de ingresos que se necesita para satisfacer las necesidades de sus familias.
texts.en:
Hilaria A. is the president of the“illimani” association in the Focal Villa Adela center, in the city of El Alto. Along with many of her fellow members, she needs to increase her income to support her family. Hilaria has five children, and with her husband, four years ago they have been selling automobile parts, and have a little stall in the taquiña intersection (El Alto). Other members are artisans, they knit blankets, and they also sell plastic goods, clothing, furniture, apples and other items. The Altiplano association needs to increase their capital to have variety and increase their merchandize. It is the only way that they can generate the necessary income to fulfill the needs of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
En el mercado El bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Juana María F. posee su propio negocio de venta de discos compactos de música cristiana y videos cristianos teniendo este negocio desde hace ocho años habiendo invertido en este mucho esfuerzo ya que está en la responsabilidad de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por lo que la señora Juana solicita el crédito es para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los discos compactos para llenar sus estantes y de esta manera ofertarlos ya que son muchos los clientes que le visitan y por tanto debe de tener el producto necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de discos compactos

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La elaboración y venta de comida es la actividad a la que se dedica la señora Manuela del Socorro M. en el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega donde oferta todo tipo de comida a los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Ella tiene muchos deseos de desarrollarse y por este motivo es que ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y así continuar mejorando su actividad y satisfaciendo a los clientes que le compran los alimentos.
texts.en:
Manuela del Socorro M. makes and sells food in the market "El Bisne" in the department of Chinandega. She offers all different types of food to the customers that visit the market.

She has many ideas to develop her business and for this reason she is asking for a loan to invest in buying ingredients for making food so that she can continue to better her business and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Liberia B. se dedica arduamente a trabajar en su negocio de pulpería el cuál posee y a pesar que ofrece pocos productos y el espacio no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias, ella se esfuerza buscando la manera de cómo mejorar en el desarrollo del negocio.

Actualmente ella requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos con la finalidad de ofertarlos en su establecimiento y así contribuir al mejoramiento de su pulpería que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chinandega, Mrs. Liberia B. devotedly works in a convenience store, which she owns. Despite having few products to sell and a space that doesn’t have the necessary conditions, she tries hard to look for a way to develop the business. At the moment, she requires a loan to buy products in order to sell them in her establishment. In this way she will contribute to the improvement of her store which so much requires the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to sell in a convenience store

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia S. se ha destacado por vender sandalias en el mercado El Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega donde las oferta a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su establecimiento para adquirir las sandalias.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las sandalias porque a su alrededor tiene mucha competencia y por tal motivo debe de ir adelante en el negocio que requiere de constante inversión.

loans.use: Compra de las sandalias

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 25 year olds, and is single and lives with his mother in the Santa Margarita neighborhood in the city of Carapeguà. 
Previously, he worked with his father in a leather fabric shop. When his father died, he became the owner. Now he wants to bring opportunitiy of work to help his family. 
He is considering working with someone else. With the loan he wants to buy leather for his shop.

loans.use: to buy leather for his shop

loans.name: Suma Sartasiñani Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Suma Sartasiñani”, que significa “nos levantaremos bien”, con 11 integrantes, están juntas hace aproximadamente 1 año, una de las integrantes es Blanca B. de 24 años, soltera, esta será su primera experiencia en el grupo y esta muy emocionada ya que siempre ha deseado hacer crecer su negocio, ella tiene el negocio de venta de verduras y quiere comprar choclo que es lo que más consume la gente. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de aluminio, chatarra, ollas, costura de polleras (falda para mujer), venta de comida, batidos y atención de tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería y materia prima.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca D. de Ramírez tiene 51 años de edad vive con su esposo el señor Florencio Ramírez que tiene 56 años, con quien tiene tres hijos, dos ya mayores de edad, uno en edad escolar y otro cursando una carrera universitaria, viven en su casa propia donde tiene una despensa, la que formaron gracias al sacrificio de su esposo quien tenia un pequeño ahorro. 


Empezaron con el negocio en el año 2000, y desde entonces han podido llevarlo adelante con mucho esfuerzo, su esposo quien también se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una propiedad de una hectárea en donde realiza cultivos de cañas de Azúcar. 
En el año 2006, se hicieron cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya y gracias a los créditos recibidos su negocio va creciendo motivo por el cual agradece el apoyo brindado por nuestra institución. 
El préstamo que solicita es para poder surtir mas de mercaderías su negocio ya que va en aumenta clientela.

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderías: Azúcar, Arroz, Fideos, Aceite, Leche y Otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of necessary goods such as flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs) Group

texts.en:
This group of women is from the San Pedro district of Encarnación. The members of the group work in a variety of businesses and industries, including cosmetics sales, hair salons, restaurants, food sales, lingerie sales, and the garment industry. They will receive different loan amounts, each between 300,000 and 500,000.

Each woman will apply her individual loan toward her business needs.

loans.use: To strengthen the businesses of the women in this group

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad M. is from the village of Naga,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Felicidad is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felicidad owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Romilio

texts.en:
Mr. Romilio Rivas is 54 years old and is married to Mrs. Carmen Acuna Rivas. They live in their own home in Hohenau. 

Mr. Romilio has been devoted to peanut candy sales for quite some time with his wife. They are both responsible for the making and distribution of the peanut candy. Many customers consistently buy their product, and the product is also distributed to other kiosks and stores. The couple operate a small kiosk from their home that is run by Mrs. Carmen. Through this work, they have been able to succeed and grow a microentreprise. The demand for good quality products by customers continues to grow, which helps them maintain their home and cover other expenses that may come up. 

They are requesting credit to buy more supplies for candy, so they can fill orders and not fail customers. The amount requested is Gs. 3,000,000.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Estela Vallejo V., age 29, owns an attractive beauty salon that is located in the city center. She has been a hairdresser for over three years and has many clients. Through this work, she can cover household expenditures and other expenses. She supports one son, who lives with her, and she owns her own home.

She is applying for credit to buy more supplies and items for her salon.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her salon

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro G. and Margarita Lopez have been married for more than 30 years. They live in their own home, which is located a few kilometers away from the city. The couple have grown children who contribute to the household income.

Pedro, age 56, has owned a sausage factory for over 25 years. The factory is operated by Pedro and his children. He has formed a strong clientele over many years, making his business sustainable and profitable.

Pedro needs credit to purchase raw materials to manufacture his products, which are in high demand because they are of good quality.

loans.use: To buy raw materials that will be used in the factory

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Group

texts.en:
This group of women formed in the San Miguel neighborhood through a contact at Fundacion Paraguaya. All its members are in sales, but they deal in a variety of products, such as cafeteria meals, cosmetics, dairy products, and cleaning supplies.

Each woman will receive a different loan amount, between 300,000 to 2,000,000, and will apply it toward her own business activities.

loans.use: To purchase food items, yarn, cosmetics, and other supplies for sale

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio Gimenez, age 42, is lives in his own home in the San Isidro district of Encarnacion with his wife, Mrs. Pearl Balmori, age 39, and their three school-aged children.

For over eight years, Rogelio has been operating a store from his residence with his wife and children. He would like to buy low-priced, high-quality merchandise from Posadas, Argentina, to sell in his store and in other stores in the area in hopes of generating more profit.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale in his shop and in other area shops

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. lives in the village of Brgy. Camba-og, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Analyn is 34 years old.  She is married to Jose Hernal, who presently operates a Tangkop business, which is a kind of fishing using a fish trap in deeper water just off the shoreline. Food is placed inside the trap to attract the fish, crabs and shrimp. After an hour, whatever is in the center of the maze-like cage is harvested. The couple has 3 children who are 12 to 17 years old. 

Based on experience,  Analyn knew that she could not rely on her husband's income from the Tangkop or fish trap because it is seasonal and the catch can sometimes be erratic. During stormy weather, her husband could not go to his fish trap and collect the catch. This is the reason why Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 - to be able to borrow money to add to her capital and start a general store which could provide her family with a more steady daily income. 

Because of Analyn's regular income from her business, she could send their children to school and also provide for the daily household expenses. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000 from her general store. Having her own income has gone a long way in improving the quality of life of the M. family.

Analyn's credit history with Kiva's partner NWTF-Project Dungganon has been good. She always pays her dues on time and completely pays off her loan within the loan term. Her last loan, which was her 12th from NWTF-PD -- amounting to PHP 17,000 -- was invested in her general store. She industriously paid her weekly installments.  Now that she has paid it off, she is borrowing her next cycle loan of PHP 19,000 to fix her husband's fish trap so that he can continue with his fishing business. 

They intend to use the profits from this loan to start a rice retailing business to further increase their income and save up for their children's college education. 

Analyn is shown here in front of her General Store as it is quite difficult to photograph her in the middle of the sea where her husband's Tangkop or fish trap is located.
 
About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Maintenance of Tangkop (fish cage)

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana Judith M. D. tiene 29 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos a su familia, ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que cursa el 5 grado de primaria. Ana tiene toda la fortaleza para salir adelante por lo que cada día fue ganando clientes  y con la confianza que les brinda todo se hace mucho más fácil para ofertarles lo que desean. En la actualidad continua con este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, joyas, cosméticos, cremas, colonias y calzado. Como toda persona tiene sus sueños, Ana sueña con mejorar los ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Judith M. D. is a 29-year-old woman who sells general merchandise for a living. She started this business more than 7 years ago because she has always liked retail. She decided to launch this business out of the need to earn an income for her family. She has one son who is currently in the fifth grade. Ana possesses the strength she needs to get ahead in life, which is why she started gaining customers every day. Because she trusts her customers, it is easier for her to offer them whatever they need. She is currently running this same business. She needs this loan to use as working capital to purchase clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, moisturizers, fragrances and footwear. Ana has dreams just like everyone else; she dreams of improving her family income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des matériels de coiffure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a moto-taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín Hernández tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, inicio este negocio por medio de su hermano, ya que le había  prestado el dinero necesario para iniciara su propio negocio, fue así que Noel logro realizar su propio negocio, el tenia que luchar ya que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Noel ha enfrentado muchos desafíos como fue el no tener le capital suficiente, y no tenia personas que le brindaran el apoyo para salir adelante, por lo que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de combustible, trasmayo y equipos de pesca. Su deseo es mejorar sus ventas y proporcionarle a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noel Agustín Hernández is 33 years old and his economic activity is artisan fishing. He has engaged in this profession for more than 17 years, having started the business with help from his brother, who loaned him the money needed to start his own business. This is how Noel came to own his own business; he had to struggle since he has two children to care for. Noel has faced many challenges such as not having enough capital and not having people to support his progress; for this reason, financing has been of great help to his business. Now he is seeking this loan as working capital for the purchase of fuel, nets, and fishing equipment. His wish is to improve his sales and provide his family with what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida A. is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Zenaida joined Kiva's partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools needed for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools needed for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat d'ignames

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen T. is from the village of P-4 Malibangcao Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Gretchen is married.

To make a living, Gretchen owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gretchen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gretchen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sokveng

texts.en:
Mr. Sokveng C., 57 (pictured with is wife), has been an assistant of commune leader for almost 25 years. His wife, Mrs. Ly Hak, 51, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1975 and have five children: 2 sons and 3 daughters. Two of them have full-time employment and other two are in school. The family lives along national road number one apporximetely15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sokveng’s children don’t have transportation for commuting to school and they spend a lot of money for traveling costs very often. Therefore, Sokveng is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.name: Mrs. Dy Soer Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty six people who are all living in Anhchanh village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Dy S. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 2-field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money for growing rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Horl Sarorn, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Dy S. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy farm supplies for growing rice.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en: Mrs. Soung L. lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Siem Rin, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they earn little income to support the family's living. In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Soung L. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 46 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom N. is a villager in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable to earn for living. In her cultivate rice, she has a problem because she does does not have enough money to expand for cultivating. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Patience is the key to success, is the guiding principle of Ginalyn R. who is from the village of Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is usually called Gina which is her nickname in their village. She is a college undergraduate and is married to Bonnie R.. They are blessed with three children; two of them are elementary student already. They wanted them to finish their studies someday so that they will find a stable job in the future. 
Despite our economic crisis, this couple is helping each other to earn income for their needs and to support their family financial needs especially their children’s education. Her husband works in a construction site at GMB Solano while Gina is engaged in fish vending. With a small working capital, she used to acquire fishes at Solano Public Market and sold in their village through house to house vending. Gina wanted to improve her business so that she can earn a higher income for her family. In this regard, she decided to join the KIVA loan program of ASKI where she could borrow a loan from lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital. She knows this would be of big help in the improvement of her livelihood project.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun S., age 44 (available in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Koem Khoem, 43, were married in 1987 and have four daughters. The eldest daughter was married and lives in the family home.  One is a garment factory worker and other two attend school. The family lives along national road number one apporximetely15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Oeun and her husband have been farming for about 20 years. They grow papaya, corn…etc. One of Oeun’s daughters just finished her baccalaureate degree and she wants to continue her studying at University in Phnom Penh, so Oeun is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to pay school fees for her daughter and she will use a part of her loan to farm as well.

loans.use: To pay school fee for her daughter and use for farming.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
"What you plant is what you reap," said Janet P., who is now 28 years old and already a mother. She lives with her family in Barangay Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. High school is her highest educational attainment since she got married at an early age. Her husband, James P., is now 26 years old and is working as a farmer. It is difficult for them to manage financially because neither of them has a stable job, but with the help of their parents, they survive.

At present, her husband is also sometimes hired as a house carpenter when not busy with farming; however, his income is not sufficient to finance all the needs of his family. In this regard, Janet decided to engage in a hog raising business to help her husband in generating income for their family needs. Janet wanted to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 as additional working capital for hog raising. She hopes to have a productive business in order to provide her family with a secure and comfortable living someday. She hopes that lenders will lend her the funds she is requesting for the improvement of her newly opened piggery business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Kim Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Nhor P. is a group leader of five members who all live in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she has a problem because her field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to her crop. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make more crops productive. Mrs. Kim Nhor P. is 32 years old widow with a child who is too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make more crops productive.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy C. is now 51 years old and she is married to Reynaldo. They are currently living harmoniously with their two children at Barangay Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. According to her, “Hard work and thriftiness are the keys to success”. Having this principle in life gives Judy guidance to work harder and economize as much as she can, to give her family a better and more successful living. Despite the hardship and difficulties of life, they work hard to earn and support the education of their children, for they want them to be successful in their studies someday.

Farming is their main source of living. They cultivate their farm land twice a year by planting rice, corn and some vegetables and root crops. As harvesting takes a long time, they needed to have a side line business to provide for their daily needs and support the financial needs of their children in school. In this regard, Judy tried to engage in selling food snacks in their village through house to house vending. When she found out that this was so beneficial to her customers, she planned to continue and strengthen the business. Because of financial difficulty, she came to join the Kiva loan program of ASKI where she could have the chance to avail of additional working capital of at least PHP5,000. She hopes to have the opportunity to enhance her business for the improvement of their poor living situation.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Western Poblacion Lopez Jaena. She is 45 years old. Cecilia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia raises and sells pigs. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Cecilia's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Iv Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of twenty-one people who live in Peam Prachum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sokhom I. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a farmer. She owns a piece of land on which she grows rice and vegetables. She has a problem because she does not have rice seed to sow on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed. She will use the rest of loan to buy a sewing machine for her child. Mrs. Sokhom I. is a 48-year-old widow. She has two children who are employed in a garment factory. 

Six members in this group loans have taken end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Borrowers with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term  loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and a sewing machine for her child.

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
Mr. Kimleng K., 40 (picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Ten, 42, live in a small village in suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for almost 21 years and have seven children. Two of them are garment factory worker, three are in school and other two are still young.
