Kimleng has been a truck driver for five years, while his wife has been faring for over 10 years. By the way, Kimleng’s two daughters, who are garment factory workers, have hairdressing skill and they want to launch their own business-operating beauty salon. 

Hence Kimleng is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to build a beauty salon and buy some materials for his daughters.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon for his daughters.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is known by her nickname, “Noring.” She is from the barangay (village) of Lactawan Solano in Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband, Romeo, is a tricycle driver in their barangay. Two of their children have finished their college studies and have their own families. Their youngest child is still studying in the tertiary level of education. 

Leonora is a market vendor. She sells smoked fish and vegetables, which helps her to earn an income. Despite her age, Leonora is still strong and determined to work hard to further improve her business. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that the more products she sells, the more income she will earn. She hopes that, with the continuous support of KIVA lenders, she will help to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.en:
“If you are responsible, you will be successful someday” says Ma. Celia P. of Barangay Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. 

Ma. Celia is 37 years old and has a high school education. Her parents could not afford to finance her studies in college, so she married early to Rodel P. from Solano Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with a child, Madelyn P., who is ten years old and in fourth grade in elementary school. She wants her child to become successful in her studies someday so that she will have a bright future.
 
Despite their poverty, the couple does their best to earn income so they can satisfy their daily basic needs and finance the schooling of their child. Ma. Celia's husband is a tricycle driver. She sells cooked snacks and vegetables from a simple vending stall in front of her house. She started her business with only  PHP 2,000 (~ $40 USD) in capital, which she used to buy goods for her food snack and vegetable vending business. 

Ma. Celia earns a weekly income of PHP 1,000 from her business, but she says that this is not enough, so she wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders to use as additional business capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Mary Rose and Giovani A. are a young couple who are raising their family in Barangay Tuao, North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 22 years old and  her husband is 24 years old. Neither of them finished college because they married at an early age. Their parents help them because they don’t have a stable source of income. It is difficult for them to find jobs because they did not graduate from college.

Her husband wants to work in construction at Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya. Mary Rose sells food in their village while taking good care of their two young children. She started the business with only PHP 2,000 (~ $40 USD) in business capital. She now earns a net income of PHP 500 each week which they use to pay for their daily needs. 

Mary Rose wants to have additional business capital to develop her food vending business. For this reason, Mary Rose would like to borrow PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders. She believes that she can earn a higher income and save for the future of their children with this loan.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Si Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Si Thai U. lives Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed to grow on the field. In order to solve this problem, she decided to request for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Phang Sarem, is a construction worker. Mrs. Si Thai U. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou Y., 44 (pictured with her daughter), was married in 1979, has four children: one son and three daughters. Three of them were married and live outside the family home. She lives a long national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh

Thou has been selling Khmer noodle for six years. Her husband is a disable person. The house where Thou lives, is old and breaks down in some parts. So, she wants to build the new one to stay but she doesn’t have money.

To respond her needs, Thou is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to make the building.

loans.use: To build a new house to stay.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita G. did not pursue her studies in college. She once worked as a maid in one of the rich family in Manila to help her parents earn a living. After many years of serving as a housemaid, she married Romeo G. and they are blessed with four children. They help each other to earn a living and support the studies of their children because they wanted them to become successful in the future. Her family lives peacefully in the village of Lactawan Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. 

Romeo, her husband, earns a daily income by operating a tricycle transport business. Because his business income was not sufficient, Merlita manages a tailoring business using her own knowledge and skills in sewing. She also raises hogs to provide her family with a better living. Her tailoring business is working well, but because she wants to improve and develop it, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from KIVA lenders to use as additional business capital. She knows that the amount she is borrowing will be very beneficial in making her business productive some day.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Makra

texts.en: Mrs. Makra C. is a farmer in Prey Moul village in Takeo province. She owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she needs some money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and fertilizer to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to buy pig food for her first child’s breeding pigs business. Her husband, Mr. Touch Saroin, is traditional musician. Mrs. Makra C. is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a pig breeder while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for plowing on the rice field, to buy fertilizer, and pig food for her first child’s breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Kim Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Hang R. lives in Srae Kaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to expand for her growing. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Siem Mahn, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kim Hang R. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school; one of whom is a monk and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request for a loan to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao V. is the leader of a group four members who live in Damnak Reachea Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. She has a problem because her soil is infertile and is damaging her crops. To resolve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kim Meng, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Sao V. is 34 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school.

All of the members of this group have taken end-of-term (EoT) loans. Borrowers with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term  loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
S., age 46, is married to Pum, age 47. She has three children, two of whom are employed as garment workers. The other one attends school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. 

S. has a plot of farming land. She and her husband have earned a better income since her first two children grew up and went to work. S. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work. Her husband also appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom Y. is a villager in Phnom Lorntas village in Takeo province. She owns a poultry business that breeds duck to make duck eggs to sell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Tith Ngoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. With the poultry business, Mrs. Rom Y. wants to expand it by purchasing 80 more ducks for breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase 80 more ducks for breeding and she would use the rest of loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H., age 40 (available in the picture with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sophea Chea, age 40, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 1999 and have four children: one son who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. And three daughters, two of them are in school and other one is still young.
 
Mao just started her business-selling fruits for one month. Her husband has been a chef for seven years. Mao is asking for her first loan of $500 to repair her motorbike and connect electricity from an electricity service to use in the family.

loans.use: To repair her motorbike and connect electricity from an electricity service to use in the family.

loans.name: Khean

texts.en: Mrs. Khean S. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Phnas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she needs some money to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support her paddy field. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Phem Hong, owns a poultry business. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a farmer and the remaining is attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Needs some money to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support her paddy field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin P., 36 and his wife, Mrs. Sovannak Chan, 39, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1984 and have three children: two daughters and one son. 

Sarin is a carpenter. His has been producing rice wine and raising pigs for 10 years.  He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and he will use a part of his loan to help his wife in raising pigs business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and help his wife in raising pigs business.

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsour S., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Champey Ngan, age 38, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1989 and have two daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home and other one stays at home.  
 
Kimsour has been selling groceries for 14 years. She buys grocery items from the Phnom Penh market to resell in her village. Her husband has full-time employment. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more grocery items to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Mrs. Samphos Soen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who are all living in Preak Ta Ong Ti 1 village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Samphos S. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is alS. a weaver. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving. Her husband, Mr. Sun Soeun, is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Samphos S. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is employed in Casino Club and the others are attending the local schoO..

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving.

loans.name: Mr. Hun Em Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eleven people who live in Preak Ta Ong Ti 1 Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Hun E. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Tum Hoeung, is a weaver. She needs more raw materials to support her business. Thus, Mr. Hun E. has decided to ask for a loan for his wife's business. He is 59 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a security guard and the other is enrolled in the local school. 

One member of this group loans has an end-of-term (EoT) loan; the rest have monthly payment loans. Borrowers with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term  loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his wife's weaving business

loans.name: Rich

texts.en:
Mr. Rich C., age 29 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Vannem Bou, age 26, were married in 2005 and have one son. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rich has been repairing sewing machines for 3 years. His wife has been a hairdresser for 2 months, but she doesn’t have enough materials for her business. So, Rich is asking for a loan of $1,000 so he wife can purchase materials for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his wife's beauty salon

loans.name: Doem

texts.en:
Mr. Doem K., age 67, and his wife, Mrs. Yorng Nao, age 57, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1971 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other two are construction workers. 

Doem has been selling cows and oxen for over 10 years, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He buys cows and oxen from provinces far away from his village, and then resells them near his home. 

Doem wants to expand his business so he can generate more income. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional cows and oxen to resell.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and oxen to resell

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap S., age 34, and her husband, Mr. Sina Poch, age 48, were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of the children attend the local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pheap has been selling fish for seven years. Her husband assists her in her business. Besides selling fish, the couple also grows rice on their farm.  

Pheap wants to supplement their income by starting a new business: producing rice wine. She will able to earn extra income. Pheap is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to build a shelter for producing rice wine and to purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and build a shelter for producing rice wine.

loans.name: Jambaldorj

texts.en:
O. is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Zavkhan Province in Western Mongolia. His oldest daughter attends the local secondary school and his youngest is in kindergarden. His wife works as a custodian at a local bank and is very supportive of her husband's business. 

O. works at a timber processing and lumber production center in his town. He is one of many self-employed entrepreneurs that have space at this center where they process lumber. O. currently works for one of these operators, using their tools to produce his product. Timber processing is a very important business in the area because lumber is a main material used in new home and fence construction. 

O. quickly realized the potential of this product. One load of timber brings in an average profit of 40,000 tugrugs (~about 28 USD) per load. For the future, O.'s dream is to buy his own tools and develop his skills so he can fully operate his own lumber production business. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase timber for his personal business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his lumber-processing business

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arkhangai Province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Batbaatar’s three youngest children attend high school. His oldest son helps him to operate a local car repair business.  

Batbaatar started his business in 2000 with working capital of 100,000 tugrug (~$70 USD). His business as grown substantially and he now more than 1,300,000 tugrug (~$914 USD) in working capital. Batbaatar has been working on cars since he was a child and, because of his many years of experience, he is known in his town for quality repairs. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1400 USD) loan to purchase more car repair supplies and tools.

loans.use: To purchase car repair supplies and tools.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Mrs. Khem P., 47, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun Thoek, 48, were married in 1985. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of them married and lives in separated house. The family lives in a small village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Khem has been a cleaner for five months. She works for a garment factory. Her husband has been a driver since he was married. The couple is in the process of building new house, but they don’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, Khem is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To finish her house building.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. The family all lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His three youngest children attend high school while his wife cares for the family’s livestock herd. Dorjsuren operates a mobile dairy trading business which sells the dairy products his wife prepares to local markets.  He started this business in 1990 with working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD) which has since reached 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD). In the 19 years of running his business, Dorjsuren has gained a reputation amongst his customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. He has also been able to gain a lot of business knowledge and experience in this long period of time. Dorjsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is a very hardworking and enterprising young woman. She is married with one child. She has been working in embroidery /needlework since1998 where she delivers her products to the shop for sales to help improve her living situation. Today, Ahlam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise to produce more products so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthou N., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sophois Chin, 25, were married in 2005 and just have a young son. They live in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthou has been driving Motor Remoque taxi for more than five years. He carries goods and people from his village to Takhmao market and back. A remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back. His wife stays at home to take care of their son. In the past, she used to be a garment factory worker. 

Chanthou is applying for her first loan of US$500 to build a fence around of his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around of his house.

loans.name: Naraa

texts.en:
Naraa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs Province in Western Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her children attend secondary school and her husband is a taxi driver. 

Naraa owns and operates a noodle shop in her town. She produces flour noodles that are used in many popular Mongolian dishes. Before she began her shop in 2008, Naraa operated a cashmere and materials supply business. She still sells some cashmere to supplement her income, but she is focused on growing and expanding her shop to include sausage processing. Her noodle shop has brought her a lot of success and business experience in a very short amount of time. For the future, Naraa is focused on expanding her noodle shop and beginning to make sausage. 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~$2100 USD) loan to purchase equipment and supplies for the new sausage shop.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies for the new sausage shop.

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Nahid is married and has five children. She is a teacher. Her husband is an assistant chef in Jerusalem. Currently, they live in a rented house. With their savings, they were able to buy a small apartment, but they need to finish it immediately to move to it before winter starts, because their rented house is not appropriate. 

Nahid approached FATEN for a loan to finance some of the last urgent finishing issues in their new house. She requested $1500 USD.

Nahid appears in the picture at her office in the school where she teaches.

loans.use: Housing

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children. She has been working in embroidery and needlework since 1990 to earn income and, along with her husband, to help satisfy the needs of the family. After this long experience, Samar is applying for a loan of $900 to buy merchandise so that she can participate in a summer symposium to present her hand-made collection.

loans.use: To participate in a summer symposium where she will present her hand-made collection

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng S., age 49, is newly married. She has four children from a previous marriage: two sons and two daughters. Two of them have full-time employment in a restaurant, and other one is a construction worker. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

For 30 years, Chheng has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Chheng is requesting her first loan of $800 in order to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Narandeger

texts.en: D. Narandeger lives with his wife in a house in Ulaanbaater, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, who is pregnant with their first child, is currently taking a break from her work as a hairdresser. Narandeger operates a cell-phone retail and repair business out of a rented room at Narantuul, the largest market in the city. The market is always very crowded and is a very profitable place to operate. He currently shares the room with a jeweler. Narandeger started his cell-phone business in 2004. He learned about cell-phone operation and repair from a close friend, and has gained much experience and skill since starting his business. Due to his successful location and increasing demand from his many customers, Narandeger feels it is time to expand his business. In the near future, he hopes to enlarge the room that he rents to allow him more selling space. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase more phones and supplies for his cell-phone business.

loans.use: to purchase more phones and supplies

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en: Mayada is a married woman and mother of 4 children who still went to school. She's 35 years old. She has been working as a home base wool tailor since 2000 and has 12 years of experience in this field. Today, Mayada is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase wools to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: purchase wools

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: N. Sergelen lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Mongolia's capital city of Ulaanbaatar. Sergelen's relatives currently own and operate a company that manufactures covers for gers. His wife works at the company as a seamstress, sewing the covers. Sergelen operates a ger cover selling business at Narantuul, the largest market in UB. He purchases the covers from his family's company and sells them out of a small workspace at the market.. Sergelen started his ger cover business in 2002 and has been successful. Due to the high traffic of the market and his ability to cheaply purchase ger covers from his relative's business, his earnings have been high. For the future, he hopes to one day start his own factory where he can produce his own ger covers to sell. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1760 USD) loan to purchase a car to use for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use for his business

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. In 2008, she and her husband decided to open a mini-market to help improve their living situation. Today, Saada is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more products and merchandise for the mini-market so she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more products and merchandise

loans.name: Roula

texts.en: Roula is a very talented young woman. She’s 18-years old and working as a hairdresser since 2008 and has 3 years of previous experience. Today, Roula is requesting to borrow $800 to renovate her shop in order to attract more clients and increase her business income.

loans.use: renovate her shop

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum N., age 36 and his wife, Mrs. Thida Khoun, age 37, have been married since 1994 and have three daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.   
 
Chhum has been selling Phaklov (meal that cook with port) in his village for 7 years. His wife is a hairdresser. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a cart to carry Phaklov for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to carry Phaklov (meal that cook with pork) for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Tegsh-Amgalan

texts.en: Tegsh-Amgalan is a 27-year-old single man who lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He operates a shoe repair business in a rented office near one of the town markets. Tegsh-Amgalan got started in the shoe repair business with his friend in 2007 and they were so successful that he was able to open his own shop in 2009. He started with a working capital of 80,000 tugrug (~56 USD) and quickly increased it to 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD). In the near future, Tegsh-Amgalan wants to own his own work space instead of renting. For now he is requesting a 600,000 (~420 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and materials.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and materials for his shoe repair business.

loans.name: Aamache

texts.en: Aamache is a 55-year-old married father of six children. He has owned a car mechanic shop since 2003 and this is how he supports his family. Aamache is requesting a $1,200 loan.  He will use it to buy more tools and to enlarge his shop to meet the needs of his clients so he can continue to earn a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his car mechanic shop.

loans.name: Davaadulam

texts.en: Davaadulam is 46 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local secondary school and her husband helps Davaadulam with her business where she sews lightweight leather coats that are suitable for the spring and fall weather here in Mongolia. She started her business in 2000 by hand making all of her own coat designs. Today, because of her poor eyesight, the construction of the coats is done by a local seamstress, but Davaadulam does all of the designing and selling of her coats. Her working capital recently reached 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) and her target market is local middle-aged women. Her designs are selling quite well, however she would like to expand her product line to include winter coats which can be sold at a higher price and would broaden her customer base. She would also like to eventually move to a workspace that is closer to her home and more comfortable than her current workspace. Davaadulam is requesting a 1,700,000 (~1200 USD) loan to purchase materials which can be used to help her begin making winter coats.

loans.use: to purchase materials which can be used to help her begin making winter coats.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is one of FATEN’s clients. She is a tailor and has received several loans, starting with 300 USD and has paid them all in full and on time. She first took her loans in a group, guaranteed by the other members, but this one will be an individual loan.

Ikhlas is married with five children aged 1 to 10 years old. Her husband is a daily worker in a restaurant.

When she started with FATEN a few years ago she had only one sewing machine. Now she has machines of different types like sewing, cleaning, etc. She works out of her house and she needs the loan to buy another machine. She appears in the photo sewing.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Horn Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loA. which consists of nineteen people and they all live in Peam Prachum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Horn B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Veth Hun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn for living conditions. In the rice growing, they face A. obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the paddy field. Thus, Mrs. Horn B. decided to ask for a loA. for this purpose. She is 51 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Twelve members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the paddy field.

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en: Saiid is a 25-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a car mechanic shop since 1999 where he services the neighboring villages. He has a great demand for his shop thus he wants to borrow $1,200 to buy more spare parts in order to be in requisition of his clients.

loans.use: buy more spare parts

loans.name: Sengemaa

texts.en: Sengemaa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of her children are studying at university while her youngest child is in secondary school. Sengema owns a successful local dairy trading business in her town .  Because her husband is handicapped, this business is the sole income for the family. She started her business in 2006 with working capital of 60,000 tugrug (~42 USD). Since then, her business has improved and now her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD). Her dream is to buy a bigger ger so that her large family will be more comfortable. She is requesting a 550,000 tugrug (~380 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Siya

texts.en:
Mrs. Siya S., 54 and her husband, Mr. Vandy Phoung, 55, were married in 1985 and have three children: two daughters and one son, two of them are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Siya has been raising pigs for almost 2 years, while her husband has been a farmer for over 5 years. He grows rice and vegetables for food. Siya is requesting her first loan of $500 to build pigpen for her pigs.

loans.use: To build pigpen for her pigs.

loans.name: Nawaret

texts.en: Nawaret is a 55-year-old single woman who lives on her own. She has owned a tailoring factory since 1997, earning income to provide a better life for herself. Today, Nawaret is asking for a loan of $1,000 to perform maintenance on the machines in her factory.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on the machines in her factory.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en: Enkhtuvshin is 26 years old and lives with his wife and four-year-old son in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Enkhtuvshin owns a woodworking business in town and his wife helps him run the business. He usually makes wooden furniture for gers. He began his business in 2006 with working capital of 200,000 tugrug (~140 USD) and has since grown the working capital to 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD). Enkhtuvshin’s products are known through town for their high quality and durability. He is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~630 USD) loan to purchase more wood in order to make more products and increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more wood.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and three brothers. He has owned a sawmill shop since 2000 to help his father provide good living conditions for their family. Today, Ali is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase more tools in order to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase more tools.

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Davaajav is 23 years old and lives in a house in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She was able to build her own home because of the success she has achieved by running her consumer goods trading business. She started her business in 2006 with working capital of 320,000 tugrug (~220 USD) which has increased to 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) since. The increased profits are due to her good business skills and good customer service. She has cultivated very good relationships with both her customers and suppliers and believes that these relationships are the key to her success. Davaajav would like to expand her product offerings and is therefore requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to buy a greater variety of products in which to sell.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products in which to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Yart Phin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group loan is for 23 people living in Peam Prachum village in Kandal province.  Mrs. Yart P. is the group leader and has selected the other members who will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes.   Mrs. Yart P. herself is a pig breeder and needs to purchase pig feed for her growing pigs. Her husband, Mr. Kang Rith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables.  Mrs. Yart P. is a 37-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school.  The other two are still too young to work or study. 

Most group members will have monthly payment loans.  Nine members will have end-of-term (EoT) loans which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are able.  Most clients start making payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Esaaf

texts.en: Isaaf is very hardworking and enterprising widow woman. She’s 63-year-old and living with her daughter. She works as a home-based cooker since 1995 where she preparing special food upon request of clients. Today, Issaf is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional merchandise shop to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income.

loans.use: buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Sdeung Sron Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdeung S. is the leader of this village bank group loan which consists of fifteen people located in Peam Prachum village in Kandal province.  All of the members will use the loan in different ways.  Mrs. Sdeung S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the last is a fisherman.  She is applying for a loan so she can buy rice seed to grow in the field, and buy nets for her child’s fishing business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. 

Most group members will have monthly payment loans. Four members will have end-of-term (EoT) loans which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are able. Most clients start making payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fishnet.

loans.name: Nivine

texts.en: Nivine is a 25-year-old single woman living with her parents and her aunt. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005, earning money to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Nivine is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy additionA. merchandise and help expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem P. lives in Banteay village in Takeo province. She owns a business which it is a fruit selling. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more coconuts and fruits to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Kim Heng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Mrs. Oem P. is 45 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is just 3 years old. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more coconuts and fruits to resell to earn more income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Mrs. Torn N. lives in Trapaing Trayoeung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pech Nouy, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support their household. In order to reach the living, Mrs. Torn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motor taxi driver. She is 37 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motor taxi driver.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 30-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working as a home-based hairdresser since 2002 to earn income to help her husband in the household. Today, Randa is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate the room specialized for her work to meet the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: renovate the room specialized for her work

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally P. is a villager in Pour Ta Mok village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Sroin, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, they earn not enough income to support their household. In order to improve the family living, Mrs. Phally P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse to use with a cart to transport passengers. Additionally, she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the paddy field.

Mrs. Phally P. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer while the other two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a horse to use with a cart to transport passengers.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 59-year-old widow woman living with her 2 children and sister.  She works as a tailor since 1994 and she is the one in addition to her sister to support her family with her business. After this long experience , Samira is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine instead of the used one to be able to satisfy the heavy demand of her  clients.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun N. lives in Chhmar Puon village in Kandal province. She is employed in the commune department. She is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. For this plantation, she needs some money to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the paddy field. She will use the rest of the money to buy a pump machine to pump water to support the rice field.

Mrs. Saroeun N. is a 53-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, hire laborers, and to buy pump machine.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. lives in Ta Norn village in Takeo province. She owns a business who is a weaver at home. She is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 32 years old single and she lives with her mother and two brothers. One of her brother is employed in a copy shop and the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Choeun S. is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: Is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.name: Waddad

texts.en: Waddad is a married woman with one child. She’s 49 years old. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 1995 and has 25 years of experience in this field. After this long experience, Waddad is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new sewing machine to be able to continue her work properly.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Mr. Horn N. is employed by an NGO in his district. He is 48 years old and lives in Trapaing Pong Toek village in Takeo province. His wife, Mrs. Khuon Nhy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. They have a child who is a farmer and helps with his mother’s work. Aside from the plantation, she also breeds pigs. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Horn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets, pig feed and fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, pig feed and fertilizer to support a rice field

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 48-year-old married woman who has four children. She works as a tailor since 2000 to help her husband in the household. Today, Leila is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase textiles and to make maintenance for the sewing machine in order to be able to serve her clients.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and to make maintenance for the sewing machine.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao C. lives in Trapaing Pong Toek village in Takeo province. She is employed in a development association in the local district. She is 41 years old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Mao C. is applying a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hire laborer to work on the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living.

loans.use: Is applying a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hire laborer to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 56-year-old married woman. She has owned a clothes shop since 2007 to provide, along with her children, better life conditions. Today, Elham is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 48-year-old married man with 4 children who still went to school. He has owned a van since 2004 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Imad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance in his van to be able to work properly and earn income.

loans.use: perform maintenance in his van

loans.name: Mrs. Sarem Long's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who are all living in Prech village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sarem L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sarem L. is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. S. Sei, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. He also owns a small business as a recycling middle man. Now this couple wants to expand their business. Thus, Mrs. Sarem L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fresh fruits and recycling to support the business. She hopes to earn income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 37 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer while the other three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Two members in this group loan are end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruits and recycling to support the business.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun L. is a single woman, 51 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province. Hun L. now lives with her sister, who works raising poultry and works with her in the farming business. Hun L. currently owns a cultivating machine that she uses for her farming. In addition, she uses her machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. Hun L. is taking out her loan to buy gasoline for her machine and she purposes to use the rest of the loan to accrue amount of fertilizers and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her machine

loans.name: Mrs. Noeurn Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of ten people and they all live in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noeurn K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to grow rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. Mrs. Noeurn K. is 51 years old and the mother of a child who is a musician.  

Nine members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeun P., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Bin, 40, were married in 1988. They have three children; one daughter who works in a garment factory. And two sons-one of them is a construction worker and other one is in school. The family lives in a small village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chhoeun has been working in province office for 21 years. In addition, he is a truck driver as well. His wife used to sell vegetables, but she has stopped the business and stays at home to take care of their children. Choeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Hamze

texts.en: Hamze is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents. He has a clothing shop and he is the one who supports his family with this business. He has been involved in this business for three years. In order to increase his sales and his income, Hamze is requesting to borrow $700 to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en: Taghrid is a 38-year-old married woman with one child. She has owned an accessories shop since 2001 called "Taghrid". Today, Taghrid is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional accessories and merchandise for her shop to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional accessories and merchandise

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Mr. Manh R., 25, lives in Siem Reap Province. He has owned a small shop in front of his home where he sells coffee and some cooking supplies to his neighbors who live near his house. Manh R. now lives with his wife who stays at home to assist him in selling his item. This couple was married years ago, but they have no child. Due to the lacking of capital, Manh R. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase more his inventory items to continue selling. The loan will provide this family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more his inventory items to continue selling

loans.name: Onn

texts.en: Onn T., 62, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her ten children. She has four married children who lives separately, while the remainder are staying in family home and working in a variety of jobs. Onn T. sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. She also goes them to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. She retails fish in the local market. Onn T. said that she finds it hard to commuting to buy fish or anywhere else, because she doesn't have a vehicle for riding needs. Therefore, she has decided to ask a loan on Kiva which she will uses to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: The smiling face person who appears in the picture over is S., age 49, married woman and mother. To earn a living, S. sells a variety kind of vegetable and some cakes to people who come to buy anything in the market. As another source of family income comes from her husband's driving a taxi. He is also a construction foreman. S. has given birth to eight children; two of whom are married and live away from home, while the others are working in various occupation. S. will be used her loan to buy a motor which she will use to cut down her transportation fees.

loans.use: To buy a motor which she will use to cut her transportation fees

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh E. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She always makes at least 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. In addition, this family cultivates a rice crop.

To help facilitate the hard labor of the farm work, Nhanh E. requests a loan on Kiva to be used to purchase a cow which she will use to plow her farmland.

The family has seven children, two of whom are garment workers in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers comme activités génératrices de revenus. 
Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 100 sacs de charbon de bois et une grande quantité de fruits et légumes. Les fruits et légumes et le charbon de bois sont achetés en détail dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur place à Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans  les activités et d’autres part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat de fruits, légumes et charbon de bois.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Tiessiri  sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 39 ans et 6 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers comme activités. 
Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 150 sacs de charbon de bois et une importante quantité de fruits et légumes. Les fruits, légumes et charbon de bois sont achetés en détail dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur place à Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 60.000 FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group of Tiessiri Association are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have six children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Konobougou in the sub-prefecture of Baroueli, region of Ségou in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other and run small convenience stores with diversified articles. These women have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their seventh group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use their loan to buy 150 sacks of charcoal and a large quantity of fruits and vegetables. They will buy these fruits, vegetables and charcoal in the surrounding villages and sell them in Konobougou to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs (US$133) each per month. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and spent part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and charcoal

loans.name: Djikiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djikiya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et  exercent comme activité le petit commerce d’articles divers. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 15 sacs de céréales et une grande quantité d’autres articles divers tels que les fruits, les légumes et les poulets au marché de Konobougou et environnants et sont revendus sur place à Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activés. 
Elles  ambitionnent de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Chata's Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 46 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parentés et font comme activités génératrices de revenus le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre et sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent d’acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, des chaussures pour hommes et femmes et des pièces de bazin, qui seront vendus à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans les activités et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group of Djiguisseme Association are married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Fana in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other and run small convenience stores with diversified articles. Four years ago these women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use their loan to buy large quantities of food condiments, shoes for men and women, and pieces of basin (a composite cloth made of linen and cotton). They sell their articles to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs (US$89) each per month. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and spent part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana,  préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent comme activités génératrices de revenus le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, des céréales, fruits et charbon de bois  en détail aux environs de Fana et sont revendus  sur place à  Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer non seulement les intérêts  de Soro Yiriwaso, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et aussi  réinvestir le reste dans les activités. Elles ambitionnent de diversifier leur commerce avec d’autres produits.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: We Will Overcome# 2 Group

texts.en:
Jebbeh J. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'We Will Over Come #2'. She is a high school graduate but couldn't continue her education due to poverty. Jebbeh is married  with 2 children, ages 4 and 7 years old, in kindergaten and 2nd grade.

Jebbeh buys fruits and vegetables like peppers, garden eggs (a sort of eggplant), cabbages, etc. wholesale and  sells them retail to the residents of Virginia where she lives. She has been taking care of her family by means of this business for 2 years, since she started this business.

Jebbeh always encourages her customers by adding a few extra vegetables and fruits to what they buy. She has hopes of expanding her business through savings and good management. The loan is needed in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

Jebbeh dreams of improving her own and her family's lives through her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ewui

texts.fr: Cette dame assure seule l’éducation de son jeune enfant, puisqu’elle n’est plus avec son mari. Pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à celui de son enfant, elle s’est lancée en 2005 dans la vente de pagnes de diverses qualités, des chaussures et sacs pour dames. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et elle est à présent connue de beaucoup de clientes. Elle les accueille bien, c’est pourquoi elles lui sont toujours fidèles. Dès qu’elle reçoit de nouveaux arrivages, elle contacte par téléphone ses meilleures clientes. Actuellement elle a besoin de constituer de nouveaux stocks ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 pagnes Super Wax, 10 pagnes Hitarget, 10 pagnes Phoenix, 12 cartons de chaussures diverses et 10 cartons de sacs de sortie.

loans.use: Achat de sacs, de chaussures et de pagnes

loans.name: Lina Armando

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu na cidade de Maputo no bairro Luis Cabral tem 43 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 17 e 25 anos. Fez 9 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores, vive na casa própria com os filhos mais uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores na cidade de Maputo e casou se aos 20 anos com o ex-marido que lhe transferiu e passaram a viver juntos num outro bairro da cidade. O casamento só durou cerca de 20 anos. Foi nessa altura que a lina comprou um imóvel na cidade onde passou a viver. Mais tarde vendeu a casa e construiu uma outra no Bairro de infulene, onde vive ate hoje.

Nunca contraiu empréstimos em bancos ou instituições similares. Foi através dos seus condiscípulos da igreja que teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema e tendo decidido aproximar solicitando o presente empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos no seu estabelecimento (arroz, farinha, sabão e outros). Rende aprox. 5.000,00MT por mês, provenientes das vendas. Tem 12 anos de experiência nesta actividade e trabalha sozinha, sem empregados.

Lina acha que o seu negocio vai conhecer um crescimento em termos do volume, para satisfazer a demanda e rendimento para o beneficio familiar.
Propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o intuito de melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 43 years old and a single mother of 3 children with ages between 17 and 25. She finished 9th grade but had to drop school due to her parent's financial difficulties. She lives with her children plus a niece she also supports. She was married for 20 years and after her divorce she moved to a different neighborhood, bought a house and kept investing in her business. She has never made loans and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$550) to buy food products like rice, flour and soap, and reselling them at the store she owns, where she makes around 5.000,00MT (U$180) per month in profit. She's been doing it for 12 years and has no employees. Lina believes her business is growing and she foresees good sales ahead. She hopes to have no problems in paying the loan back so she can apply for others in order to keep improving her business and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic food products for reselling

loans.name: Virginia Lourenco

texts.pt:
Virginia nasceu no distrito nortenho da província de Maputo, Manhica. Tem 39 anos de idade, casado e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 4 e 14 anos. Todos aqueles que têm idade, freqüentam escolas Publicas de Boane. Virginia fez somente 7 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vivem na casa própria com seu marido, filhos mais dois netos sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na vila de boane porque seus pais saíram do distrito natal quando ela tinha 2 anos de vida. É comerciante e dona do negocio há mais de 23 anos e trabalha sozinha.
O seu marido é militar afecto no quartel de Boane com salário mensal de 4.000,00MT.
Virginia rende através das vendas que efectua mensalmente, cerca de 3.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e juntamente com o marido vem construindo uma casa de alvenaria.

Nunca tinha contraído empréstimos em bancos, e através das informações obtidas aos vizinhos, aproximou a Hluvuku-Adsema e solicita o presente empréstimo (pela terceira vez) no valor de 13.000,00t para compra de material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros). Os outros créditos foram para a mesma actividade e pagos sem problemas nos valores de 7.000,00MT e 16.000,00MT.

Propõe se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos para cumprir o objectivo futuro de ver a casa concluída e bem apetrechada.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in Manhica, the northern district of the province of Maputo. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of the school-aged children attend public schools in Boane. Virginia only attended school until the seventh grade. She stopped attending due to her parents financial situation. She owns her home and lives there with her husband and children, as well as two grandchildren whom she supports. . She grew up in Boane because her parents left her native district when she was 2 years old. She is a business woman and has owned a shop for the past 23 years. She works alone. Her husband is in the military and works in the Boane barracks earning 4.000,00MT per month. Virginia earns money from her monthly sales, around 3.000,00MT which she uses to support her family. She and her husband are building a cement block home. She has never had a bank loan before. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from neighbors and is requesting her third loan, for 13.000,00 for the purchase of construction materials (cement, stones, sand, etc.) Her previous loans were for the same purpose in the amounts of 7.000,00MT and 16.000,00MT, which were paid without any issues. She plans to pay back the loan without incident to be able to access further loans and achieve her goal of seeing her house finished and equipped.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Adjovi Nyuako

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Il y a 2 ans, elle a ouvert une cantine de restauration dans l’enceinte du bâtiment de la préfecture du Golfe à Lomé. Son restaurant a pour principaux clients les fonctionnaires de l’administration publique qui apprécient particulièrement sa cuisine. Elle vend aussi des boissons et d’autres accompagnements. Elle souhaite en ce moment acheter des casiers de boissons et des produits  pour préparer des sauces pour la cuisine. C’est pour cela qu’elle espère bénéficier d’un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 casiers de bières et 10 casiers de sucreries. Elle a aussi besoin de 05 cartons de la viande de poulets et 02 cartons de poissons. Elle compte sur la fidélité de sa clientèle pour respecter son échéancier de remboursement.
texts.en:
Adjovi Nyuako K. is married and the mother of two children. Two years ago, she opened a canteen in the administration building of the Prefecture of the Golfe in Lomé. Her main clients are the civil servants of the Prefecture who particularly enjoy her cooking. She sells also drinks and other accompaniments.

Adjovi wants to buy now crates of drinks and ingredients for her sauces. That is why she applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 10 crates of beer and 10 crates of soft drinks. She needs also 5 boxes of chicken meat and 2 boxes of fish. She relies on her faithful customers to repay her loan on schedule.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks and boxes of chicken meat and fish

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de Miria sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  7 sacs de céréales, 30 sacs de charbon de bois et beaucoup d’autres articles dans les villages environnants qui seront revendus sur place à Konobougou, en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 32 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ambitionnent diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Inacio Francisco

texts.pt:
Inácio nasceu na província central de Sofala, no distrito de Marromeu, tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos com 3 e 7 anos de idade. O mais velho freqüenta escola. Fez nível médio de Magistério Primário há 13 anos no instituto no distrito da Manhica e leciona na Escola primaria completa de Boane com salário mensal de 7.500m, 00mt que aplica no sustento da família (esposa e filhos). Vive na casa própria na vila de campoane, distrito de boane.

Saiu de Marromeu juntamente com os pais no ano de 1988 para a vila de Boane e em 2000 construiu a sua própria casa.
Já teve empréstimo para compra de Bens de consumo, num banco comercial (BIM) e decidiu não continuar com o banco para novos empréstimos por ter enfrentado dificuldades para pagar prestações  foras das suas capacidades e durante muito tempo.

Após informações obtidas acerca das actividades da hluvuku através de colegas, decidiu aproximar a instituição solicitando o presente empréstimo no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia e outros).
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais crédito com intuito de terminar a casa posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Inácio was born in the central province of Sofala in the Marromeu district. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 7. His older child attends school. He completed a degree in Elementary Education 13 years ago in a school in the Manhica district. He teaches at the elementary school in Boane, earning 7.500,00MT per month, which he uses to support his wife and children. He owns his own home in Campoane in the Boane district. He left Marromeu along with his parents in 1988 to move to Boane and he built his own home in 2000. He previously had a loan to purchase consumer goods through a commercial bank (BIM) and decided not to continue with the bank for additional loans because he had faced difficulties making payments beyond his means for a long time. Upon learning about Hluvuku from colleagues, he decided to request a loan. This loan is for 12.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.) He plans to pay back the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans with the goals of finishing his house and equipping it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, stones, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 39 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font comme activités génératrices de revenus le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec le nouveau prêt les femmes désirent acheter, une grosse quantité de produits cosmétiques, des habits pour hommes et femmes à Bamako, des paquets de condiments alimentaires et des sacs de charbon de bois, qui seront revendus sur place à Baroueli et à Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Sabougnouma Group (the “good cause”) are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have three children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the prefecture of Baroueli, region of Ségou in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other and run small convenience stores with diversified articles. These women have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their sixth group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

These women will use their new loan to buy large quantities of cosmetics, clothes for men and women, food condiments and charcoal in Bamako. They will sell these articles in Baroueli and Konobougou to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average profit of 25,000 CFA francs (US$55) each per month. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and spent part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer
