The women started to work by selling beer and, later, using their own resources, they have been able to enlarge the business.

The establishment has many customers due to the quality of service and the good flavor of the dishes that Clotilde prepares. Her potential customers are the farm workers who work nearby, and even people from the city, including some tourists.

With earnings from this business, Clotilde helps her parents by sending them money, since they are of advanced age and can no longer work. Everyday she gives her best to advance her business. One fruit of this business is that they have begun constructing a small room on the second floor for attending to customers.

Clotilde is requesting a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternative for $700, to be used in buying construction materials to finish the room already under construction.

She dreams of making her establishment grow and having her own home. Clotilde is hardworking and enterprising, and her customers and neighbors consider her a responsible and amiable person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR CONSTRUCTING A ROOM FOR SERVING CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hermana en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas desde hace 15 años, empezó trabajando en un taller de costura como operaria y luego pudo independizarse, actualmente confecciona prendas en base a pedidos y con los ingresos percibidos en este negocio sostiene la economía familiar.

La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que tenga bastante demanda por parte de sus clientes, pero las máquinas de coser con las que trabaja no son adecuadas y continuamente están fallando, por lo que no le garantizan una producción eficiente, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de una máquina de coser industrial.

Manuela sueña con extender su negocio y hacer un taller más grande para dar trabajo a otras mujeres y enseñarles a usar su creatividad y paciencia en la confección de prendas de vestir, otro de sus sueños es vender los productos de este taller en su propia tienda de ropa.

Ella es una mujer reponsable, trabajadora y sus clientes siempre están contentas con la calidad de las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en:
Manuela is 58 years old, single and lives with her sister in the city of Chiclayo. Sh has been making clothes for women since she was 15. She began work in a sewing workshop as a sewing machine operator and later she was able to start working independently. She currently makes clothes to order and with the income she receives from this business she is able to keep up the family's costs. The quality with which she carries out her work has resulted in a lot of demand from her customers, however the sewing machines that she works with are of poor quality and are continually breaking down. Because of this she cannot guarantee efficient production, so for this reason she is now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles that she intends to use to buy an industrial sewing machine. Manuela dreams of extending her business and creating a bigger workship to provide employment for other women and teach them to use their creativity and patience by making items of clothing. Another dream of hers is to sell the products she makes in her workshop in her own clothing store. Manuela is a responsible, hardworking woman, and her customers are always happy with the quality of clothes that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el centro poblado Chosica del Norte, distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene en su casa un horno en el cual elabora pan, desde hace tres años su familia se sostiene económicamente con esta actividad, su esposo solía trabajar como obrero de construcción civil, pero debido a su avanzada edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y retomar su oficio de panadero.

Gregoria trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 6 de la tarde hasta muy avanzada la noche amasando los ingredientes para la elaboración del pan, luego lo hornean en la madrugada para sacarlo a la venta. Todos los días sus dos hijos menores  salen en bicicleta a las 5.30 de la madrugada para distribuir el pan elaborado a los clientes y después de terminada esta labor van a la escuela.

Los continuos incrementos de precio de los insumos que utiliza regularmente en la elaboración de los panes (harina, manteca y leña para su horno), han hecho que lo percibido diariamente en el negocio no sea suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, por este motivo Gregoria se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles, que piensa invertir en la compra de más insumos para ampliar su negocio.

Gregoria sueña con terminar de construir su casa y con que sus dos últimos hijos puedan  estudiar alguna carrera técnica, ella es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a mother of a family, 55 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the centre of the village Chosica del Norte, district of La Victoria, located 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In her home she has an oven that she uses to make bread, which has supported her family economically for the last three years. Her husband used to work as a civil construction worker, but due to his age he had to quit his job and take up his previous profession as a baker. Gregoria works with her husband from 6 in the evening until very late in the night, mixing the ingredients to make bread and then baking early in the morning before taking it out to sell. Every day her two youngest children leave the house by bicycle at 5.30 in the morning to distribute bread to the customers and then go on to school once they have finished. The continual increase in the price of the supplies that Gregoria regularly uses to make bread (flour, butter and wood for the oven) has meant that the business' daily income is not enough to cover all the family's costs. For this reason, she has seen the need to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1100 nuevos soles, which she intends to invest in the purchase of more supplies to expand her business. Gregoria dreams of being able to finish building her house and for her two youngest children to study a technical degree. She is a hardworking, honest woman who is very loved by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make bread

location.town: Chosica del Norte - La Victoria - Chiclayo

loans.name: Maria Asunta

texts.es:
La socia Maria Asunta, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, la socia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores y ella es madre y padre para sus menores hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de animales menores, nuestra socia, compra animales al por mayor y menor, los hace reproducir y a sus ves los vende, entre los animales que ella cría están, los cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos, la socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción en la adquisición de más animales menores.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Maria Asunta is from the district of Anta, province of Anta, department of Cusco, located an hour and ten minutes from the province of Cusco.

Our member is 30 years old and lives in the country community of Inquilpata. She is a single mother of two children. Maria is mother and father for her young children and varies their activities at home by raising small animals. She buys the animals wholesale and retail, breeds them and sells them. Among the animals that she raises are cuyes (a hamster-like animal), poultry and pigs. She needs a loan to increase production by purchasing more young animals.

Our member is thankful and values the loan received and is committed to pay the established loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jesualina

texts.es:
La socia Jesualina, es  natural del distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, la socia tiene 2 hijos, ella  es  conviviente y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de quesos, nuestra socia vende en la feria de Inquilpata todos los viernes sus quesos, la socia desea el préstamo para poder adquirir mayor número de quesos y así tener un mayor y mejor ingresos económico.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, en concha calle;  ella tiene 33 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella  compra y vende animales menores, entre los que se tiene a los cuyes, las aves de corral, chanchos pequeños. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar más animalitos menores y así mejorar su producción y su futura venta.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Rosa Elena, is a native of Anta District, Anta Province, Department of Cusco. This area is located an hour and ten minutes away from Cusco Province.

Rosa Elena lives on Concha Street in the rural community of Inquilpata. She is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosa Elena divides her time between doing her household chores and managing her small business of buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, poultry, and piglets. She needs a loan to buy more animals so that she can improve her production and future sales.

Rosa Elena values and appreciates the opportunity to receive a loan and promises to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more animals

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 40 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos y es casada, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales menores, ella los compra de la feria de Inquilpata y los cuida, reproducen y vende, la socia también vende chicha, esta es una bebida a base de maíz fermentado que se tomaba en el tiempo de los incas y hasta la fecha sigue siendo la bebida favorita y natural de los andes de Perú.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es casada  y tiene 2 hijos ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder implementar sus tienda con mas productos básicos.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha comes from the Anta District, Anta Province, in the Department of Cusco, which is 1h 10 from the Province of Cusco. She lives in the Inquilpata community, is 33 years old, is married, and has two children. She alternates her homemaking activities with her retail business - a small grocery store. She is asking for a loan to stock up her store with basic supplies. Martha appreciates and is grateful for the loan granted through this medium. She commits to pay her installments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia Ricardina, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales ovinos, nuestra socia los compra en la feria de Inquilpata y los engorda y luego los vende a mejor precio, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y de este modo tener mayor productividad.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ricardina comes from the Anta District, Anta Province, in the Department of Cusco, located 1h 10 from the Province of Cusco. She lives in the Inquilpata community, is 55 years old, is married, and has two children. She alternates her homemaking activities with her business - buying and selling sheep. She buys animals at the Inquilpata market, fattens them, then sells them at a better price. She is asking for a loan to reinvest in her business and therefore increase her productivity. Ricardina appreciates and is grateful for the loan granted through this medium, and promises to pay her installments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.es:
La socia Sinforosa, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, nuestra socia tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, ella alterna sus labores con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende granos, todo tipo de maíz, lentejas, habas, frijoles, la socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su pequeña tiendita y surtir sus granos, ella trabaja muchos años en esto y conoce el negocio muy bien.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 4 años de edad en el caserio La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene un pequeño bar – restaurant que funciona al lado de su casa, este negocio actualmente constituye la única fuente de ingreso económico de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente cono obrero agrícola.

Este negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente el poco mobiliario (sillas, mesas) con el que cuenta, no le basta para atender a los clientes que vienen a solicitar el buen servicio que brinda, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mobiliario para ampliar la capacidad de atención en su establecimiento.

María sueña con mejorar completamente la infraestructura de su negocio para ofrecer un buen servicio y empezar a atender a diversos turistas que van a la zona a visitar la reserva natural de Bosques de Pómac. Además desea darle a sus hijos en el futuro la oprtunidad de estudiar alguna carrera técnica con la cual puedan ganarse la vida.

María es una mujer alegre y servicial, sus vecinos y clientes la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona responsable y de buena sazón en la cocina.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children (ages 16, 15, and 4) in the hamlet of La Zaranda, Pítipo District, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. María has had a small restaurant/bar for the past three years, which operates next to her home. At present, this business is the family's only source of income since María's husband works on and off as an agricultural laborer. This business has been growing steadily, and the few tables and chairs in it are not enough to accommodate the many clients that come to enjoy the great service it provides. Therefore, for the first time, María finds herself asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, a PEN 2,500 loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of furniture to increase the service capacity of her establishment. María dreams of making her business infrastructure better to offer good service and to start serving tourists who come to the area to visit the natural reserve of the Pómac forests. In the future, she would also like to provide her kids with the opportunity to study a technical career with which they can earn a living. María is a happy-go-lucky, helpful woman; her neighbors and clients love her and think she is a responsible woman, and that she has great spice in the kitchen!

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying furniture to expand her business

loans.name: Jeronima

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia Irma, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia Mariela, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, la socia tiene 29 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo, nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra cuyes, aves de corral y otros animalitos en la feria de Inquilpata que se realiza todos los viernes y una vez que se reproducen ella los vende, la socia requiere el préstamo para reinvertir en la compra de sus animalitos y así incrementar sus ganancias

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.fr: Nicolas H. est un homme âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Badou, une ville située à 110 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur de café et cacao. Il exerce cette activité plus de 10 ans.  Avec ce crédit, Nicolas préfère faire le stock de ces produits en vue de les revendre au moment de pénurie vu la chute du prix du café et du cacao. Avec ces bénéfices, il souhaiterait exporter lui-même ces produits en créant sa propre société qui sera dénommée « ELAGNO ».

loans.name: Krub

texts.en: K. is 52 years old, married, and has eleven children, one who is married and ten who live at home. He grows vegetables and rice, and sells them to other sources for income in Khnar Village in the Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife almost 30 years earns around $3 per day. Two of his sons are employed as construction workers and another raises pigs and poultry for sale. With his large family, K. works almost everyday to generate revenues for to support his family's living. K. said that he is always paid a lot of money for taxi because he doesn't have his own vehicle for riding so he has decided to ask a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike.

Carlos posee su propio negocio hace once años donde ofrece servicios de impresión, El negocio de Carlos tiene una buena ubicación ya que se encuentra en una zona de mucha afluencia y comercio, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio

texts.es: Norma Beatriz O. G., reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Norma tiene 22 años de edad vive junto a su esposo quien es comerciante. Norma esta recién casada con Alberto,  el deseo de la joven pareja  es poder estabilizarse económicamente para poder tener un bebe, para ello necesitan trabajar mucho y así poder hacerse de unos ahorros, Norma tiene un comedor que le genera buenos ingresos; el destino del crédito que solicita Norma lo utilizara para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos, para obtener mayores ventas.

loans.name: Sandra Oralia

texts.es: Sandra Oralia L. C. de 47 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. Sandra es madre soltera tiene una hija llamada Flor de María quien es el orgullo de Sandra, Flor estudio un técnico y actualmente trabaja como organizadora de eventos, para Sandra ha sido un logro ver a su hija crecer y hacer de ella una mujer honesta y responsable, Sandra ha sacado a su hija adelante a través de su trabajos realizados de la confección de ropa a la medida, la cual tiene ubicada desde su casa, el crédito que Sandra solicita es para comprar tela para la producción de ropa.

loans.use: Comprar tela

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Julia Patricia E. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Julia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos William de 21 años, Luis de 16 años y Brenda de 13 años de edad. Julia ha sacado a su familia adelante brindándoles estudios a sus tres hijos y una estabilidad familiar, Julia posee una panadería, que distribuye a varias tiendas cercanas, el crédito que Julia solicita es para comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción de pan.
texts.en:
Julia Patricia E. lives in the town of Ilopango, which is in the department of San Salvador. She is 44 years old and a single mother with 3 children – William (age 21), Luis (age 16), and Brenda (age 13). Julia strives to move her family forward by providing her children with an education and a stable family life. She owns a bakery and distributes her goods to several nearby shops.

Julia is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she increase her bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making bread

loans.name: Agaster

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Agaster M. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 14 and 30. Agaster has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 2003. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Agaster currently earns about 150 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her products. Agaster thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci J. reside en Tecoluca el departamento de San Vicente. Ana tiene 32 años de edad se encuentra casada con Oscar quien trabaja como jornalero, juntos han cuidado de sus tres hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, y  ahora el nuevo integrante de la familia de tan solo15 meses . Ana tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio, el cual lleva siete años al servicio de sus clientes, Ana elabora tortillas desde su casa con un sabor singular por el cual sus clientes la prefieren, ya que se cocinan a leña y comal, una práctica ya poco utilizada para muchos negocios de los mismos. El crédito que Ana solicita es para comprar maíz y leña.

loans.use: Compra leña y maiz

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve quality of her business place

loans.name: Irayda América

texts.es: Irayda América R. F. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Irayda tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija la pequeña Doris de 6 años estudiante de parvularia. Irayda se dedica a la costura elaborando ropa y accesorios para el hogar, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la cual quiere mejorar a través de este crédito, ya que no cuenta con el suficiente espacio para trabajar y desea construir un pequeño cuarto para instalar su negocio

loans.use: construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Rosa Eriselda

texts.es: Rosa Eriselda M. G. reside en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Rosa tiene 43 años de edad vive con su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico y sus tres hijos. Rosa posee su negocio donde elabora pupusas y tortillas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un chalet donde le permite ser vista por muchos aunque su clientela es muy estable ya que cuenta con dieciséis años de experiencia dedicándose a su negocio. El crédito que solicita Rosa es para comprar matería prima para aumentar su producción de pupusas y tortillas.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Blanca vive con su esposo José Luis y sus cuatro hijos D. 12,10,8 y 5 años D. edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Blanca y su esposo como todos los padres quieren darle lo mejor a su hijos y es por ello que Blanca está en busca D. un  crecimiento en su negocio, que le permita aumentar su ingresos, ella posee su negocio en su domicilio donD. venD. productos D. consumo y su nuevo adquisición en productos D. papelería, el crédito que Blanca solicita es para solidificar su negocio surtiéndolo D. variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango, which is in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband José Luis and her four school-aged children (ages 12, 10, 8, and 5). Like all parents, Blanca and her husband want to proviD. the best for their children. For this reason, she is looking to expand her business and generate more earnings.

Blanca operates a store out of her home where she sells consumer products and newly acquired paper products. She is requesting a loan to solidify her business by restocking it with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve quality of her business place

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es: Julia Esperanza G.

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción M. D. A. resiD. en San Salvador  la capital del popularmente llamado Pulgarcito D. América. María tiene 55 años D. edad, vive con esposo don José y sus dos hijos D. 20 y 21 años D. edad estudiantes universitarios. Hace diez años María aprendió confección y costura, conocimientos con los cuales ahora María maneja su propio negocio desD. su casa elaborando variedad D. estilos en ropa a la medida, pero ahora María urge D. un crédito, ya que desea comprar tela para elaborar prendas, para ser comercializadas con clientes y vecinos D. su colonia.
texts.en:
María Concepción M. D. A. lives in the capital of San Salvador, which is popularly called “The Thumb of the Americas”. She is 55 years old and lives her husband Don José and her two children (ages 21 and 20) who are university students. Ten years ago, María learned how to sew and make dresses. Today she utilizes these skills and manages her own home business where she makes different styles of clothing.

Maria is in urgent need of a loan so that she can buy fabric to make garments that she can sell to customers and neighbors in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Eneas Elías

texts.es: Eneas Elías T. R. reside en el pintoresco departamento de Ahuachapán, Eneas se encuentra soltero, maneja su propio negocio una venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos, Los clientes lo reconocen como una persona muy metódica es su negocio y sobre todo trabajador y responsable, Eneas ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente donde ha sido puntual con todos su pagos, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para surtir de otros  productos de belleza para damas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia R. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo que trabaja como agricultor y sus dos hijos estudiantes. Rosa posee su negocio ubicado  en su domicilio donD. tiene instalado un molino y una pequeña tienda que carece D. variedad D. productos y es por lo cual solicita este crédito, ya que desea surtir su negocio con variedad D. mercadería que le permita generar ventas y ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia R. D. R. is 46 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two school-aged children. Rosa manages a business out of her home where she operates a grain mill and runs a small grocery store that carries different products.

She is requesting a loan because she desires to restock her business with a variety of merchandise. This will help her generate sales and income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Felista M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 16 and 21. Felista has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 1995. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week.  Felista currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of product. Felista thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine B. lives in the village of Gandzaqar near the town of Ijevan. She is married and has two children. Her son lives in Russia, while her unemployed daughter lives with her and her husband. Karine works in the Statistic Department. For the past nine years, she has engaged in bee-keeping on the side. Her husband and father-in-law help Karine in this hard work. Karine had a bee allergy and initially kept the animals at a great risk to her health, but during the years of her work she has gained immunity. Karine developed her business on her own land and sells all her honey very quickly, because she has regular customers. With the good income from bee-keeping Karine solves most of her family problems. She is requesting a loan of 450.000 AMD in order to increase the number of bee families she keeps.

loans.use: To pay for additional bee families

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina C., 39, is from Parola, Binondo, Manila, a shanty village near the edge of Manila Bay.  She is married to Romeo, 51, a transport dispatcher.  Two of her three children are attending school.

Two years ago, Lina opened a general store in front of her house.  She started selling a handful of canned goods and biscuits.  Now her general store has grown bigger. She makes a net profit of P5,000.00 a month.  Her profits are budgeted for their daily basic needs especially her children’s education.

Lina just became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008 but has already seen a lot of economic as well as spiritual development in her life.  She has learned from the cooperative the importance of saving for the future.  She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P15,000.00 as additional capital for the continuous growth of her store.  She will re-stock her grocery inventory.


She hopes to see her store grow even bigger.  She also wants to see her children graduate from their studies.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert M. is 57 years old. He lives in Sevan with his wife and son. The whole family contributes to his business, which consists of preparing and selling confectionery. Three years ago, Albert developed a spot in the yard of his own home as a place for his business. Before that, he worked as a builder in Russia. He decided to return to his native land and start his family business. His production is now very popular in the entire Gegharkunik region. The main business centre is located in Albert’s hometown, Sevan town. Albert provides many shops and school buffets with his product. He has difficulty delivering his product to such a vast region. Albert wants to take a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a car in order to provide his customers with his fresh products, on time.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport his products to his customers.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Lidia S. from Tukuyu. She is married with 2 children, aged 2 and 4. Lidia has been running a business selling used clothes since 2007. The business involves importing second-hand clothes across the oceans from America and Europe, which are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers. The retailers then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lidia currently earns about $80 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Lidia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timbers in bulk

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel K. was born in 1953 in Ijevan. He is married and has two daughters. One daughter works in the Ijevan Music School, the other is married and lives away from her parents. Samvel has owned a food shop since 1999. Before starting his business, Samvel worked as a builder up until the closing of his Building Department. His mother and his wife are helping him in the business. In the past ten years, thanks to his profits, Samvel has been able to buy new furniture for his house and to pay the expenses for his daughter’s wedding, as well as for his mother’s surgery. Unlike the other food shops in Ijevan, Samvel’s shop is open for 24 hours. This is Samvel’s 6th borrowing cycle with “Nor Horizon.” This time he is requesting 500,000 AMD to buy non-alcoholic drinks and candy for his shop. In the future Samvel wants to open a second food shop in Ijevan.

loans.use: To buy non-alcoholic drinks and candy for his shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve quality of her business

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en: Leyli K. lives in Ijevan. She is a widow and has two daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives separately, and the other one lives with Leyli. Since 2003, Leyli has operated a food store in a place her brothers owns in the central street of Ijevan. Previously, she had worked in the Ijevan food-processing factory, until it was closed, along with most of Armenian factories. With the profits from her business, Leyli provided for some of her family’s needs, such as buying necessary furniture and home appliances and organizing her elder daughter’s wedding. Leyli likes her work and, most of all, appreciates that she can help pensioners by taking them home and helping to carry their purchases. Leyli is a fifth cycle borrower in Nor Horizon, and now she needs 600,000 AMD to buy sugar, sunflower-seed oil and tomato sauce for her shop. In the future she hopes to increase her income in order to collect enough money to repair her apartment.

loans.use: To buy sugar, sunflower-seed oil and tomato sauce for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for  her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Nustriana

texts.en:
Nustriana P., from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, is 73 years old, married, and the mother of five adult-aged children. To make a living, Nustriana owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap , toothpaste, sugar and snacks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nustriana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal bulk in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Chanrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanrith K., age 21(shown in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Piseth Sot, age 19, just were married in 2009 and have no children yet. The young couple is living in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanrith sells fish and her husband assists his wife in the business. Chanrith is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is managing a general store business in their village.  She is a single parent and she have three children.  They are living in the simple village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela. She works hard to provide the needs of her children especially in their studies. Jocelyn hopes that someday, they can have a progressive living. 

Her children encourages her to become more diligent and become successful in the business.  She patiently maintains her store and it is open very early in the morning and closes late at night to earn a bigger income.  However, insufficient capital limits her in improving her business.  This is the reason why Jocelyn wanted to request a loan from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5, 000 as additional business capital. She hopes to improve her store for them to have a stable source of income.  

Jocelyn is now 35 years old and her children are: Joemar - 17 years old; Marcelo A. Jr. - 16 years old and John Mar - 8 years old who is already in the primary level.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoung M., age 53 (shown in picture with her husband), and her husband Mr. Morn Korng, age 56, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, while one daughter is a garment factory worker and another one attends university. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phoung and her husband have been farming for 25 years. She now is requesting her first loan of $800 to use for the farm and to pay school fees for her daughters.

loans.use: To use for the farm and to pay school fees for her daughters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim U., 56, and her husband, Tep Heang, 52, were married in 1979. They have seven children; six sons and one daughter. One of them was married and lives in separated house and two children have full-time employment. he family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Lim sells ice and fruits in front of her house. In the past, she sold vegetable. Her husband has been a construction worker for more than ten years. Besides of the business, he is a motor taxi driver as well. Unhappily, his old motorbike breaks down and doesn’t work properly which upset his business.
Hence Lim is requesting a loan of $300 to help her husband to purchase new motorbike for replacing the old one.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase new motorbike for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milk in bulk

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna C., 31, is a silk weaver and husband, Mr. Vuthy Him, 36, is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and the other one is still too young. Vanna sells her products to a middleman in her village, who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. She has had one previous loan. Now she is requesting a new loan of $50 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items for her store in bulk

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie manages a direct selling business and also runs a manicure and pedicure service in her village. She lives in the village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela with her husband, Rogelio, and their six children. Two of the children help their father with a farming business. Their eldest child is Rogie (19 years old, elementary school graduate); then Roger (16 years old, high school undergraduate), Roy (14 years old, high school student), Rogelio Jr. (9 years old, elementary school student), Roselyn (7 years old, elementary school student), and Roel (4 years old). The couple works hard to meet the needs of their family.

With her patience and hard work, Rosie is able to help her husband sustain their family. She is now asking for financial assistance with a loan of 5,000 pesos as additional business capital for her direct selling business and to purchase different materials she needs for her beauty service. Rosie is hoping that she will succeed in providing her children with their needs through her small business.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her personal product sales

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap D., 41, and her husband, Mr. Cheng-ean Hean, 53, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. One of their sons is a construction worker, and one other child is silk weaver. Three children are in school and another one is still young.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home.

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline sells fish from her own fish pond in the village. She also sells vegetables for a larger income to support their needs. She is 38 years old, married to Robinson, who manages their farm lot and their man-made fish pond. The couple is blessed with three children: Genalyn (20 years old, high school graduate), Jinky (17 years old, also a high school graduate) and Janette (10 years old, presently studying in the elementary school located in their village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela). Evangeline dreams of having an improved business to be able to secure the future of her children.

Evangeline would like to request additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 pesos for the improvement of her vending business and also to meet their farming needs. Evangeline and her husband are doing their best to be productive in their businesses for the welfare of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme lives in the rural village of Gomez, San Isidro, Isabela. She is married to Ronald whose occupation is farming. They help each other in maintaining their livelihood so as to be able to provide their children with a better way of living.

Noeme manages a hog-raising business to give them an alternative source of income aside from farming. In this way, they can further support the needs of their family and the educational needs of their children.

Due to the difficulties of life, Noeme is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in maintaining the needed feed supply of her hogs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will serve as business capital in maintaining her hog-raising business.

Noeme believes that her business is a great help in sending her two children to school. They are: Jay – 9 years old and John Kennedy – 8 years old. She is hoping that she will be able to help supply the important needs of her family by doing well in her pig business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Mrs. Hazel G. is from Montilla, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She is 37 years old and is married with seven children of school age.

Due to abject poverty, she joined Project Dungganon in 1991 and started her salted-peanuts and “balut" business in their community (a balot or balut is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell). Then, a year later, she ventured into making peanut butter and delivered it to her regular clients.

However, Mrs. G. realized that their monthly income was not sufficient for her family. She came up with the idea of making a cart so that she could go around town selling her products such as the peanut butter, salted peanuts and a little of her RTW (ready-to-wear clothes). It proved to be a brilliant idea.

Now, she is planning to expand her business and make another mobile store to sell her wares in their community. Mrs. G. is proposing PHP 14,000 for her 15th loan. 


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Fausatiu

texts.en: Fausatiu is 42 years old and she has 2 children. Her children are all schooling. She sells tailoring materials and sarongs.She started this business in 2006.The demands for her tailoring materials is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang L. is 43 years old and father to seven children: six are single and the other one is married and has already started a new family. In the beginning of 2002, Tang L. has been working in building apartment. He also assists his wife's handicraft work, to weave bamboo basket for sale. The family's living conditions are not comfortable due to their house is cracking down frequently. With this difficulty, Tang L. has decided to seek a loan to add to his personal saving to buy housing equipment in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment in order to build a new house

loans.name: Mirjahan

texts.en: Mirjahan was born in 1956. She is a mother of 4 children. 7 years ago she started poultry business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy poultry for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Thlang's Group

texts.en:
The are three low-income persons who have jointly requested in this group loan, all of whom are citizens living in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of these people, Mrs. D. has been selected to be a leader by members. D., 63, is a widowed mother blessed with one child. To earn a living, D. retails kind of vegetables thA. she buys in bulk on credit from her nearby farmers. D. will be used her first loan to accrue her business capital in order to better meet her customer's requirements. The other members of this loan are:
S. A., a vegetable vendor, who is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.
Y. is taking out her loan to buy a boA. for her fishing activities.

loans.use: To accrue her business capital in order to better meet her customer's requirements

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is single and lives in Baku city. She was born in 1986. Four years ago she started her clothing sales business. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more clothes and shoes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Big Five Marketer Group

texts.en:
Daniel B.S. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Big Five Marketer'. He is 48 years old, married with 4 children, aged 9-24 years old. Their educational levels are 4th- 12th grade. He also cares for 2 siblings. Daniel could not go to university after high school graduation due to lack of financial support.

Daniel's business is his general shop; he buys general good that people use daily wholesale and sells them to the residents of Old Road, Joe Bar where he lives.

Daniel started with food preparation and later sales of drinks then decided to elevate his business to a general goods shop and has been running this business for 18 years, hoping to establish branches all over Monrovia,Liberia. Daniel pays rent for the shelter he occupies for the business, so when the rent is increased, it causes problems for his business.

Daniel needs this loan to purchase more general goods. He dreams of giving his children an education so that they will live better lives in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more general goods

loans.name: God Children Group

texts.en:
D. J. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'God Children'. He is 27 years old, married with children aged 1 and 2 years old, and also cares for a sibling. D. is a senior high school student hoping to excel to the highest level of education.

D.'s business is his call center. He makes phone calls, sells and rents movie discs, and does money exchange for the residents of Saye Town, 3rd St., south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia where he lives.

D. started this business with Ld$15,000 that was given to him by his mother, and he has been running this business for 3 years, hoping to see his business grow and expand to a higher level. D. gives his customers a better exchange rate and sells and rents quality movie disc and also gives them the best time making pay calls.

D. needs this loan to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and always giving them good medical care.

loans.use: this loan to improve his business.

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola is 48 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoe paste,noodles,cooking oils,spices,etc. she has been in this business for long.she hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.She is a hard working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is a 45 years old woman living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is married and has 2 children.All her children are schooling.She sells drinks and juice in her shop.She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bosi

texts.en:
Bosi says that she loves being her own boss. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions, hair cream, etc. She started this business in 2003. She is 34 years old and married with two children.

Bosi hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy fries bons.Bons is made flour.She also sells sarongs of various colours to her customers.She is a hard working woman.she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of flour and sarongs. She is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and sarongs

loans.name: Moju

texts.en: Moju lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers within her community. She hopes for the loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Abike

texts.en: Abike is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells prayer items like bibles,candles,incence,olive oil,etc. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more prayer items to sell. she says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more prayer items

loans.name: Mohubbat

texts.en: Mohubbat lives in Baku city. He was born in 1955. He has been in the cattle-breeding business for 10 years. He is married, has 4 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve his cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en: Olaide is a 34-year-old woman living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is married with 2 children. She sells provisions like noodles, bathing soap, sugar, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Hope is a group of 5 borrowers led by Marie F., 51 years old, a widow with 5 children aged 21-31 years. Their educational levels are 12th grade-University graduates. She also cares for 2 orphans and 4 siblings.

Marie lives and works in the New Matadi community south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Marie's business is buying charcoal and fufu (local Liberian food) wholesale from rural Liberia and selling it to the residents of New Matadi, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 19 years and is grateful to the business for funding her children's education throughout these years.

Marie started by selling prepared food but later decided to get involves in out-of-town business. She also sells good products to her customers to retain them as customers. Marie is hoping to establish a store in future. And she dreams of her and her children being successful in the future.

Marie needs this loan in order to purchase more goods that can cover her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods that can cover her customers' needs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 26 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoe paste, spices, rice, etc.She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Salimont

texts.en: Salimont is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and crates of eggs. She has been in this business since the year 2000. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and crates of eggs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and eggs to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 36 years old and has been married to his wife, Luisa, for six years. Together, they have a two-year-old daughter. Antonio currently lives in the Chapare Province of Cochabamba Department, in a town called Sacaba. Antonio is a taxi driver for the Trufi line in the city of Cochabamba. The Trufi line runs the same routes each day, and charges per person; just like a bus system.

Antonio has been driving his taxi for a year now, ever since he first bought the taxi and joined Trufi. Now that Antonio has a stable job, he is taking out a loan from CIDRE to purchase land and build a new home for his family.

loans.use: The purchase of land for a home

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.en:
María is 50 years old, single, and lives in the Quillacollo Province of Cochabamba Department. She has four children, aged 15, 20, 22, and 24. She sells fruit in La Pampa, which is the fruit section of La Cancha. La Cancha is an open-air market in the city of Cochabamba, and it also happens to be the largest open-air market in all of South America.

María sells watermelons, Peruvian coconuts, pineapples, and papayas. She also sells sugar cane and cane juice, which sell very well because she is one of the only vendors that offers them in La Pampa. She typically sells the most on Saturdays and Sundays, and sometimes she travels to different markets to offer her goods.

María has been selling fruit in La Pampa for five years. With the loan from CIDRE, María plans to refurbish her fruit stand and offer a greater quantity and variety of goods at her fruit stand. María hopes this loan will help her improve the quality of life for herself and her children. She hopes that all of her children will become successful professionals.

loans.use: Refurbishing a stall in the market and purchasing more fruit

loans.name: Jimena

texts.en:
Jimena is 21 years old and single. She lives in the community of Colkapirua, which is in the Sumumpaya Province of Cochabamba Department. Jimena has been working as a "lechera," or dairy cow farmer, for the past six years. Growing up helping in her family's dairy cow business led Jimena to where she is now. Jimena still lives at home and she now owns her own livestock.

Jimena will use her loan to purchase food for her livestock; specifically, soy bean husks. She hopes that this will improve her cows' milk production. Jimena is currently studying at a technical institute each night, and she looks forward to finishing her studies and becoming a professional.

loans.use: Purchasing food for livestock

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: K. Joy is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a married lady with 3 children all in secondary school as she takes care of other orphans. Joy has a stationery shop business on Kampala road that has been in existence for 9 years and she is able to make 100,000/= as profits a week. Her major challenge is the lack of enough capital to boost her stationery shop since she has the good customer care skills for a successful business. She also hopes to have a successful and healthy home. Joy needs a loan to help increase her stock by buying more new books and other stationery. She is such a friendly and hard working lady.

loans.use: Buying more new books and other stationery for her shop.

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Joseph F. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called 'One Family'. He is a 36-year-old junior student of the University of Liberia. He is single with a 4-year-old child; the child's educational level is kindergarten. Joseph and his daughter live in WestPoint which is a crowded and poor community close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Joseph's business is buying used shoes wholesale and selling them to the residents of Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 5 years and started with Ld$6,000 that was given to him by his oldest sister. His business has improved. Joseph always purchases quality goods to be sold to his customers so that they will continue buying from him.

Joseph hopes to establish a store in the future and dreams of giving his children a quality education and a balanced diet that will keep them healthy. Joseph needs this loan in order to purchase durable goods to be sold to customers.

loans.use: to purchase durable goods for resale

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells frozen foods like fish, beef, chicken, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Amanbek

texts.en: Amanbek is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His oldest son attends the local secondary school while the younger two children attend kindergarten. Amanbek operates a raw material trading business in his local market. He began the business in 1999 and continues to trade raw materials such as sheep and goat skins to local retailers. In 2008, he also began to trade meat and meat products in order to supplement his income. This business is the only source of income for Amanbek’s family and he is determined to expand his customer base and product offerings in order for his family to become financially secure. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase more sheep and goat skins, meat and supplies for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and goat skins, meat and supplies

loans.name: Ariutsogt

texts.en: S. Ariuntsogt is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. Her oldest son attends local secondary school and his younger daughter hasn't yet reached school age. Ariuntsogt operates a small electronics shop in his town. She offers a variety of products and services including DVD rentals, cellphone parts sales, and computer services. Ariuntsogt started his business in 2003 and has since built a great reputaition in her community among her customers and suppliers both. She attributes her success to her strong accounting practices. Ariuntsogt's business is very important to her and her family, and she says, "I want to expand my DVD rental business so that I can provide for my children's education."She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) loan to purchase more cellphone parts to sell and DVDs to rent at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cellphone parts to sell and DVDs to rent

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He runs a business selling fruit and green vegetables at Buguruni Kisiwan ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from Buguruni food staffs city market shopping center wholesale and sells to customers retail. He manages to meet his daily family demands and business capitalization from his business income. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga lives with his wife and two children in Kharkhorin, ancient Mongolian empire's capital. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend a local secondary school while his wife operates a clothing retail business in the local market.

Battulga owns and operates his own wooden-products business, specializing in 'ger' parts, 'ger' furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2002 after graduating from a carpenter training course. Most of his profits come from the sale of his larger-sized furniture which is sold at prices between 850,000 and 1,200,000 tugrug (~600-840 USD). All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider.

He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford to build a house by the end of next year. Battulga is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more wood so that he can increase the number and variety of large furniture pieces that he can sell.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Winfred's Group

texts.en: N. Winfred is a 30 year old lady and married with 4 children aged between 9 years and 6 months, as she takes care of her siblings. She is a business lady involved in the sale of second hand clothes and the sale of green bananas from Owino and Nansana markets respectively for 17 years. She employs two people to help with both businesses and hence remains with 80,000/= as profits a week. She has a dream of importing her clothes from Dubai for more quality so that she could become self reliant with the increased savings. For the clothes, at times they are scarce to get and once she gets her loan, she will be able to buy in large quantities for increased stock. She is a determined and hard working lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for increased stock.

loans.name: Buyandelger

texts.en:
Buyandelger is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Kharkhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in Uvurkhangai province in Mongolia. His three younger children all attend university and two of them will be graduating in the next year.

Buyandelger owns a successful microbus taxi service. In 2001, he signed a contract with the tourist company “Explore Mongolia” where his responsibilities include driving tourists around to popular destinations between July and October. During the tourist slow season, Buyandelger transports his fellow Mongolians between Uyanga sum and Kharkhorin sum. He is known to both tourists and Mongolians alike as a reliable, friendly driver who takes great care of his passengers.

For the future, he wishes to continue paying for his children’s university education and would eventually like to build his own home. Buyandelger is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase parts for his microbus so that he can keep it in good running condition.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his minibus

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo L. is a Tanzanian an entrepreneur business married woman. She runs a business of making and selling traditional clothes (baticks) to customers at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the manufacturing materials from the baticks materials shop from the whole sales and retails. It is made by boiling together clothes sheets and different color s in ratios according to the market demand. Its demand is internally and externally and used to make different types of clothes designs. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to capitalize the business

loans.name: Tumurdorj

texts.en: Tumurdorj is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic ten, in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He operates a dairy trading business, where he purchases dairy products from a nearby small village and transports them to the market in his town. Tumurdorj started his business in 2000 with working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD) and it soon reached 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD). Since his business has become increasingly profitable, he has been able to provide for himself and his wife. Tumurdorj’s main goals are to provide for his family and deliver quality dairy products to the market. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase his sales in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. has been in the welding business in Naivasha town for the last four years. He is 32 years old and married to Christine Atieno. They have one school going child.  

Daniel was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy a new welding machine.

He still sees himself in welding in the near future since it’s a profitable business.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Enid's Group

texts.en:
M. Enid is a 26-year-old female who is married with one child aged 6 years. She also takes care of two siblings. All the children are in school.

Enid is a hairdresser in Namasuba as well as keeping poultry at her home for two years and, so far, she is able to make 40,000/= as profits each week. She has good customer care skills and this has won her more customers, hence more profits and income. She hopes to expand her salon so that it becomes the best in Namasuba and then open other branches in future plus have an educated family.

Enid needs a loan to help increase her salon stock by buying more braids, weaves, chemicals and other cosmetics for her salon so that she can make more income.

loans.use: To increase her salon stock

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two older children attend a local secondary school while the youngest stays at home with her mother.

Byambasuren owns a taxi business where he transports people back and forth from Arhangai to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, a trip which takes two days round trip. He started his business in 2000 and, after nine years, he has expanded his customer base and earned a good reputation among the local people.

Byambasuren is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan in order to make repairs on his taxi in order for him to keep it running well on his long trips.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: John

texts.en: John N. is 32 years old, is married to Ann Njeri, and they have two school-going children. John has operated his bakery shop for the last three years in Naivasha town. He supplies his neighbors with cakes at a reasonable price. He also operates a secondary business of motorcycle transport within the town. He does this in the afternoons after delivering the cakes. With the income from both business he is able to sustain himself and his family. John was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy wheat flour at wholesale price which is cheaper. In future he plans to grow both businesses and also employ people who will help him in his operations. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy wheat flour for baking cakes

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
K. Harriet is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is 32 years old and married with two children aged 12 and 9 years. She also takes care of two orphans. She is a friendly and hardworking lady with a retail shop and a clinic as her businesses.

Harriet manages both businesses in two separate areas but is good at coordinating their functionalities. From the clinic, Harriet is able to make 100,000/= plus 70,000/= as profits from the retail shop per week. She has high hopes of having the best laboratory in her business area as well as having her children as role models in the community.

Harriet needs a loan to help increase stock both in the clinic and in the retail shop so that she could make more income. She is such a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To increase stock in both her retail shop and her clinic

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella K. is a small business married woman .She is a food vender selling cooked and fried food stuffs to customers at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the food stuffs from the market in whole sales. Due to low business capital she can not manage to rent a place where she can make a café but she prepares it at home and then supplying to customers in working stations. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha A. runs a business of selling soft drinks at LKigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She an entrepreneur married business woman.  She sells juices, Drinking water, Ice cream and Soda to customers. Juices is made by her self by buying fruits from the market and using a blender to make it while soda and Ice cream is purchased from the whole sales shops and selling in retail to customers. Ice cream is mostly consumed by school children thus the market is during the school time. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up her business

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Ntoogo's Group

texts.en: W. Ntoogo is the leader of his lending group in Wandegeya. He is a friendly man and married with 3 children with the eldest being in secondary school. W. is a business man selling motor vehicle spare parts from Soweto Zone in Wandegeya for 15 years. He is able to make profits that enable him take care of his family as well as accomplishing family development goals. W. needs a loan to help re boost his business after using a lot of money to clear his children’s school fees.  He needs to buy more spare parts for increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia R. D. M. resiD. en el municipio D. Artesanos Nahuizalco en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Antonia tiene 55 años D. edad, es madre D. cinco hijos su razón para salir adelante, los hijos D. Antonia son muy unidos a ella apoyan en el trabajo del hogar  y también colaboran en la agricultura. El negocio D. Antonia es un comedor ubicado en el mercado local, el crédito que en esta oportunidad solicita Antonia es para comprar frijoles, manteca y arroz.

loans.use: Comprar frijoles, manteca y arroz

loans.name: Marie Nyumah Group

texts.en:
'Marie N.' group is a group of 5 borrowers led by Marie N. ,41 years old, married with 4 children aged 11-29 years old. Their educational levels are 4th grade - university graduate. She also cares for siblings.

Marie lives in Clara town, Bushrod Island, a commercial community north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Bricks and soap production is Marie's business, and she has been running this business for 20 years. Selling good products and wonderful human relations have brought her this far.

Marie started this business with Ld$4,000 her husband gave her; she now operates for more than that amount. She is hoping to turn her little business into a factory through hard work and good management.
