Marie needs this loan in order to purchase more raw materials for production. She dreams of giving her children better education and health care.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for production

loans.name: Hadijah's Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is a 45-year-old female and is married with six children aged between 24 and 11 years, all still in school. She also takes care of other orphans.

Hadijah is a strong and hardworking lady who has sold agricultural products in Owino market for nineteen years. She is able to make only 100,000/= (approx. $50) in bi-monthly profits and this is due to having to pay high taxes for operating from the City Centre market as well as the high transport costs to bring the produce to the market. She works so hard to ensure that she satisfies her family needs and to ensure that her children reach university level.

Hadijah needs a loan to help expand her business by having more agricultural produce for resale so that she is able to attract more customers for increased sales.

loans.use: To buying more agricultural produce to sell

loans.name: Agnes Wangari

texts.en: Agnes Wangari is 34 Years old. She is married and is the mother of three school-going children. Agnes has a clothes-selling business which she has been running for the last five years on a busy street in Narok where most residents do their shopping. Agnes learned about KADET from a friend who is already a registered client. This will be her third loan which she is planning to use to rent a permanent store where she will be able to sell her clothes without shifting the business since it is at a semi-permanent shed. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to expand her business to meet her clients’ demands. She also plans to have her own pick-up truck so that she will be able to sell her clothes even in the interior markets which she is currently not able to reach due to transport problems. Agnes’s future dream is to become a self-reliant woman who can also employ more people and uplift their living standards. She believes she is a courageous woman who is ready to work hard despite life's challenges. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes and to rent a permanent shop

loans.name: Gabriel Alexander

texts.es: Gabriel Alexander F. R. reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Gabriel tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y hermano de 19 años que se encuentra estudiando. Gabriel es un hijo ejemplar, cuida de su madre con su hermano, ambos son el apoyo y sostén de ella, el negocio de Gabriel fue herencia de su padre quien ya ha fallecido, es un taller de estructuras metálicas, el cual ahora está a cargo de Gabriel, el crédito que solcita es para invertir en herramientas y materiales.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy K. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian business married woman. She runs a business of selling clothes both new and used at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from the second hand clothes shops and the Kariakoo city business shopping center in whole sales and retail. Her business is three years old and its income is used to meet the daily family demand. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: God Mercy Group

texts.en:
'God Mercy' is a group of 5 borrowers led by David G., 43 years old, married with 5 children aged 6-23 years old. Their educational levels are 4th grade-12th grade. He also cares for a sibling.

David is a college drop-out due to poverty. He decided to sell used clothing in the Waterside market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 20 years. He started with Ld$1,000 but with hard work and good management, he has come this far.

David always sells his customers good products and treats them well to encourage them to always patronize his business. David dreams of growing his business to a higher level so that he will be able to order goods from containers from abroad and become successful so that he can educate his children and have access to health facilities.

He needs this loan to purchase more goods in order to promote his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods in order to promote his business

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINO AL ÉXITO”, viven el la ciudad del Cusco, la mayoría de ellos comparte un stand en su centro de trabajo, y tiene actividades similares.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de artesanías, otros socios tiene un carro que hace el servicio de taxi, y en número mayor las socias de este banco se dedican a la venta de juguetes, ropas, bisuterías, todas traídas de la ciudad de Tacna; otras 2 tiene su tienda de abarrotes, uno de ellos tiene su depósito de cervezas y un carro que hace servicio de transporte de Tacna Cusco y viceversa. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcato Tora (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Tarquí a unos 30 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, Tarquí se caracteriza por sus llanuras siendo el  sector  más productivo de leche y ganado vacuno, su clima es frió y la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, la mayor parte de la población joven han emigrado a diferentes partes del mundo para darles a sus familias estabilidad económica. Sus socias con el carisma que les caracteriza nos brindan sus historias.

La señora Delia Eudocia V. V. vive en la comunidad de Chilcato Tora en  la parroquia Tarquí, es socia del Banco Comunal del nombre de su comunidad, ella tiene 55 años de edad,  se encuentra casada, concibió siete  hijos de los cuales no recuerda las edades ya que todos son mayores de edad y casados,  sólo se acuerda de su última hija de 27 años que es  la única soltera, tres de sus hijos casados viven en su casa y le ayudan económicamente de vez en cuando porque  tienen sus propias responsabilidades en su hogar, su esposo es agricultor y con el trabajo en su juventud lograron construir su casa.

Delia se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene uso de razón, siembra coles, lechugas, nabos,  etc., cría gallinas y vende sus huevos, tiene dos terneritos los está criando para luego venderlos, también tiene una tienda pequeña pero aun le hace falta muchos víveres.

Dentro de su banco comunal  todas las socias  son muy buenas amigas a mas de ser de la misma comunidad se conocen desde hace varios años. Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideosm, etc.  para surtir su tienda.

Su sueño es ya no tener más deudas pues hasta la fecha está ayudando a su hijo que viajo al extranjero a pagar los gastos incurridos para su viaje.

La señora  María Tránsito P. C. es  otra socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre de su banco comunal en la parroquia Tarquí, tiene 65 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su amor  procreó cinco hijos, no recuerda las edades de sus hijos, solo de su último hijo que tiene 25 años es soltero y aún vive con ella, su esposo no trabaja porque le dio alergia al polvo de cemento impidiéndole realizar sus actividades laborales,  ella con su cónyuge lograron construir una casita pequeña de adobe, su situación económica es baja y toda la comunidad lo sabe, también le detectaron diabetes hace cinco años y ahora debe cuidarse mucho para no tener una recaída en su salud.

María se dedica a la cría de pollos hace poco tiempo, también tiene una vaca su leche vende a los carros lecheros del sector pero le pagan muy barato, nos manifiesta que es su primer crédito en la fundación y todas sus amigas le apoyaron para que ingrese y trate de salir adelante con los beneficios que otorga la Fundación a sus socias, con el préstamo que ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en su criadero comprando mas pollos, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento de esta manera incrementar su negocio y  tener un ingreso seguro para solventar sus gastos de medicinas y del hogar.

Su sueño es ver que todos sus hijos se superen personal y económicamente.

La señora Teresa Elvira  C. C. vive en la comunidad de Chilcato Tora, en la parroquia Tarquí, es socia del Banco Comunal del mismo nombre de su comunidad, tiene 47 años de edad, casada y concibió seis hijos de:24, 22, 20, 14, 11, 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia corte y confección en una academia a distancia, la segunda hija ya es casada y vive independiente, su hijo de 20 años trabaja en la construcción pero todo el dinero es solo para sus gastos, mientras que sus tres últimos hijos aún son estudiantes de escuela y colegio. Su esposo migró al exterior para darles un futuro mejor y gracias a ello han logrado construir su casa propia.

Teresa se dedica a la agricultura y es más para el consumo de su hogar, también a la crianza de animales, vacas lecheras, chanchos, pollos, etc, que los vende en la comunidad, 

Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y su expectativa es mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia, con el préstamo que  la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de más animales como: pollos y chanchos, comida  y vitaminas para su crianza.

Su meta es llegar a tener un gran criadero y  ser una gran comerciante de animales.
texts.en:
The Chilcato Tora Communal Bank is located in the Tarquí parish 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. Tarquí is characterized by its plains, and it is the sector that produces the most milk and dairy livestock. Its climate is cold. Most of the people work in agriculture and livestock. A large part of the population of youths has immigrated to different parts of the world to give their families economic stability. The members, with their characteristic charisma, tell us their stories. Delia Eudocial V. V. lives in the Chilcato Tora community in the Tarquí parish. She is a member of the communal bank with the same name as her community. She is 55, married, and has seven children. She does not remember their ages because they are all adults and married. She only remembers that her last daughter is 27, and she is the only one that is single. Three of her married children live in her house and help economically once in a while. They have their own responsibilities in the home. Her husband is a farmer, and through his work in his youth they were able to build a house. Delia has been a farmer ever since she was young. She plants cabbage, lettuce, and turnips, etc. She raises hens and sells their eggs. She has two calves, and she is raising them to later sell. She also has a small store, but she is lacking a lot of supplies. Within the communal bank the members are very good friends. They are from the same community, and they have known each other for several years. This is her first loan with the foundation. She will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, etc. to better stock her store. Her dream is to have no more debts. She is now helping her son who traveled abroad to pay the expenses he incurred on his trip. María Tránsito P. C. is another member of the Mujeres de Chilcato Tora Communal Bank. She lives in the community that has the same name as her bank in the Tarquí parish. She is 65, married, and has five children. She does not remember the ages of her children. She only remembers the age of her last child who is 25, single, and still lives with her. Her husband does not work because he became allergic to the cement dust. This stopped him from doing his work. She and her husband built a small adobe house. Their economic situation is down, and all of the community knows it. Also, she was diagnosed with diabetes five years ago. Now she has to take very good care of herself to not have a relapse in her health. María has been raising chickens for a short time. She also has a cow, and she sells her milk to the milk carts in the area. But, they pay very little. This is her first loan with the foundation. All of her friends supported her joining, and she tries to get ahead with the benefits the foundation offers their members. With this loan from ESPOIR she will buy more chickens, food, and vitamins for their growth. This way she will expand her business and have a secure income to pay the medication and household expenses. Her dream is to see all of her children succeed personally and economically. Teresa Elvira C. C. lives in the Chilcato Tora community in the Tarquí parish. She is a member of the communal bank with the same name as her community. She is 47, married, and has six children; ages 24, 22, 20, 14, 11, and 9. Her first daughter is studying dressmaking at an open academy. Her second daughter is married and lives independently. Her 20 year old son works in construction, but all of the money is only for his expenses. Her last three children are still in school. Her husband migrated to the exterior to give them a better future. Thanks to that, they have been able to build their own house. Terese is a farmer; most of her crops are for household consumption. She also raises animals like dairy cows, pigs, and chickens, etc. She sells them in the community. This is her first loan with the foundation. She hopes to improve her economic situation and that of her family. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy more animals like chickens and pigs, food, and vitamins to take care of them. Her goal is to have a large farm and to be a great animal merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products like rice, sugar, oil, seeds for planting, animals like chickens, pigs, food, and vitamins for their care

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma T. is a small business an entrepreneur Tanzanian business woman. She runs a Grocery at Kigamboni Tungi ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of goods including soft drinks and food staffs. She is married with four children. The Business income is used to meet her daily demand including business capitalization. She plans to open a food staff’s shop but fund is a problem. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to capitalize the business

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
'United We Stand' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Morris C., 43 years old, married, with 4 children aged 4-19 years old. Their educational levels are 4th grade-9th grade.

Morris is a college drop-out due to poverty. He decided to sell used shoes in the Waterside market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 8 years. He started with only Ld$1000 but with hard work and good management, he has come this far.

Morris always offers his customers good products and has a good manner of approach that encourages his customers to always patronize his business. Morris dreams of growing his business to a higher level so that he will be able to order used shoes from abroad and become successful and educate his children and have access to health facilities. He needs this loan to purchase more goods that can serve his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods that can serve his customers' needs

loans.name: Ada Yanira

texts.es: Ada Yanira V. D. M. resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ada tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos aun menores D. edad. Ada tiene su propio negocio ubicado en el mercado D. cocinas D. Cojutepeque, el negocio D. Ada es el  conocido y preferido por muchos, tiene una clientela estable por la cual ahora solicita este crédito ya que necesita producir mayor cantidad D. comida para cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumentar la produccion de su comedor

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen tiene la edad de 27 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerla. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo por lo que todos son menores de edad por la buena administración de Lucia ha logrado su negocio ha crecido. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como son los granos básicos ya que en su mayoría de clientes, son personas que viven por los alrededores.  Por la necesidad de cada día Lucia lucha con proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la inversión de su negocio. En futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y vender ropa.
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen is 27 years old. Her business is a general store, which she has operated for more than 6 years. She has managed to keep it going by working as hard as she can. Lucia is also taking care of her three young children, but thanks to her good management, she has been able to expand her business. The store is located in her home, where she offers basic products such as dry grains. The majority of her customers are people who live nearby. Each day, Lucia struggles to make ends meet and to provide for her children's needs, and for this reason she is requesting this loan to invest in her business. In the future, she would like to further expand her business and sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Love Yourself Group

texts.en:
Gladys W. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Love Yourself'. She is 32 years old, a single mother with  2 children aged 6 and 13 years old. They are in school. She is illiterate due to lack of financial support from her parents.

Gladys lives and works in West Point, a poor community close to the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Gladys' business is the sale of general home products to the residents of West Point, Monrovia, Liberia. She started this business with Ld$10,000 and has been running this business for 3 years despite challenges of price changes.

Gladys' good relations and quality products make customers always patronize her business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to serve her customers. 

She dreams of expanding her business to a bigger shop so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: in order to purchase more goods to serve her customers

loans.name: Martina Janett

texts.es: Martina Janet Rodríguez tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Martina se dedica a un comedor, que está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado proporcionarle mejoras a su local, Martina es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar ya que todas dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar le han enseñado a mejorar la administración de su negocio. Ella ofrece diferentes platillos variados en donde sus clientes escogen el que más les gusta muchos asisten a su local por es un lugar familiar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para verduras, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pollo, carnes, pescado, camarones entre otros productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que ya se acerca la temporada lluviosa.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del  país,   esta ciudad es considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad además, aquí podemos disfrutrar de  paisajes hermosos y lugares turísticos  para ser visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Este Banco está formado por un socio y trece socias que están dispuestos a salir adelante con sus negocios, familias y llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida, viven en diferentes partes de la urbe cuencana.

La señora Marcela Elizabeth  N. T. es socia del  al Banco Comunal  Nuevos Senderos, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el  sector del Mercado 12 de Abril, ella tiene 25 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada y fruto de su amor concibió dos  hijos de  4 y 2 años de edad, la relación con su esposo es muy sólida siendo el pilar principal de su hogar, él trabaja en su propio taller de latonería; aún no tienen casa propia por lo que deben pagar arriendo.

Marcela es Psicóloga Clínica lleva dos años ejerciendo su profesión, montó el consultorio en su propio domicilio por lo que no paga arriendo, permitiéndole ahorrar ese dinero para los gastos de su hogar y para mejorar el espacio físico de su  consultorio.

Marcela  se lleva muy bien con todas las socias creando un buen  ambiente de amistad, nos comenta que este es su tercer ciclo junto a su banco comunal y  asegura que los prestamos que la fundación le ha entregado le han permitido ir adecuando el local donde montó su consultrorio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de instrumental necesarios para las terapias con sus pacientes para darles un mejor  sevicio.

El gran sueño de Marcela es que cada día le vaya mucho mejor para comprar un local y montar su consultorio.

La señora  María Beatriz S. Z. es otra socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos,  vive en el Sector El Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, fruto de su unión matrimonial concibió tres hijos de 18, 8, 6 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja en un taller de latonería y por las noches estudia en la Universidad UNITA,  sus dos hijos menores estudian  en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la mecánica y es una persona muy colaboradora en casa; no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus suegros.

María tiene un comedor  ubicado en el redondel de las bodegas de ETAPA, lleva trabajando dos años en él, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. nos comenta que por las vacaciones el negocio decayó un poco y espera que en el inicio de clases mejore.

Este  es su primer ciclo en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR y se animó a ser socia de la fundación por las facilidades para obtener el crédito y la oportunidad que le da de invertir en su negocio, con el préstamo que la fundación le entregue va a invertir en la compra de menaje de cocina  para su negocio y  para la matrícula de su hijo en la Universidad.

Su gran sueño es ampliar su restaurante y contar con un local propio para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ser más competitivo.

La señora María Virginia  O.  M. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos, ella vive en el sector el Control Sur en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra casada, de su relación conyugal concibió cuatro hijas de: 27, 24, 23, 11 años de edad, sus hijas mayores se encuentran casadas, excepto la  primera y la última que viven con ella, además nos comenta que aún no consigue cupo en el colegio para su hija menor pues desea que siga con sus estudios,  su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada,  mantienen una buena relación conyugal compartiendo las responsabilidades económicas y del hogar,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

María tiene un negocio de  comida rápida, ofrece  salchipapas, chuzos, hamburguesas, colas, etc., lleva veinte  años en esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de 4 p.m. hasta las 9 p.m. de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día,  nos comenta que le va muy bien por eso cada día busca dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

María mantiene una buena relación con todas las socias de su banco, este es su tercer ciclo en la FUNDACION ESPOIR  y se siente muy agradecida por los préstamos obtenidos pues le han permitido estabilizarse económicamente,  con el nuevo préstamo que la fundación le entregue lo va a invertir en la ampliación de su negocio, compra de bebidas gaseosas surtidas, aguas naturales y productos desechables. Su gran meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Senderos Village Bank is located in the city of Cuenca in the southern part of the country. The city is considered a World Heritage Site and has beautiful scenery and tourist attractions that are visited by domestic and foreign tourists. This bank is composed of one male member and thirteen female members that want to be successful in their businesses and achieve a better quality of life for their families. They live in different parts of Cuenca. Mrs. Marcela Elizabeth N. T. is a member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the Mercado 12 de Abril section of Cuenca. She is 25 years old and is happily married with two children, 4 and 2 years of age. Her relationship with her husband is very solid and is the foundation of their family. He has his own metal-working workshop.They still do not own their own home and have to pay rent. Marcela is a clinical psychologist and has been in practice for two years. She set up her office in their home to save on rent and to be able to fix up the space. Marcela gets along very well with the other members, creating a friendly environment. She tells us that this is her third loan cycle with the Village Bank and she says that the earlier loans from the bank have enabled her to improve her office space. WIth the loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of instruments necessary for her patients' therapy to be able to serve them better. Marcela's dream is to buy a piece of land and build her own office. Mrs. María Beatriz S. Z. is another member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the El Vergel section of Cuenca. She is 38 years old and is married with three children, 18, 8 and 6 years of age. Her oldest son works in a metal-working workshop and at night studies at the UNITA University. Her two younger children go to school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic and is very helpful around the house. They do not own their own home and they live in their in-laws' house. María has a restaurant located by the traffic circle at the ETAPA warehouses. She has been working there for two years and her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 4pm. She tells us that during summer break, business fell off a bit and she hopes things improve once classes begin. This is her first loan with FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR and she wanted to become a member because of the easy access to credit and the opportunity that it would give her to invest in her business. With the loan, she will buy cooking supplies for her business and pay her son's university tuition. Her dream is to increase the size of her restaurant and own the property to be able to serve her customers better and to be more competitive. Mrs.María Virginia O. M. is another active member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the Control Sur section of Cuenca. She is 45 years old and is married with four daughters, 27, 24, 23 and 11 years old. Her older daughters are married except for the eldest and the youngest who still live with her. She tells us that she has not been able to get a spot in school for her youngest daughter who she would like to have continue her studies. María's husband is an employee at a private company and they have a good relationship, sharing financial and household responsibilities. They do not own their own home and are renting. María has a fast food business, selling hotdogs, hamburgers, sodas, etc. She has had this business for twenty years and she works from 4pm to 9pm every day. She tells us that her business is doing well since every day she tries to offer better service to her customers. María has a good relationship with the other members of the bank. This is her third loan with FUNDACION ESPOIR and she feels very thankful for the earlier loans as they have allowed her to get economically stable. With the new loan from the foundation, she will invest in the expansion of her business and will purchase sodas, juices and disposable goods. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: office remodeling, kitchen supplies, soft drinks, paper plates

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: God Is Big Group

texts.en:
Jerome J. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'God is Big'. He is 28 years old, married with 2 children, aged 6 and 4 years old. Their educational levels are Kindergarten and 1st grade. He is a university student.

Jerome lives and works on Gurley Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Jerome's business is tailoring. He sews quality clothes and sells them to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He started this business with Ld$5000.00 and has been running the business for 5 years.

Jerome's good relations with his customers and quality materials he sews for customers make them always patronize his business.

He needs this loan in order to purchase more textiles to sew more clothes. He dreams of expanding his business to a clothing production company, so that he can educate his children and set a foundation for them.

loans.use: in order to purchase textiles to sew more clothes

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Gelgi V., de 43 años de edad, vive en el barrio campo bruce, tiene tres hijos, madre soltera, es una mujer que ha sobresalido con su negocio para ayudar  a sus hijos que estudien y sean personas de bien. Es costurera desde hace muchos años, hace vestido al estilo del cliente  y  ropa para vender, en estos últimos meses ha tenido pedido y por falta de tela, no ha producido lo que es, es por eso que con el crédito que esta solicitando, comprara telas bordados, botones, Ciper y otros para hacer los vestidos. Como sabanas, manteles, cortinas. Es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic y se siente contenta por que gracia al financiamiento que le ha dado ha logrado poder aumentar sus ventas, como aumentar la clientela por sus trabajos de costura.

loans.use: Comprar tela, bordados, botones, hilos y otros para producir la confeccion de sus vestidos

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia Maria García C. tiene 58 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 29 años que se dedica a este trabajo, Lesbia tiene la facilidad de realizar las compras por medio de los proveedores que llegan a ofrecerles los productos en camiones, ella siempre le ha gustado aprovechar el tiempo y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de productos necesarios para su negocio. el deseo de Lesbia es mejorar las ventas, ya que últimamente ha tenido recaídas muy fuertes y no ha podido recuperarse, pero sus sueños y sus esperanzas son las que siempre mantiene.
texts.en:
Lesbia Maria G. C. is 58 years old and makes a living through her convenience store. For more than 29 years she has been doing this job, and she can easily make purchases from the suppliers that arrive in trucks to offer her products. She has always liked to make the most of her time and satisfy the needs of her clients. She is requesting this financing for the purchase of necessary products for her business. Her desire is to improve her sales, since lately she has had a sharp decline and hasn't been able to recover, but she always maintains her dreams and hopes.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her job.

loans.name: Celsa Arelis

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, especificamente en el Mercado El Bisne, la señora Celsa B. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bebidas tales como jugos, gaseosas, agua entre otros siendo ofrecidas ambulantemente con un termo ofreciéndolas principalmente en las estaciones de buses.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y de esta manera continuar ofertándolas ambulantemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de las bebidas

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen C. D. A. D. 47 años edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Carmen vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad . El esposo D. Carmen es muy responsable en los gastos D. la familia sin embargo el presupuesto aumenta a medida que hijos crecen, es por ello que Carmen ha instalado un negocio para poder generar ingresos que ayudaran a su familia, Carmen  tiene una tienda hace ocho años y por la cual ahora solicita este crédito, para compara productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen C. D. A. is 47 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and two young children. Carmen's husband is very responsible about the family's expenses. However, the budget increases as their children grow older, and therefore Carmen has set up a business in order to be able to generate income to help her family. She has had a store for eight years now, and she is requesting this credit to purchase products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business.

loans.name: María Armandina

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 43 años que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa desde hace ocho años en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, aceite, azúcar), verduras y bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas); este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos económicos estable que posee su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero en las minas del sur del país.

Hace algunos meses, gracias al esfuerzo compartido con su esposo y al apoyo de Edpyme Alternativa, pudo terminar de construir su casa, pero esta actividad hizo que dejara de atender su establecimiento mientras duraba la construcción, por lo que ahora su negocio se encuentra desabastecido, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que planea reabastecer su negocio.

Los productos que más vende son las bebidas, pero ella, pensando en el futuro de sus hijos que aún estudian, planea ampliar su negocio con la venta y promoción de abarrotes. María sueña con ampliar su negocio para atenderlo junto a su esposo y que este deje de hacer viajes al sur del país por largas temporadas así como para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.

Este es el tercer préstamo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa y durante el tiempo que ha venido trabajando con nosotros María ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year old mother who lives with her husband and their four children in the sector Cesar Vallejo, located in the city of Chiclayo. For eight years she has had a small grocery store in her house in which she offers her clients essential products (rice, oil, sugar), vegetables, and drinks (soft drinks and beer). This business is the only stable source of economic income that her family possesses, since her husband works occasionally as a miner in the southern part of the country. A few months ago, thanks to the shared effort of her husband and the support of Edpyme Alternativa, she was able to finish building her house. However, the construction forced her to stop attending to her business, and consequently her business now finds itself unstocked. For this reason she is requesting a credit of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she plans to restock her business. The product of which she sells the most are drinks. However, thinking of the future of her children who are still studying, she plans to expand her business with the sale and promotion of groceries. Maria dreams of expanding her business to attend to it alongside her husband, so that he can stop making trips to the south of the country for long periods of time, and also in order to provide her children the opportunity to study a better career path. This is the third loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa, and during the time she has been working with us, Maria has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client when it comes time to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of essential items and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana N. T. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de ropa cuya propietaria es ella misma ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa a sus clientes tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito debido a que una vez mas requiere invertir en la compra de la ropa para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar sus condiciones de venta y por ende mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora María Argentina A. se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de comida la cuál ella misma elabora con el propósito de obtener los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El motivo por el que solicita el crédito es para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar dichos alimentos y ofrecerlos a los clientes en su propio establecimiento donde a diario le visitan los clientes para comprar los deliciosos productos que ella prepara para la venta.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo la señora Carla P. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de ropa, fajas y carteras en su establecimiento en una zona muy visitada por clientes en el mercado.

Con urgencia ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la ropa, de las fajas y los bolsos para continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad y así mejorar las condiciones de su actividad para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega, Sra. Carla P. attends to her business with great enthusiasm and effort. She sells clothing, belts, and wallets from her establishment. The area where the market is located is frequented by many customers.

Carla is in urgent need of a loan so that she can buy clothing, belts, and purses so that she continue offering products to her customers and improve her business. This will help her maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el joven Milton Antonio M. solicitó un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los granos básicos ya que este es el producto que él ofrece en su establecimiento donde vende arroz, maíz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros.

Se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y también por esforzarse por desarrollar el negocio. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorar las condiciones del negocio.

loans.use: Compra de los granos básicos

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida H. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ofreciéndola en su tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde oferta el producto a su clientela.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta manera continuar mejorando su condición en el negocio y llegar a ser una excelente comerciante de ropa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Brigida H. runs a business selling clothes for women, men and children in a stall in the wholesale market of the city of Managua where she offers her products to her customers. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothing so that she can continue to improve her business and become a great trader of clothing in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Vilma del Socorro Ramírez Narváez tiene 62 años, a esta edad Vilma ha luchado por salir adelante en la vida y ha conocido de diferentes experiencias de su negocio. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo como es la elaboración de de ropa variada, bolsos y mochilas. Ella siempre ha sido cliente de Fundación León 2000, ella es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende ella ya que todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante, por lo que ya que es la única posibilidad que tiene mostrar sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus productos. Su deseo es  mantener este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma del Socorro Ramírez Narváez is 62 years old. At her age, Vilma has struggled to make progress in life and has had many different experiences with her business. She has dedicated herself to the same work for over 20 years, which is the creation of handbags, backpacks and clothing of various types. She has always been a client of the León 2000 Foundation. She is the mother of 10 children, none of whom are financially dependent on her today, since they are all working independently. She distributes her products on foot, since it is the only way she can show them to buyers. The financing she is currently requesting will provide working capital to purchase raw materials for each of her products. Her desire is to continue with this business, since it is her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: La Señora Juana de la Concepción M. tiene 66 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Juana tiene 1 hija a su cargo que asiste a una escuela especial, ya que tiene problemas de aprendizaje y con mucha más razón son sus motivos para salir adelante y aportar los ingresos necesarios para su familia. Ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días ya que tiene que preparar sus refrescos naturales, bolsitas y tiene que traer pan en un panadería que está ubicada cerca de su casa ya que es aquí donde obtiene más favorable el pan. Juana solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas, detergentes, pan entre otros. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Juana de la Concepción M. is 66. She has a mini market. She has been in this business for over four years. Juana has a daughter she cares for. She goes to a special school because she has learning problems. This and many other reasons are her motivation to get ahead and provide her family with the necessary income. She gets up very early every day because she has to prepare her natural soft drinks and bags. She has to fetch the bread in a bakery, which is located close to her house. That is where she gets the best bread. Juana is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, frozen products, sweets, detergent, and bread, among other things. Her wish is to give her daughter better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is already 30 years old and is married to Domingo T.. The couple is blessed with two children who were Anabelle - 10 years old and Kenette-7 years old, both of them are currently studying in the primary level of education in their place. The family simply lives in the village of Gomez San Isidro, Isabela of where, rice is their common produce products. 

Rosita manages a direct selling business of AVON. The business has become her way in helping her husband to earn income for their children education and their common necessities. According to her, she wanted to have added capital so that her business will grow further. In this regard, she is requesting the amount of PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders. She knows this will be of big help in the maintenance and success of her direct selling. 

Rosita further said that, the success of her business is a big benefits to her children that is why, she is determined and tries hard towards her business development.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her personal product sales

loans.name: Carola Lastenia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Carola Lastenia C. F. tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos todos adultos quienes viven en sus propias casas, es de la etnia creole y se dedica desde hace mas de 9 años a la venta ambulante de diferentes productos, entre estos perfumes de hombres y  mujeres, paraguas, sandalias, cremas faciales, productos laminados (cadenas, aretes, anillos) y otros productos en general.

Con este negocio ha podido mantenerse ya que su marido no trabaja por su avanzada edad y con la pensión que obtiene no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar. La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de kiva por un monto de US 600 y fue cancelado en tiempo y forma. Aprovecha este medio para agradecer a los prestamistas que confiaron en ella entregándole el dinero.

Actualmente la señora Carola tiene una gran demanda de productos encargados por lo que requiere un financiamiento para comprar lo siguiente:

10 Unidades de Perfumes de mujer los que le cuestan US 15 cada uno, 8 unidades de perfumes para caballero que le cuestan US10 cada uno, 8 unidades de paraguas cuestan US 3 cada uno, 5 juegos de vestidos de sofá a US 35 cada juego, 2 docenas de  sandalias de mujer a US 84 cada docena, 3 docenas de menticol a US 35 cada docena, 8 unidades de crema alizadora a US 5 cada unidad, 3 docenas de  agua florida a US 20 cada docena y 3 docenas de aretes laminados a US 66 cada docena.
texts.en:
Carola Lastenia C. F. is a 57 year old entrepreneur. She is married and has three adult children who live in their own houses. She is Creole. For over nine years she has been a street vendor selling products like men’s and women’s perfume, umbrellas, sandals, face cream, laminated products (chains, earrings, rings), and other general products. She has been able to support herself with this business. Her husband does not work because of his advanced age, and the pension he gets does not cover the household expenses. This entrepreneur, C., has received a loan from Kiva for the sum of US $600. It was paid back on time and in the manner agreed upon. She takes advantage of this opportunity to thank the lenders who had confidence in her and lent her the money Carola currently has a great demand for ordered products. That is why she needs a loan to buy the following: 10 units of women’s perfume that cost US $15 each, 8 units of men’s perfume that costs US $10 each, 8 units of umbrellas that cost US $3 each, 5 sets of sofa covers at US $35 per set, 2 dozen women’s sandals at US $84 per dozen, 3 dozen Menticol (an antiseptic lotion) at US $35 per dozen, 8 units of straightening cream at US $5 each, 3 dozen of scented water at US $20 per dozen, 3 dozen laminated earrings at US $66 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy women's and men's perfume, umbrellas, sets of sofa covers, women's sandals, antiseptic lotion, straightening cream, scented water, and laminated earrings

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Ana Isabel P. tiene 56 años, hace más de 15 años que se decida a este negocio como es la elaboración de cajetas de cocos, esta actividad económica viene de familia, su Mama quien le enseño como se elaboran estos dulces que son muy ricos y apetecidos por sus clientes. Desde la edad de 15 años Ana sabía pelar cocos la fruta que se utiliza para la elaboración de los dulces, ya que todos los días tenía que levantarse temprano para ayudarle a su Mama algunas veces salía a las calles a vender. Actualmente ella se hace cargo, de este negocio ya que es uno de los trabajos que más le gusta además tiene que salir a las calles y ofrecer sus dulces. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, leña, cocos, leche entre otras cosas. El sueño de Ana es proporciónale mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mirtha Estela

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha Estela J. tiene ya más de seis años de dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada afuera de su casa,  ya que tiene dos hijas que están terminando su carrera profesional, 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le está haciendo falta mercancía de temporada de invierno, y le ofrecen una buena cantidad de mercancía a muy buen precio. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en el negocio y así poder ayudar a sus hijas a terminar sus estudios.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá con la pensión que recibe cada mes.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirtha Estela J. has been selling used clothing outside of her home for more than six years. Her two daughters are completing their professional education.

Mirtha offers high quality products at a good price. She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing for her business because she is lacking winter merchandise. At the moment, she does not have the money because she had to help her daughters finish their studies. Mirtha plans to repay this loan using the earnings from her business. Her household expenses are covered by a pension that she receives each month.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción Rodríguez C. tiene 58 años. Tiene 8 hijos con 8 hijos con su pareja actualmente ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con capital propio por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Lamentablemente con los pocos estudios que Concepción recibió ha logrado establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. Con el crédito comprara la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. Ella desea para un futuro que su negocio se mantenga estable para que sus ingresos proporcionen lo básico.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El joven Pablo Antonio P., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio Buenos Aires, junto sus padres, los planes futuros hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus padres para hacer su casa de habitación, desde hace cinco años se dedica a la agricultura ya que su jefe le alquila un lote de terreno para que la trabaje y pueda realizar sus proyecto, le agradece a Afodenic, por la buena aprobación de su crédito y la confianza que le ha brindado, ya que esta es la única manera para poder comprar los fertilizantes e insumos que necesita su producción ya que la crisis económica del país no se lo permite .

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para  aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: réparer sa voiture

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Elmer Antonio C., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio, San Caralampio, junto a sus padres los cuales le apoyan,  le brindaron un terreno para que lo trabaje y salga hacia delante por si mismo, sus planes son poder establecerlo de plátano y piña, le agradece a Afodenic por su aprobación y la confianza de su crédito ya que con este financiamiento logrará sus planes y con una buena asistencia agrícola podrá obtener una buena producción. Antes de que se dedicara a la agricultura el Joven C. se dedica a la construcción y es sus tiempos libres le apoyaba a sus padre en el campo. Con este crédito comprara abonos y venenos para  aplicar a la producción y poder mejorar el cultivo. Agradece a la institución por hacer las mejoras a sus cultivos, el cual espera vender a buen precio sus futos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette de los Ángeles C. García tiene la edad de 39 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, a pesar de la edad y las enfermedades ella es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, por lo que decide salir a las calles a ofrecer productos como ropa interior y perfumes, Jeanette no posee niveles académicos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar de cualquier forma el trabajo y se gana la vida de una forma humilde pero honrada. Y es por ese motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de estudiar que ella no tuvo.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de la banane plantain

loans.name: Mujeres Las Independientes Group

texts.es: El grupo de Mujeres la independientes S. originario del barrio la independencia  del Municipio de Sancristobal Totonican lugar muy visitado por los turistas nacionales e internacionales por su iglesia catolica como es conocido como llano de la felicidad por su hermosas catarata, dicho grupo viene trabajando mas de ocho años juntas, y el principal problema que afronta el grupo es la falta de capital por lo cual necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales, para la elaboracion de bordados, canastas de plasticos.
texts.en:
The Group of Independent Women (“Grupo de Mujeres Las Independientes”) is from the neighborhood of Independencia, which is in the township of San Cristobal Totonican. This area is visited by many domestic and international tourists from the Catholic Church and is known for its friendly atmosphere and beautiful waterfalls.

The group is has been working together for more than 8 years. Their main challenge has been a lack of capital. They need a loan in order to buy materials for making embroideries and plastic baskets.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for their handicrafts

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar G. L. tiene 37 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ellos estudian y ayudan a Don Oscar. La actividad económica de Oscar es  la venta y elaboración quesillos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Inicio este negocio por su familia, ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron este negocio a Oscar le gusto mucho ya que siempre estaba interactuando con sus clientes. Oscar es un hombre trabajador y le gusta enseñarles a sus hijos como se gana el dinero humildemente fue con el tiempo decide hacerse cargo de manera independiente de este negocio ahora es la fuente principal de sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra materia prima para su negocio. el sueño de Oscar es seguir adelante a pesar de todas las dificultades.
texts.en:
Oscar G. L. is a married 37-year old man. He has 2 children in his care; they are in school and also help him with his business. Oscar is engaged in the business of producing and selling quesillos (a snack made with tortilla, cheese, and other ingredients). He has been selling quesillos for more than 15 years. The business was started by his family; they taught him the business. Oscar enjoys the work very much, since he is always interacting with his customers. Oscar is a hardworking man and enjoys teaching his sons how to earn money humbly. Over time he decided to take charge of this business and now it is the principal source of his income. The loan that he is requesting is for working capital to buy raw materials for his business. Oscar dreams of continuing to move ahead in spite of all of the difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des boissons alcoolisées

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a motorcycle for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of African 'waxcloth' for resale

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: El señor Margarito es padre de familia de una señorita que esta estudiando, el y su hija viven solos por cuestiones de la vida así ha tenido que ser, el se encarga de su casa y de su hija, para brindarle un mejor futuro. El labora como vigilante en una empresa desde hace 2 años. Su hija esta próxima a graduarse y esto es el motivo por el cual esta el señor Margarito V. solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Margarito is the father of a young lady who is a student. He and his daughter live alone. Due to life’s circumstances that is how it had to be. He is responsible for his house and his daughter and wants to offer her a better future. For 2 years, he has worked as a watchman in a business. His daughter is close to graduating, and that is the reason Señor Margarito V. is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payments for the graduation of his daughter

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto R. tiene ya más de veinte cinco años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para el ya que es viudo y sus hijos ya están grandes y tiene su propia familia. 
Solicita un préstamo por que al negocio le está haciendo falta mas materia prima para poder realizar los muebles que le están solicitando, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar del material y así poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo para que sus clientes lo puedan recomendar con otras personas.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de los muebles.
texts.en:
Gilberto Rodríguez has been making furniture from wood for over 25 years. This business is the source of income he has for himself. He is a widower, and his children are grown and have their own families. He is asking for a loan because he needs raw materials for his business to make the furniture people are ordering. At this time he does not have enough money to buy the material in order to be able to deliver the orders to his customers on time. Delivering on time allows the customers to recommend him to other people. He plans to repay the loan with the earnings he gets by selling the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material for his carpintry business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de machine à coudre

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Silvia Elizabeth  y su esposo  Samuel son padres de un pequeñito, ella trabaja para un medico como asistente en una clínica, y su esposo labora para una empresa en el área de operador desde hace 9 años. Ellos son una familia muy trabajadora y unida la cual está solicitando esta crédito para la instalación del techo de lamina de dos cuartos en su vivienda para así tener una mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia Elizabeth and her husband, Samuel, have a small child. She works as an assistant for a doctor in a clinic. Her husband has worked as an operator for a business for nine years. They are a hard-working and united family. They are asking for this loan to install a laminate roof on two rooms in their house. This way they will be more comfortable in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place a laminate roof on two rooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des oignons, des cubes, du piment

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn P. is a 31-year-old woman living in the village of Punta Tagda, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married to Edgardo P., who drives a motorcycle to shuttle passengers around their community and also manages the operations of the two motorized fishing boats they own. Aside from being a business women, she also works as a clerk in their barangay (Village Council), and the salary she earns supplements their family income.The couple has two children who are only 4 and 5 years old. They are the reason Analyn strives so hard in her business ventures – so that she can provide her children with financial security and be able to send them to good schools.

The couple’s eagerness to attain their dream is the driving force behind all their endeavors. It was actually Edgardo who encouraged Analyn to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 so that she could start her own business. Her first venture, after she joined NWTF-PD, was selling fish in her community and the nearby barangays. She immediately saw that it could provide her family with a good income because, even with the small capital she started with, she was able to help her husband pay for some of the household expenses.

Analyn continued with her business activities and expanded by selling capiz shells to a handicraft maker. With a more steady income, she was able to pay her loan installments on time and establish a good credit performance with her group, center and NWTF-PD. Accordingly, she has been able to increase her loan amount at each new loan cycle, enabling her to afford a motorized fishing boat. From the profits of her fishing venture, she bought a motorcycle with a sidecar for her husband to enable him to add to their daily income. Her husband operates it when there's bad weather conditions or when there's trouble with the fishing boat. As their business activities improved, she was able to buy a second motorized fishing boat and hire a helper to operate it. Analyn continues to sell the fish catch in the public market and around their community. This earns her a minimum of 7,000 pesos per month. She has been able to save for her children’s future, pay her debts on time and cover household expenses.

For her 11th loan cycle, she borrowed 29,000 pesos to add to her working capital. When she paid that off, within the loan term and without any delays, she applied for a 12th loan of 29,000 pesos so that she could have revolving working capital for her business ventures: fishing, fish vending and selling capiz shell. She intends to save some of her income for her children.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing business and capiz shell selling

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Hardwork and dedication are the keys to success according to Florentina S., 48 years old, who has continuously improved her living through her own efforts.

She is married to Jose Jerry S. who is presently engaged in fish vending together with his wife. They have 3 children, the oldest of whom is 21 and the youngest of whom is just 9 years old. The family lives in the village of Prk. Balinghoy, Brgy. Malingin Bago City Negros Occidental.

Florentina grew up in a very poor family. Her parents could not afford to send their children to school, but she strived hard to support herself and get a proper education by selling fish with her parents to different barangays (villages).

When she got married, she, together with her husband, continued selling fish in her community, neighboring barangays and nearby towns. Because they sold good quality fish, they soon had regular customers in every place they went, selling all their stocks much faster.

But even with the ongoing business, they were starting to worry that they might not be able to save enough to send their children to college later on. This propelled Florentina to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could expand her business and be able to buy more fish to sell. Now she earns an average profit of PHP 10,000 per month, good enough to support their family with enough left over to save for her children's higher education.

For her previous 9th cycle loan she borrowed Php 15,000 for her business. She was able to repay her loan on time without any delays. She planned to borrow for her 10th cycle loan the same amount of Php 15,000 that she intends to use in her fish vending business. She plans to expand her business. If there is any extra income, she plans to put up a general store and the rest will be saved for children future.

About Kiva's partner NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta D. is from the village of Centro Napu,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 74 years old. Mamerta is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mamerta owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing office space for rent services to local community members. Mamerta has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mamerta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mamerta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the space rented. Mamerta is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mamerta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia V. is from the village of Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Lydia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a mini grocery store which her daily customers are her neighbors. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2006, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora P. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, married with one school-aged child. She is one of micro entrepreneur of PMPC who engaged in barbecue business. Her costumers are her neighbors and passers by. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP a month. 

In February 2006, she joined Paglaum to gain access in financial services and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. At her six cycles, she is now requesting a new loan amounting to 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy more ingredients and more meat needed for her business. She used the profit generated from the business to send her one child to school and finish her college degree.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more meat for her barbecue business

loans.name: Janechit

texts.en: Janechit R. is one of PMPC's micro entrepreneurs who prepares and processes a Filipino food delicacy known as longanisa, a meat processed viand which is usually served for breakfast. She is a resident of Catadman, city of Ozamiz, and married with two school-age children. In this business, she earns an income of 1,600 pesos a month. Last August, 2009, Mrs. R. joined PMPC because she likes their programs and the services PMPC offered to her. Right now, she is applying for her first loan of 5,000 to use as additional capital to purchase more ingredients and meat for her longanisa processing. Her future plan for her family is to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and meat for longanisa processing

loans.name: Elmith

texts.es: La señora Elmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 04 que aun están bajo su cargo.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la Venta de Abarrotes, hace varios años atrás. Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco y con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 comenzó a comprar mas abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.Hoy sus vecinos, amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca diariamente y esa es una de sus ventajas grandes que tiene, para generar sus propios ingresos y de esta manera ser responsable con sus cuotas.Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. is from the village of Poblacion1, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Teresa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling kitchen supplies and products in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Estali

texts.es: La señora Estali, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Estali, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como: Esika, CyZone y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Estali, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Estali is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Cucardas II”, which is located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Deparment of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependents. Estali is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life and her desire to get ahead has led to some success. Today she is satisfied with that she has achieved through her business.

Estali sells different brands of cosmetics such as Esika, CyZone, and Avon. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase beauty products to add to her inventory such as perfumes for women and men, crèmes, pressed powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes. She also plans to buy a display case for exhibiting her products.

Because of her maturity, Estali is an example for other women to follow on how to start a business and persevere in the pursuit of one’s dreams. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & a display case

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from Catadman, city of Ozamiz. She is 49 years old and married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, she operates a buy and sale business. She buys RTW’s like t-shirts, pants, sandals and sells it to her neighbors and friends. She is also a dealer of avon products like perfume, lotion, and beauty products and other cosmetics supply. She has been engage in this business for 5 months and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In June 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living condition and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase more Avon products like perfumes, lotion and beauty products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of the barrower’s family.

loans.use: use to purchase more beauty products and cosmetics supply

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania L., who lives in Hacienda Sarait, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is married to Rey Largavita. She's a hardworking mother who wants to provide financial security for her two sons who, although already 25 and 26, have special needs because of their inborn disabilities. She is now 57 years old and worries how her sons will fend for themselves when she and her husband pass on. This is why Epifania and Rey are working very hard now to set aside some money to provide for their sons' future financial security. 

As ambulant food vendors, they do a lot of walking. On a regular working day, Epifania and Rey wake up at dawn to go to the public market to buy the ingredients for their menu of the day. Epifania prepares and cooks all of the food they plan to sell, then Rey helps her pack the food into single-serve packets and arrange them equally in separate baskets. Once their food baskets are packed, Epifania takes her sons to her a neighbor she trusts to take care of them while they are working. That done, Epifania and Rey take their respective baskets and go on separate selling routes around the town, visiting their regular customers first. By walking, they increase their probability for a sale because people they meet on the street usually stop to buy the packed food they offer. When all the food is sold, they go home to rest and get things ready to do the same routine again the following day.

In July 2001, Epifania joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to borrow additional capital for her food vending business. With the additional capital, she was able to increase the food volume and also expand the variety of food that she and her husband sell. Her cooking has become so popular with other members of NWTF-PD that she now brings food to sell during the weekly center meetings that she attends. With the loans that provide her with much-needed working capital, her business has improved a lot. She earns a net profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos per month on the average, and it has been a great help for her family, especially in allowing her to afford the maintenance medicines that her sons need, as well as pay for all their household expenses.

Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 on her 15th loan cycle was fully paid within term and without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy a gas stove to cook food much faster, and the balance will again be used as revolving working capital to buy the daily ingredients of her products.

Epifania is shown in the attached picture with her food offerings during one of the center meetings in the NWTF-PD Center house.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.
